<script>if (!('randomUUID' in crypto)) {
	crypto.randomUUID = () =>
		([1e7] + -1e3 + -4e3 + -8e3 + -1e11).replace(/[018]/g, (c) =>
			(c ^ (crypto.getRandomValues(new Uint8Array(1))[0] & (15 >> (c / 4)))).toString(16),
		);
}</script>

<script>
	const useMaxDefaultContentWidth = Boolean(false);

	const defaultContentWidth = useMaxDefaultContentWidth ? 'expanded' : 'collapsed';

	let contentWidthPreference;

	try {
		contentWidthPreference = localStorage.getItem('contentwidth') || defaultContentWidth;
	} catch (e) {
		contentWidthPreference = defaultContentWidth;
	}

	if ( contentWidthPreference === 'expanded' ) {
		document.documentElement.classList.add('is-content-expanded');
	}
</script>

			<div class="page-header__title-wrapper">
				<h1 class="page-header__title" id="firstHeading">
					<span class="mw-page-title-main">Kratos</span>				</h1>
																</div>
			<div class="page-header__actions" id="p-views">
				
									<a class="wds-button wds-is-text page-header__action-button" data-tracking-label="comments-button" href="#articleComments">

									<a class="wds-button wds-is-text page-header__action-button has-label" href="/wiki/Kratos?action=edit" id="ca-viewsource" data-tracking-label="ca-viewsource" accesskey="e">
						<svg class="wds-icon wds-icon-small"><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-lock-small"></use></svg>						View source					</a>
				
				
									<div class="wds-dropdown">
						<div role="button" class="wds-dropdown__toggle wds-button wds-is-text page-header__action-button" aria-label="Page Tools" aria-controls="p-cactions" data-tracking-label="dropdown-actions">
							<svg class="wds-icon wds-icon-small"><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-more-small"></use></svg>						</div>
						<div id="p-cactions" class="wds-dropdown__content wds-is-right-aligned wds-is-not-scrollable">
							<ul class="wds-list wds-is-linked">

											History										</a>

					<div id="content" class="page-content ve-init-mw-desktopArticleTarget-targetContainer">
													<script data-name="featured-video-mapped-to-wiki">
	(function () {
		// we can't use mw.config here because it's too early so we need to pass this data in different way
		const videoDetails = {
			mapping: {"mediaId":"K21eFFRc","connatixPlaylistId":"9bdf4208-a923-44b1-8fb3-4e1289c300c9","impressionsPerSession":4},
			impressionsPerSession: 4,
		};
		const videoBridgeCountries = ["AE","AG","AL","AM","AR","AT","AU","AZ","BA","BB","BD","BG","BH","BN","BO","BR","BS","BY","CA","CH","CL","CN","CO","CR","CU","CY","CZ","DE","DK","DO","DZ","EC","EE","EG","ES","FI","FR","GB","GE","GF","GG","GH","GP","GR","GT","GU","GY","HK","HN","HR","HU","ID","IE","IL","IM","IN","IQ","IR","IS","IT","JE","JM","JO","JP","KE","KG","KH","KR","KW","KY","KZ","LA","LB","LK","LT","LU","LV","LY","MA","MD","ME","MK","MM","MN","MO","MQ","MT","MU","MV","MX","MY","NG","NI","NO","NP","NZ","OM","PA","PE","PH","PK","PL","PR","PS","PT","PY","QA","RE","RO","RS","RU","SA","SC","SE","SG","SI","SK","SV","TD","TH","TN","TR","TT","TW","UA","US","UY","UZ","VE","VI","VN","ZA","ZW"];
		const tier3VideoBridgeCountries = ["GB","BE","NL","DE","AU","MX","AR","FR","MD","CA","ES","IT","PE","CO","CL","NZ"];
		let hasVideoOnPage = null;

		function getCookieValue(cookieName) {
			const cookieSplit = ('; ' + document.cookie).split('; ' + cookieName + '=');
			return cookieSplit.length === 2 ? cookieSplit.pop().split(';').shift() : null;
		}

		function hasMaxedOutPlayerImpressionsInWiki() {
			const impressionsSoFar = Number(getCookieValue('playerImpressionsInWiki')) || 0;
			const allowedImpressions = Number(videoDetails.impressionsPerSession);

			return impressionsSoFar >= allowedImpressions;
		}

		function getCountryCode() {
			try {
				return JSON.parse(decodeURIComponent(getCookieValue('Geo'))).country.toLowerCase();
			} catch {
				return null;
			}
		}

		function isVideoBridgeAllowedForCountry() {
			const countryCode = getCountryCode();

			if (!countryCode) {
				return false;
			}

			// If it's a default mapping, then check the country whitelist from the default mapping.
			if (videoDetails?.mapping?.isDefaultMapping) {
				// If the wiki is classified as a tier3 wiki, then check the country whitelist from the tier3VideoBridge whitelist.
				const allowedCountriesForTier3Wikis = tier3VideoBridgeCountries.map(function (allowedTier3CountryCode) {
					return allowedTier3CountryCode.toLowerCase();
				})

				return allowedCountriesForTier3Wikis.indexOf(countryCode) !== -1;
			} else {
				// If not a default mapping wiki (so it's a wiki mapping), then check the country whitelist from the videoBridge whitelist
				const allowedCountries = videoBridgeCountries.map(function (allowedCountryCode) {
					return allowedCountryCode.toLowerCase();
				});

				return allowedCountries.indexOf(countryCode) !== -1;
			}
		}

		window.fandomIsVideoPossible = function () {
			if (hasVideoOnPage === null) {
				hasVideoOnPage =
					videoDetails.mapping &&
					isVideoBridgeAllowedForCountry() &&
					!hasMaxedOutPlayerImpressionsInWiki();
			}

			return hasVideoOnPage;
		};

		window.canPlayVideo = function () {
			return window.fandomIsVideoPossible()
		};

		if (!window.canPlayVideo()) {
			document.body.classList.add('no-featured-video');
		} else {
			document.body.classList.add('has-featured-video');
		}
	})();
</script>
							<div itemprop="video" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/VideoObject">
			<meta itemprop="name" content="Twisted Metal Season 2 Cast Matches Wishes to Video Game Characters">
		<meta itemprop="duration" content="PT01M44S">
		<meta itemprop="description" content="We presented the stars of Twisted Metal Season 2 — Anthony Mackie (“John Doe”), Stephanie Beatriz (“Quiet”), Joe Seanoa (“Sweet Tooth”), Anthony Carrigan (“Calypso”)— and EP Michael Jonathan Smith with a list of wishes and asked them to match to video game characters. ">
		<meta itemprop="thumbnailUrl" content="https://cdn.jwplayer.com/v2/media/e0EfZkdY/poster.jpg?width=720">
		<meta itemprop="contentURL" content="https://cdn.jwplayer.com/videos/e0EfZkdY-cSpmBcaY.mp4">
		<meta itemprop="uploadDate" content="2025-08-06T20:58:12+00:00">
		<div id="featured-video__player-container" class="featured-video-player-container isNotScrollPlayer" data-jw-placement-id="KmMLkvao"><div id="jwPlacementDiv_KmMLkvao" data-jw-placement-id="KmMLkvao" class="isNotScrollPlayer"><div id="jwExperienceDiv_1gzi7kh1c4d6" class="jwplayer jw-reset jw-state-playing jw-stretch-uniform jw-flag-aspect-mode jw-breakpoint-4 jw-floating-dismissible aria-describedby="jw-jwExperienceDiv_1gzi7kh1c4d6-shortcuts-tooltip-explanation"><div class="jw-aspect jw-reset" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"></div><div class="jw-wrapper jw-reset" style="will-change: auto;"><div style="opacity: 0; visibility: hidden; overflow: hidden; display: block; position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div style="overflow: auto; display: block; position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div style="height: 1px; width: 670px;"></div></div><div class="jw-contract-trigger" style="overflow: auto; display: block; <section class="pi-item pi-group pi-border-color">
	<h2 class="pi-item pi-header pi-secondary-font pi-item-spacing pi-secondary-background">Biographical Information</h2>

<div class="pi-item pi-data pi-item-spacing pi-border-color" data-source="title">
	
		<h3 class="pi-data-label pi-secondary-font">Titles</h3>
	
	<div class="pi-data-value pi-font"><div class="scrollable" style="overflow:auto; max-height:230px; width:99%; -moz-border-radius-topleft:0.5em; border:1px solid #AAAAAA; padding-left:0.5em; background:transparent;"><ul><li>God of War</li></ul></div></div>
</div>

<div class="pi-item pi-data pi-item-spacing pi-border-color" data-source="alias">
	
		<h3 class="pi-data-label pi-secondary-font">Alias</h3>
	
	<div class="pi-data-value pi-font"><div class="scrollable" style="overflow:auto; max-height:230px; width:99%; -moz-border-radius-topleft:0.5em; border:1px solid #AAAAAA; padding-left:0.5em; background:transparent;"><ul><li><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a>/Stríðsguð (ᛊᛏᚱᛁᚦᛊᚷᚢᛞ) <small>(in Gróa's shrine)</small></li><li>God of Hope</li><li>Cruel Striker/Fárbauti (ᚠᚨᚱᛒᚨᚢᛏᛁ) <small>(in Loki's shrine and by <a href="/wiki/Ver%C3%B0andi" title="Verðandi">Verðandi</a>)</small></li><li>Ghost of Sparta</li><li>General</li><li>Spartan</li><li>The Marked Warrior</li><li>Foreign God <small>(by the <a href="/wiki/Norse_Gods" title="Norse Gods">Norse Gods</a>)</small></li><li>Exiled God/Útlægr Guð <small>(Soundtrack)</small></li><li>Mortal <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Olympians</a>)</small></li><li>Father <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a> and <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>)</small></li><li>Lord Kratos</li><li>My Kratos <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>)</small></li><li>My Spartan <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>)</small></li><li>Shield-Bearer/ΦΕΡ'ΑΣΠΙ <small>(Soundtrack)</small></li><li>Oathbreaker</li><li>The Champion/Slave of the Gods</li><li>The Killer of the Gods/ God-Killer</li><li>Slayer of <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a></li><li>Death, the Destroyer of Worlds <small>(by the <a href="/wiki/Grave_Digger" title="Grave Digger">Grave Fallen God</li><li>The Ashen God</li><li>The Marked Warrior</li><li>White Warrior <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Icarus" title="Icarus">Icarus</a>)</small></li><li>Killer of <a href="/wiki/Argos" title="Argos">Argos</a></li><li>Murderer of <a href="/wiki/Gaia" title="Gaia">Gaia</a> <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Cronos" title="Cronos">Cronos</a>)</small></li><li>Broken Mortal <small>(by Ares)</small></li><li>Cursed Mortal <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Hermes" title="Hermes">Hermes</a>)</small></li><li>Plague <small>(by Zeus and <a href="/wiki/Odin" <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a>)</small></li><li>Old Man <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Modi" title="Modi">Modi</a>)</small></li><li>Son of a Bitch <small>(by <a title="Mimir">Mimir</a>)</small></li><li>Animal <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a>)</small></li><li>Bearded Beefer <small>(by <a href="/wiki/Brok" <section class="pi-item pi-group pi-border-color pi-collapse pi-collapse-open">
	<h2 class="pi-item pi-header pi-secondary-font pi-item-spacing pi-secondary-background">Equipment</h2>

<div class="pi-item pi-data pi-item-spacing pi-border-color" data-source="weapons">
	
		<h3 class="pi-data-label pi-secondary-font">Weapon</h3>
	
	<div class="pi-data-value pi-font"><div class="scrollable" style="overflow:auto; max-height:230px; width:99%; -moz-border-radius-topleft:0.5em; border:1px solid #AAAAAA; padding-left:0.5em; background:transparent;"><p><b>Greek Era</b></p><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Athena" title="Blades of Athena">Blades of Athena</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Exile" title="Blades of Exile">Blades of Exile</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Artemis" title="Blade of Artemis">Blade of Artemis</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Barbarian_Hammer" title="Barbarian Hammer">Barbarian Hammer</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Claws_of_Hades" title="Claws of Hades">Claws of Hades</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Nemean_Cestus" title="Nemean Cestus">Nemean Cestus</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Nemesis_Whip" title="Nemesis Whip">Nemesis Whip</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Spear_of_Destiny" title="Spear of Destiny">Spear of Destiny</a></li></ul></div><div class="scrollable" style="overflow:auto; <div class="pi-item pi-data pi-item-spacing pi-border-color" data-source="items">
	
		<h3 class="pi-data-label pi-secondary-font">Item</h3>
	
	<div class="pi-data-value pi-font"><div class="scrollable" style="overflow:auto; max-height:230px; width:99%; -moz-border-radius-topleft:0.5em; border:1px solid #AAAAAA; padding-left:0.5em; background:transparent;"><p><b>Greek Period</b></p><ul><li><span class="new" title="Magic Pouch (page does not exist)" data-uncrawlable-url="L3dpa2kvTWFnaWNfUG91Y2g/YWN0aW9uPWVkaXQmcmVkbGluaz0x">Magic Pouch</span> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Poseidon%27s_Trident" title="Poseidon's Trident">Poseidon's Trident</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Amulet_of_the_Fates" title="Amulet of the Fates">Amulet of the Fates</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Golden_Fleece" title="Golden Fleece">Golden Fleece</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Icarus_Wings" title="Icarus Wings">Icarus' Wings</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Sun_Shield" title="Sun Shield">Sun Shield</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Triton%27s_Lance" title="Triton's Lance">Triton's Lance</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Bow_of_Apollo" title="Bow of Apollo">Bow of Apollo</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Head_of_Helios" title="Head of Helios">Head of Helios</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Boots_of_Hermes" title="Boots of Hermes">Boots of Hermes</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li></ul></div><div class="scrollable" style="overflow:auto; max-height:230px; width:99%; -moz-border-radius-topleft:0.5em; border:1px solid #AAAAAA; padding-left:0.5em; background:transparent;"><p><b>Norse Period</b></p><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Stone_Masons_Chisel_Tip" title="Stone Masons Chisel Tip">Stone Masons Chisel Tip</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Witch%27s_Compass" title="Witch's Compass">The Witch's Compass</a> <small>(formerly)</small></li><li><a href="/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st" title="Bifröst">Bifröst Lamp</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Unity_Stone" title="Unity Stone">Unity Stone</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Head of Mimir</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Yggdrasil_Realm_Seeds" title="Yggdrasil Realm Seeds">Yggdrasil Realm Seeds</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Draupnir" title="Draupnir">Draupnir</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Gjallarhorn" title="Gjallarhorn">Gjallarhorn</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Sk%C3%AD%C3%B0bla%C3%B0nir" title="Skíðblaðnir">Skíðblaðnir</a></li></ul></div></div>
</div>

</section>
<section class="pi-item pi-group pi-border-color pi-collapse pi-collapse-open">
	<h2 class="pi-item pi-header pi-secondary-font pi-item-spacing pi-secondary-background" data-source="C">Behind the Scenes</h2>

Carson">Terrence C. </small></aside><p></p><p><small>
</small></p>

<table class="cquote" style="margin:auto;">
<tbody><tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:20px; font-size:36px; font-family:'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight:bold; text-align:left; padding:3px;">“
</td>
<td valign="top" style="padding:3px;"><i>What can I say to you? I remember how it felt to take the throne. All that it meant. And all that it did not. A God of war... a God of pain. Of suffering. Of destruction. The Norns said I chase a redemption that I know I can never deserve. What does that make me? God of fools. A God of... hope. "When all else is lost..." You lost everything. And everyone. And you became... There is no forgiving you. You chose... I chose. What now? Should I, this same man, should I sit? Take? Proclaim? Lead? Place myself in service? In service. Should I... lose everything and everyone... will there still be enough left inside so that I do not become you? I do not know. But I have hope. You are cruel, and arrogant, and selfish. But... you are more than that. You have always been more than what others saw. You are more than that.</i>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" style="width:20px; font-size:36px; font-family:'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight:bold; text-align:right; padding:3px;">”
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="3" style="padding-top:10px;"><p style="font-size:smaller; text-align:right;"><cite style="font-style:normal;">–Kratos confronting his younger self in the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Ragnar%C3%B6k:_Valhalla" title="God of War Ragnarök: Valhalla">Valhalla DLC</a></cite></p><figure class="mw-halign-center" typeof="mw:File"><audio src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8b/Kratos_Speech.mp3/revision/latest?cb=20240214201502" width="150" class="mw-file-element" style="max-width: 100%; width: 150px;" controls=""><a href="https://godofwar.fandom.com/wiki/File:Kratos_Speech.mp3">https://godofwar.fandom.com/wiki/File:Kratos_Speech.mp3</a></audio><figcaption>noicon</figcaption></figure><p class="mw-empty-elt"></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Kratos</b> (Greek: <b>Κράτος</b>), also known as <b>Fárbauti</b> (Nordic: <b>ᚠᚨᚱᛒᚨᚢᛏᛁ</b>), the <b>God of War/Stríðsguð</b> (Nordic: <b>ᛊᛏᚱᛁᚦᛊᚷᚢᛞ</b>) is the main and titular protagonist of the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Series" class="mw-redirect" title="God of War Series"><i>God of War</i> series</a>. He is a <a href="/wiki/Demigod" title="Demigod">demigod</a> son of his father <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> and mother <a href="/wiki/Callisto" title="Callisto">Callisto</a>, as well as a brother of <a href="/wiki/Deimos" title="Deimos">Deimos</a>. Kratos is also the father of <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a> and <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>, and was married to <a href="/wiki/Lysandra" title="Lysandra">Lysandra</a> and <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Laufey</a>.     
</p><p>Once the brutal captain of the <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> army, Kratos led his men through numerous conquests across Greece, eventually facing the <a href="/wiki/Barbarians" title="Barbarians">Barbarians</a>. Overwhelmed and on the verge of death, Kratos struck a deal with <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a> by committing atrocity under his name. Even his own family grew horrified by his actions. Tragically, Ares tricked him into killing his wife and child, branding him the "<b>Ghost of Sparta</b>" with their ashes fused to his skin. Seeking redemption, Kratos served the other <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a> of Olympus for ten years, enduring their labors that deepened his hatred for them. Ultimately, he defeated Ares and claimed the throne of the "<b>God of War</b>", but his fury against the <a href="/wiki/Olympians" title="Olympians">Olympians</a> led to a series of battles that determined Greece's fate.    
</p><p>Eventually leaving Greece as well as his bloody past behind, Kratos ends up in Ancient <a href="/wiki/Ancient_Egypt" title="Ancient Egypt">Egypt</a> and makes his way into <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a>. Having come to view his troubled past with great shame, Kratos has taken the initiative to mature and grow past his self-destructive tendencies, choosing to live as a man under the Norse Pantheon. He even finds love again with a woman named <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Faye</a>, eventually fathering a son with her named <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>. When Faye dies of unknown circumstances, Kratos and Atreus set out on a journey to spread her ashes from the highest peak in all the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a> as it was her final wish. However, the two come into conflict with various Nordic creatures along their way, and are constantly pursued by a mysterious <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Stranger</a> — seemingly under orders from the King of the Norse Pantheon himself, <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a>.
</p><p>As <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a> unfolds, Kratos and Atreus were confronted by Odin and <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>. While embarking on a perilous journey across the Nine realms in a desperate attempt to stop Ragnarök, they join <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a>'s forces, but despite their efforts, it could not be prevented. Uniting allies from across the realms, they waged war against <a href="/wiki/Asgard" title="Asgard">Asgard</a>, with Kratos facing Thor once more and ultimately defeating Odin. As Asgard fell, the trio returned to Midgard, where Atreus (now "<b>Loki</b>") — set out to seek any remaining <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Giants</a>, bidding a heartfelt farewell to his father. Meanwhile, Kratos and Freya, alongside <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mímir</a>, began the monumental task of rebuilding and restoring the Nine realms. While also finally accepting his past while traveling in <a href="/wiki/Valhalla" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a>, he decides to join Freya's council of Gods and reclaim the throne of the "<b>God of War</b>" once again. 
</p>

<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-17"><a href="#Personality_&amp;_Appearance"><span class="tocnumber">2</span> <span class="toctext">Personality &amp; Appearance</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-18"><a href="#Personality"><span class="tocnumber">2.1</span> <span class="toctext">Personality</span></a>

			<h3 class="trfc161__header-text">Quick Answers</h3>
		</div>
		<img class="trfc161-logo" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/8941553e-df6a-4310-a080-b9da56fdcbdd" alt="fandom logo">
	</div>
	<div class="trfc161__groups">
			<details class="trfc161__group dark-theme" data-question-id="11597" data-revision-id="2">
				<summary class="trfc161__question-wrapper">
					<b class="trfc161__question">What is the origin of Kratos' name in Greek mythology?</b>
						<img class="trfc161__question-chevron" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/36002e46-06fe-4633-9d99-27d96cf5bcdc" alt="toggle section">
				</summary>
				<div class="trfc161__answer">
					<div class="quick-answers__answer-text">
						Kratos, a character from the God of War series, derives his name from Greek mythology. The term 'Kratos' signifies 'power' or 'strength', and he embodies physical strength. He is recognized as the son of Pallas and Styx, and has siblings named Nike, Bia, and Zelus, representing victory, force, and glory respectively. Known for his brutal and merciless nature, Kratos advocates for violence and defends Zeus' rule.
					</div>
					<div class="trfc161__answer-source">
						Provided by: Fandom
					</div>
					<div class="quick_answers__report-module-root" data-reportable="1"><div class="quick-answers__report-module"><button class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_button__8ckmk"><div class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_content__mLECx"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 12 12" width="1em" height="1em" class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_flagIcon__a2C2f"><defs><path id="IconFlagTiny__a" d="M3 7h5L6.59 5.707A.957.957 0 016.27 5a.96.96 0 01.32-.707L8 3H3v4zm-1 5a1 1 0 01-1-1V1a1 1 0 112 0h7.03l.003.001h.017a1 1 0 01.942.872v.001c.008.064.01.128.006.191v.002a.997.997 0 01-.283.631v.001l-.002.002-.001.001-.001.001-.002.002-.002.002L8.414 5l2.293 2.293.003.003.001.001.001.001.001.001.002.002v.001a.997.997 0 01.283.631v.002a1.02 1.02 0 01-.006.191v.001a.996.996 0 01-.315.609 1 1 0 01-.627.263h-.017L10.03 9H3v2a1 1 0 01-1 1z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconFlagTiny__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg>REPORT ISSUE</div></button></div></div>
				</div>
			</details>
			<details class="trfc161__group dark-theme" data-question-id="11598" data-revision-id="2">
				<summary class="trfc161__question-wrapper">
					<b class="trfc161__question">Who are the parents of Kratos in the God of War series?</b>
						<img class="trfc161__question-chevron" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/36002e46-06fe-4633-9d99-27d96cf5bcdc" alt="toggle section">
				</summary>
				<div class="trfc161__answer">
					<div class="quick-answers__answer-text">
						Kratos, the protagonist of the God of War series, is the son of Zeus and Callisto. His quests lead him to reluctantly kill his mother in 'God of War: Ghost of Sparta' and his father in 'God of War III'.
					</div>
					<div class="trfc161__answer-source">
						Provided by: Fandom
					</div>
					<div class="quick_answers__report-module-root" data-reportable="1"><div class="quick-answers__report-module"><button class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_button__8ckmk"><div class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_content__mLECx"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 12 12" width="1em" height="1em" class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_flagIcon__a2C2f"><defs><path id="IconFlagTiny__a" d="M3 7h5L6.59 5.707A.957.957 0 016.27 5a.96.96 0 01.32-.707L8 3H3v4zm-1 5a1 1 0 01-1-1V1a1 1 0 112 0h7.03l.003.001h.017a1 1 0 01.942.872v.001c.008.064.01.128.006.191v.002a.997.997 0 01-.283.631v.001l-.002.002-.001.001-.001.001-.002.002-.002.002L8.414 5l2.293 2.293.003.003.001.001.001.001.001.001.002.002v.001a.997.997 0 01.283.631v.002a1.02 1.02 0 01-.006.191v.001a.996.996 0 01-.315.609 1 1 0 01-.627.263h-.017L10.03 9H3v2a1 1 0 01-1 1z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconFlagTiny__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg>REPORT ISSUE</div></button></div></div>
				</div>
			</details>
			<details class="trfc161__group dark-theme" data-question-id="11599" data-revision-id="2">
				<summary class="trfc161__question-wrapper">
					<b class="trfc161__question">How did Kratos become the God of War?</b>
						<img class="trfc161__question-chevron" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/36002e46-06fe-4633-9d99-27d96cf5bcdc" alt="toggle section">
				</summary>
				<div class="trfc161__answer">
					<div class="quick-answers__answer-text">
						In a desperate moment, Kratos pledged allegiance to Ares, the then God of War, to vanquish his enemies. Ares accepted, marking Kratos with the Blades of Chaos and promoting him to a general. After Zeus betrayed and stripped him of his godly status, Kratos resurrected, regained his powers, and retaliated against Zeus and the Olympians, leaving him as the sole Greek God of War.
					</div>
					<div class="trfc161__answer-source">
						Provided by: Fandom
					</div>
					<div class="quick_answers__report-module-root" data-reportable="1"><div class="quick-answers__report-module"><button class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_button__8ckmk"><div class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_content__mLECx"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 12 12" width="1em" height="1em" class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_flagIcon__a2C2f"><defs><path id="IconFlagTiny__a" d="M3 7h5L6.59 5.707A.957.957 0 016.27 5a.96.96 0 01.32-.707L8 3H3v4zm-1 5a1 1 0 01-1-1V1a1 1 0 112 0h7.03l.003.001h.017a1 1 0 01.942.872v.001c.008.064.01.128.006.191v.002a.997.997 0 01-.283.631v.001l-.002.002-.001.001-.001.001-.002.002-.002.002L8.414 5l2.293 2.293.003.003.001.001.001.001.001.001.002.002v.001a.997.997 0 01.283.631v.002a1.02 1.02 0 01-.006.191v.001a.996.996 0 01-.315.609 1 1 0 01-.627.263h-.017L10.03 9H3v2a1 1 0 01-1 1z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconFlagTiny__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg>REPORT ISSUE</div></button></div></div>
				</div>
			</details>
			<details class="trfc161__group dark-theme" data-question-id="11600" data-revision-id="2">
				<summary class="trfc161__question-wrapper">
					<b class="trfc161__question">What is the significance of Kratos' Nordic name, Fárbauti?</b>
						<img class="trfc161__question-chevron" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/36002e46-06fe-4633-9d99-27d96cf5bcdc" alt="toggle section">
				</summary>
				<div class="trfc161__answer">
					<div class="quick-answers__answer-text">
						In the God of War series, Kratos is referred to as Fárbauti by the Jötnar. This Nordic name translates to 'cruel striker' or 'lightning'. The name Fárbauti is significant as it is associated with the Jötunn husband of Laufey and the father of Loki in Norse mythology, suggesting a connection between Kratos and these mythological figures.
					</div>
					<div class="trfc161__answer-source">
						Provided by: Fandom
					</div>
					<div class="quick_answers__report-module-root" data-reportable="1"><div class="quick-answers__report-module"><button class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_button__8ckmk"><div class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_content__mLECx"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 12 12" width="1em" height="1em" class="QuickAnswersReportButton-module_flagIcon__a2C2f"><defs><path id="IconFlagTiny__a" d="M3 7h5L6.59 5.707A.957.957 0 016.27 5a.96.96 0 01.32-.707L8 3H3v4zm-1 5a1 1 0 01-1-1V1a1 1 0 112 0h7.03l.003.001h.017a1 1 0 01.942.872v.001c.008.064.01.128.006.191v.002a.997.997 0 01-.283.631v.001l-.002.002-.001.001-.001.001-.002.002-.002.002L8.414 5l2.293 2.293.003.003.001.001.001.001.001.001.002.002v.001a.997.997 0 01.283.631v.002a1.02 1.02 0 01-.006.191v.001a.996.996 0 01-.315.609 1 1 0 01-.627.263h-.017L10.03 9H3v2a1 1 0 01-1 1z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconFlagTiny__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg>REPORT ISSUE</div></button></div></div>
				</div>
			</details>
			<details class="trfc161__group dark-theme" data-question-id="11601" data-revision-id="2">
				<summary class="trfc161__question-wrapper">
					<b class="trfc161__question">What is the height of Kratos in the God of War series?</b>
						<img class="trfc161__question-chevron" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/36002e46-06fe-4633-9d99-27d96cf5bcdc" alt="toggle section">
				</summary>
				<div class="trfc161__answer">
					<div class="quick-answers__answer-text">
						The height of Kratos, the central character of the God of War series, differs across the games. He stands roughly 8 feet tall in the Greek saga, but this was reduced to about 6 feet 6 inches in the Norse saga for a more realistic look. In God of War III, his height was reported as 7 feet 8 inches, but was later adjusted to 6 feet 4 inches in the Norse Era Games.
					</div>
					<div class="trfc161__answer-source">
						Provided by: Fandom
					</div>

<script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"FAQPage","name":"Kratos","mainEntity":[{"@type":"Question","name":"What is the origin of Kratos' name in Greek mythology?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Kratos, a character from the God of War series, derives his name from Greek mythology. The term 'Kratos' signifies 'power' or 'strength', and he embodies physical strength. He is recognized as the son of Pallas and Styx, and has siblings named Nike, Bia, and Zelus, representing victory, force, and glory respectively. Known for his brutal and merciless nature, Kratos advocates for violence and defends Zeus' rule."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"Who are the parents of Kratos in the God of War series?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"Kratos, the protagonist of the God of War series, is the son of Zeus and Callisto. His quests lead him to reluctantly kill his mother in 'God of War: Ghost of Sparta' and his father in 'God of War III'."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"How did Kratos become the God of War?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"In a desperate moment, Kratos pledged allegiance to Ares, the then God of War, to vanquish his enemies. Ares accepted, marking Kratos with the Blades of Chaos and promoting him to a general. After Zeus betrayed and stripped him of his godly status, Kratos resurrected, regained his powers, and retaliated against Zeus and the Olympians, leaving him as the sole Greek God of War."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What is the significance of Kratos' Nordic name, F\u00e1rbauti?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"In the God of War series, Kratos is referred to as F\u00e1rbauti by the J\u00f6tnar. This Nordic name translates to 'cruel striker' or 'lightning'. The name F\u00e1rbauti is significant as it is associated with the J\u00f6tunn husband of Laufey and the father of Loki in Norse mythology, suggesting a connection between Kratos and these mythological figures."}},{"@type":"Question","name":"What is the height of Kratos in the God of War series?","acceptedAnswer":{"@type":"Answer","text":"The height of Kratos, the central character of the God of War series, differs across the games. He stands roughly 8 feet tall in the Greek saga, but this was reduced to about 6 feet 6 inches in the Norse saga for a more realistic look. In God of War III, his height was reported as 7 feet 8 inches, but was later adjusted to 6 feet 4 inches in the Norse Era Games."}}]}</script>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Biography">Biography</span></h2>
<p>See also: <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Ascension" title="God of War: Ascension">God of War: Ascension</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Chains_of_Olympus" title="God of War: Chains of Olympus">God of War: Chains of Olympus</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War" class="mw-redirect" title="God of War">God of War (2005)</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(DC/Wildstorm_comic_series)" title="God of War (DC/Wildstorm comic series)">God of War (DC Wildstorm Comics)</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Ghost_of_Sparta" title="God of War: Ghost of Sparta">God of War: Ghost of Sparta</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Betrayal" title="God of War: Betrayal">God of War: Betrayal</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_II" title="God of War II">God of War II</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_III" title="God of War III">God of War III</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Fallen_God" title="God of War: Fallen God">God of War: Fallen God</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Lore_and_Legends" title="God of War: Lore and Legends">God of War: Lore and Legends</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(Dark_Horse_Comics)" title="God of War (Dark Horse Comics)">God of War (Dark Horse Comics)</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(2018)" title="God of War (2018)">God of War (2018)</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="God of War Ragnarök">God of War Ragnarök</a></b></i>, <i><b><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Ragnar%C3%B6k:_Valhalla" title="God of War Ragnarök: Valhalla">God of War Ragnarök: Valhalla</a></b></i> 
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_1" style=""></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Before_the_God_of_War_series">Before the God of War series</span></h3>
<p><b>Part I: Kratos' Youth</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_1.1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502092750" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="BeforeGOW 1.1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="80" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 1.1.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_1.1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_1.1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502092750"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_1.1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502092750" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 1.1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_1.1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502092750" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="80" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 1.1.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_1.1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_1.1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502092750"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Born in the <a href="/wiki/Greek" class="mw-redirect" title="Greek">Greek</a> city-state of <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>, Kratos is the <a href="/wiki/Demigod" title="Demigod">demigod</a> son of the King of the <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Gods</a>, <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a>, and to a <a href="/wiki/Greek_Mortals" title="Greek Mortals">mortal woman</a> named <a href="/wiki/Callisto" title="Callisto">Callisto</a>. Because of this, he has incredible intelligence, superhuman strength, and immense physical prowess. However, he is left unaware of who his father was for most of his life. Outraged at Zeus for fathering yet another bastard child, <a href="/wiki/Hera" title="Hera">Hera</a> ordered Kratos' execution on the day he was born. 
</p><p>But as for the King of the Gods, he took pity on the child and refused, leaving Kratos in Sparta to be raised by Callisto. Like all Spartan younglings, Kratos, with an incredible set of superhuman godly powers, (unknown that he is Zeus' son and the one whom he inherited the abilities), was monitored and trained for combat by the Spartan authorities; those who were deemed fit were to stay and be trained as <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> warriors. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0c/BeforeGOW_2.3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502094944" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="BeforeGOW 2.3" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 2.3.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_2.3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0c/BeforeGOW_2.3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502094944"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0c/BeforeGOW_2.3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502094944" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 2.3" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0c/BeforeGOW_2.3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502094944" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 2.3.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_2.3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0c/BeforeGOW_2.3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502094944"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>However, those who were deemed unfit would be sent to the mountains (possibly <a href="/wiki/Mount_Taygetos" title="Mount Taygetos">Mount Taygetos</a>) to fend for themselves. Already feisty and aggressive at a young age, Kratos trained together with his younger brother, <a href="/wiki/Deimos_(Demigod)" class="mw-redirect" title="Deimos (Demigod)">Deimos</a>, who was also a demigod, as they dreamed of joining the Spartan Army when they grew up. Around this time, Zeus began to hear prophecies foretelling his demise at the hands of one of his sons, a mortal known as the "marked warrior".  
</p><p>Hoping to circumvent the <a href="/wiki/The_Cycle_of_Patricide" title="The Cycle of Patricide">cycle of patricide</a> before it was too late, Zeus sent <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a> and <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a> to hunt down the “marked warrior”, wanting to dispose of the boy who would one day rise up against him. Ares, noticing Deimos' strange birthmarks, decided to invade Sparta with an army of <a href="/wiki/Centaur" title="Centaur">centaurs</a> and take him to <a href="/wiki/Thanatos" title="Thanatos">Thanatos</a>, the God of Death. Kratos tried to save his brother, but Ares struck him and knocked him into a pile of wood, leaving him with a permanent scar over his right eye.  
</p><p>Insulted by the mortal's defiance, Ares prepared to kill the young Spartan but was stopped by Athena. The Goddess reminded Ares that they had what they were looking for, and apologized to Kratos before disappearing in a burst of flames. The loss of his brother left an indelible mark on Kratos, as he vowed to never falter again. With full honour to his brother, Kratos had himself tattooed in the exact image of Deimos' birthmark. Kratos would later forget that it was Ares and Athena who took his brother from him and wouldn't realize it until after Ares' death. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/BeforeGOW_%28bonus13%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620092224" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="BeforeGOW (bonus13)" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="84" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW (bonus13).jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_%28bonus13%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/BeforeGOW_%28bonus13%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620092224"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/BeforeGOW_%28bonus13%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620092224" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW (bonus13)" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/BeforeGOW_%28bonus13%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620092224" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="84" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW (bonus13).jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_%28bonus13%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/BeforeGOW_%28bonus13%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620092224"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><b>Part II: Marriage and Fatherhood</b> 
</p><p>As Kratos came of age, he became a respected member of the Spartan army, eventually marrying <a href="/wiki/Lysandra" title="Lysandra">Lysandra</a> and siring a daughter named <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a>. However, shortly after her birth, she fell ill, causing the Spartan authorities to deem her weak. Spartan law required that she be thrown into a chasm and left to die.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/53/BeforeGOW_3.4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502095854" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 3.4" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="50" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 3.4.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_3.4.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/53/BeforeGOW_3.4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502095854"></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/53/BeforeGOW_3.4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502095854" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 3.4" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/53/BeforeGOW_3.4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502095854" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="50" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 3.4.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_3.4.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/53/BeforeGOW_3.4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502095854"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Determined to save his daughter, Kratos set out on a journey for the <a href="/wiki/Ambrosia" title="Ambrosia">Ambrosia</a> after hearing from an elder of its exceptional healing capabilities. But unbeknownst to Kratos, Ares had chosen him to be his champion in the wager of the Gods; a contest with the ultimate goal to capture the Ambrosia and the wager's victor would have statues erected in their honor all throughout Greece. A battalion of Spartans accompanied Kratos on his quest, including <a href="/wiki/Captain_Nikos" title="Captain Nikos">Captain Nikos</a>. 
</p><p><b>Part III: Quest for Ambrosia and Atreus of Sparta</b>
</p><p>Along the way, he encountered a healer who gave him the <a href="/wiki/Flames_of_Apollo" class="mw-redirect" title="Flames of Apollo">Flames of Apollo</a>. Kratos eventually encountered Poseidon's champion, <a href="/wiki/Herodius" title="Herodius">Herodius</a>, and killed him as the Spartans conquered his army and stole their ship. Enraged at Kratos for costing him the wager, Poseidon unleashed a handful of hazards at sea in the hopes of killing him but failed.    
</p><p>Later on, Kratos encountered Artemis' champion, <a href="/wiki/Pothia" title="Pothia">Pothia</a>, and killed her as well, with her army also falling victim to the Spartans, although Artemis did not retaliate. In fear that Kratos would defeat his champion, <a href="/wiki/Alrik" title="Alrik">Alrik</a>, the Barbarian King, Hades sent a torrent of fire through the sky. Although he failed to kill Kratos, he succeeded in killing many of Kratos' men, including Captain Nikos.    
</p><p>As he found the Ambrosia, Kratos encountered <a href="/wiki/Cereyon" title="Cereyon">Cereyon</a>, Helios' champion, and killed him as well. Alrik and his Barbarian Army battled the Spartans for the Ambrosia, as <a href="/wiki/Alrik%27s_Father" title="Alrik's Father">Alrik's Father</a> was very ill and in need of the elixir. After a grueling battle between the two leaders, Kratos successfully captured the Ambrosia at the cost of his own men and summoned an army of <a href="/wiki/Rocs" title="Rocs">Rocs</a> to continuously torture Alrik.   
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a1/BeforeGOW_4.1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502100239" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 4.1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="55" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 4.1.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_4.1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a1/BeforeGOW_4.1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502100239"></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a1/BeforeGOW_4.1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502100239" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 4.1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a1/BeforeGOW_4.1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502100239" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="55" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 4.1.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_4.1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a1/BeforeGOW_4.1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502100239"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos then returned to Sparta and healed Calliope, obtaining the rank of 'Captain' from the <a href="/wiki/King_of_Sparta" title="King of Sparta">King of Sparta</a>. At some point after becoming captain, Kratos would command a young soldier named <a href="/wiki/Atreus_of_Sparta" title="Atreus of Sparta">Atreus</a> who remained hopeful even in the darkest times. When the day came for Atreus to lay down his life in battle, he did it without hesitation and saved many others, earning Kratos' respect so much that the captain carried Atreus home and personally buried him with full honours of Spartan custom, acknowledging him as the only Spartan who ever had a smile on his face even in battle.   
</p><p><b>Part IV: Vow to Ares, the God of War</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/BeforeGOW_%28bonus18%29..jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620094002" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="BeforeGOW (bonus18)." src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="84" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW (bonus18)..jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_%28bonus18%29..jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/BeforeGOW_%28bonus18%29..jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620094002"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/BeforeGOW_%28bonus18%29..jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620094002" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW (bonus18)." src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/BeforeGOW_%28bonus18%29..jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620094002" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="84" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW (bonus18)..jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_%28bonus18%29..jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/BeforeGOW_%28bonus18%29..jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620094002"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Years later, Kratos became a Spartan general, winning many battles against other armies with brutal but effective tactics. However, his pride and hunger for power grew greater with every victory. Despite Lysandra's pleas, Kratos vowed to continue his bloody conquests "until the glory of Sparta [was] known throughout the world", spending time with his family only when he was able to return to Sparta.   
</p><p>Kratos and his Spartan army finally met their match when they encountered the merciless <a href="/wiki/Barbarians" title="Barbarians">Barbarian</a> tribes from the east that numbered in the thousands, led by Kratos' old enemy, Alrik. Outnumbered and overpowered, the Spartans quickly found themselves on the losing end of the battle.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b4/BeforeGOW_5.5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502102622" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="BeforeGOW 5.5" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 5.5.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_5.5.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b4/BeforeGOW_5.5.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502102622"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b4/BeforeGOW_5.5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502102622" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 5.5" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b4/BeforeGOW_5.5.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502102622" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 5.5.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_5.5.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b4/BeforeGOW_5.5.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502102622"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>With Kratos himself left at the mercy of Alrik - the <a href="/wiki/Alrik" title="Alrik">Barbarian King</a>, seeking revenge against Kratos for inadvertently causing the death of his father. In an act of desperation to save his life and refusing to accept defeat, Kratos called out to <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a>, the God of War, pledging his allegiance in exchange for victory. Ares accepted the offer, proceeding to kill all of the Barbarians, and giving Kratos the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a> as a sign of his servitude, permanently bound to him by searing the chains onto his arms. Immediately after receiving them, he used the Blades against Alrik and decapitated him in single combat, ending the battle in Sparta's victory.  
</p><p><b>Part V: The Ghost of Sparta is born</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f8/BeforeGOW_6.3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502103012" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="BeforeGOW 6.3" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 6.3.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_6.3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f8/BeforeGOW_6.3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502103012"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f8/BeforeGOW_6.3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502103012" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 6.3" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f8/BeforeGOW_6.3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502103012" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 6.3.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_6.3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f8/BeforeGOW_6.3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502103012"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>For a time, Kratos served Ares loyally, raiding villages, slaughtering innocents, and spreading chaos in his name. Under the God of War's influence, Kratos became utterly ruthless and gradually lost any semblance of the humanity he once had. One day, during a raid on a village of Athena's followers, Ares secretly transported Lysandra and Calliope to the village’s temple.   
</p><p>Ignoring the <a href="/wiki/Village_Oracle" title="Village Oracle">village oracle</a>'s warnings, Kratos entered the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Athena" title="Temple of Athena">Temple of Athena</a>. He slaughtered everybody inside in a fit of blind rage, including his wife and child (whom he believed were still in Sparta). Ares justified this as a means of severing Kratos' remaining attachments to the world, thereby molding him into the perfect warrior. Stricken with horror and grief at what he had done, Kratos left the bodies of his family to be burned within the temple, ultimately renouncing his allegiance to the God of War. The Oracle cursed Kratos, forcing him to forever wear the ashes of his dead family on his skin.   
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_6.6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502103340" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="BeforeGOW 6.6" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 6.6.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_6.6.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_6.6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502103340"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_6.6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502103340" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="BeforeGOW 6.6" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_6.6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502103340" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="BeforeGOW 6.6.jpg" data-image-key="BeforeGOW_6.6.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/BeforeGOW_6.6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240502103340"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>From that day onwards, Kratos became known as the 'Ghost of Sparta<i>',</i> his skin now 'pale as the moon' from the ashes that coated him. To other mortals, he was now marked by his ghostly white skin - the knowledge of his past actions often repulsed them to the point where they would rather die than allow him to save their lives. He became known as the personification of cruelty and selfishness. Word of this metamorphosis would spread even outside of Greece as <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Norse God</a> and advisor to <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a>, who would become a future ally to Kratos himself, would later on instantly recognize who Kratos was.
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_2"></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War:_Ascension">God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Ascension" title="God of War: Ascension">Ascension</a></span></h3>

<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a2/GOW_Ascension_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230501135242" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block;
