bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a2/GOW_Ascension_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230501135242" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GOW Ascension Poster 6" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a2/GOW_Ascension_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230501135242" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GOW Ascension Poster 6.jpg" data-image-key="GOW_Ascension_Poster_6.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a2/GOW_Ascension_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230501135242"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><b>Part I</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/Kratos_Ascension_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612131638" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 1.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/Kratos_Ascension_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612131638"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/Kratos_Ascension_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612131638" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/Kratos_Ascension_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612131638" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 1.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/Kratos_Ascension_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612131638"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Realizing that he had been blinded by anger and manipulated by <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a>, the God of War, to kill his wife and child, Kratos decides to seek revenge, breaking his oath to Ares to stay submissive and be a loyal servant. Angry with Kratos' decision, Ares orders the <a href="/wiki/The_Furies" title="The Furies">Furies</a> to hunt him down so that he could once again be forced to serve him. Meanwhile, Kratos looked for a way to break his blood oath with Ares. But when entering the abandoned <a href="/wiki/The_Village_of_Kirra" title="The Village of Kirra">Kirra Village</a>, he suddenly finds himself in his house which should be located in the city of <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>. However, he was immediately awakened by <a href="/wiki/Orkos" title="Orkos">Orkos</a>, who tells him that all of this was just an illusion to weaken his mind. 
</p><p>Using Lysandra's necklace and ring, Orkos managed to get Kratos out of the illusion and instructed him to look for the Oracle in Delphi. While Kratos didn't believe Orkos' words, he still followed his direction to go look for the Oracle named <a href="/wiki/Aletheia" title="Aletheia">Aletheia</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Delphi" title="Delphi">Delphi Mountains</a> where, upon his arrival, he maneuvered around using the giant snake <a href="/wiki/Python" title="Python">Python</a> until he was able to reach the Oracle’s temple, where Aletheia was being held by <a href="/wiki/Castor_and_Pollux" title="Castor and Pollux">Castor and Pollux</a>, a pair of twins who were worshiped as Gods. This was because they were considered to have helped shipwrecked sailors and brought favourable winds to other sailors.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/23/Kratos_Ascension_3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612131856" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 3" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 3.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/23/Kratos_Ascension_3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612131856"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/23/Kratos_Ascension_3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612131856" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 3" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/23/Kratos_Ascension_3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612131856" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 3.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/23/Kratos_Ascension_3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612131856"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Castor asked Kratos to bring a proper offering for him if he wanted to meet Aletheia, and when Kratos refused, he became furious and immediately attacked, giving Kratos no other choice but to kill Castor and Pollux. They fought until the whole room shook and collapsed, before then retrieving the <a href="/wiki/Amulet_of_Uroborus" title="Amulet of Uroborus">Amulet of</a> <a href="/wiki/Amulet_of_Uroborus" title="Amulet of Uroborus">Uroborus</a>, an amulet that can be used to manipulate time in various ways. Kratos used it to restore the wreckage and reach Aletheia, who unfortunately was found dying after being crushed by the rubble. Both of her eyeballs were gone, and the Amulet of Uroborus couldn't be used to heal Aletheia's wounds. 
</p><p><b>Part II</b>
</p><p>Before she took her last breath, Aletheia, who already knew the purpose of Kratos' arrival, revealed Ares' evil plan to shape Kratos into a warrior capable of overthrowing <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a>, because then, Ares could become the new King of Olympus. Aletheia also told him that Orkos' intentions were pure, so Kratos could trust him. Finally, she said that the only way to break the blood oath between Kratos and Ares is to kill his oath-keeper. Hearing this, Kratos knew that the oath-keeper in question is the Furies, which according to Aletheia, the three sisters can only be conquered using the <a href="/wiki/Eyes_of_Truth" title="Eyes of Truth">Eyes of Truth</a> which were located on the island of Delos.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c5/Kratos_Ascension_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612132136" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 6" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 6.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_6.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c5/Kratos_Ascension_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132136"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c5/Kratos_Ascension_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612132136" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 6" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c5/Kratos_Ascension_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132136" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 6.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_6.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c5/Kratos_Ascension_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132136"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Armed with the insight he got from Aletheia, Kratos traveled a long way to <a href="/wiki/Delos_Landing" title="Delos Landing">Delos Island</a> to look for the Eyes of Truth. But at Kirra Port, he once again meets Orkos who reveals that he is the son of Ares and <a href="/wiki/Alecto" title="Alecto">Alecto</a>, the Queen of the Furies. Orkos then explained Ares' evil plan to Kratos and the Eyes of Truth that Kratos is currently looking for are Aletheia's eyes. Afterwards, Kratos boarded a ship to Delos Island. Arriving on the island of Delos, Kratos explores the remains of the ruins of <a href="/wiki/Statue_of_Apollo" title="Statue of Apollo">Apollo's Statue</a> and encounters many enemies that get in his way, before he is once again tricked by the illusion of the Furies, teleporting him to the city of Sparta. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f4/Kratos_Ascension_8.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612132343" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 8" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 8.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_8.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f4/Kratos_Ascension_8.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132343"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f4/Kratos_Ascension_8.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612132343" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 8" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f4/Kratos_Ascension_8.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132343" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 8.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_8.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f4/Kratos_Ascension_8.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132343"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>But this time, Kratos isn't fooled, and immediately faced the three sisters. Although the Furies attack him simultaneously, Kratos manages to cut off Megarea's arm, but Tisiphone comes attacking with her pet bird, <a href="/wiki/Daimon" title="Daimon">Daimon</a>. Unfortunately, when Kratos almost managed to kill Tisiphone, Alecto, in the form of a giant sea monster that sunk <a href="/wiki/The_Lantern_of_Delos" title="The Lantern of Delos">Apollo's Lantern</a> which contained the Eyes of Truth, then returned to her human form and ensnared Kratos. Alecto asks Kratos to return to the side of Ares with the lure of being appointed as a God, but Kratos adamantly refused. 
</p><p><b>Part III</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/99/Kratos_Ascension_9.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612132441" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 9" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 9.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_9.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/99/Kratos_Ascension_9.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132441"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/99/Kratos_Ascension_9.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612132441" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 9" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/99/Kratos_Ascension_9.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132441" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 9.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_9.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/99/Kratos_Ascension_9.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612132441"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Hearing this refusal, Tisiphone and Megaera regrouped with Alecto and prepare to capture Kratos, but before they could do so, Orkos appeared and saved Kratos by taking him away to a different part of Apollo's Statue. Orkos then equips Kratos with the <a href="/wiki/Oath_Stone_of_Orkos" title="Oath Stone of Orkos">Oath Stone</a>, a stone that has the power to create clones of the user. After a difficult, obstacle-filled journey, Kratos manages to repair the damage to the Statue of Apollo by using the Amulet of Uroborus, including the part of Apollo's Lantern which was previously sunken by Alecto, where the Eyes of Truth is hidden. 
</p><p>He then directed the eye's beam of light towards Apollo's Lantern and went there to get the Eyes of Truth. After successfully completing the <a href="/wiki/Trials_of_Archimedes" title="Trials of Archimedes">Trials of Archimedes</a>, where Kratos was made to slay a hoard of monsters, the Furies once again ambushed and snatched the Eyes of Truth from him. Orkos had been subdued by the Furies and Kratos was captured. For two weeks, Kratos was detained and tortured endlessly by the Furies inside the <a href="/wiki/Prison_of_the_Damned" title="Prison of the Damned">Prison of the Damned</a>, where during that time, they always tried to persuade Kratos to return to being Ares' loyal servant. But Kratos' answer remained the same, swearing to never again serve the God of War. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Kratos_Ascension_18.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612133703" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 18" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 18.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_18.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Kratos_Ascension_18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612133703"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Kratos_Ascension_18.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612133703" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 18" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Kratos_Ascension_18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612133703" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 18.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_18.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Kratos_Ascension_18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612133703"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>One day, when Megaera came to torture him, Kratos managed to break free of his bindings and began pursuing Megaera relentlessly. In the midst of this chase, Kratos once again falls victim to an illusion where three women attempt to seduce him in a brothel. But the ring on one of the women's hands made Kratos realize that it was just another illusion and he immediately attacked Megaera. However, she managed to infect one of the limbs of the Titan <a href="/wiki/Aegaeon" title="Aegaeon">Aegaeon</a> with her insects. While it was a difficult fight, Kratos ultimately managed to conquer Aegaeon and then killed Megaera.  
</p><p><b>Part IV</b>
</p><p>With Megaera dead, Kratos retrieves the Amulet of Uroborus that was previously taken from him. He then continued his search for the two remaining Furies, Tisiphone and Alecto, during which Kratos fell victim to more illusions of the Furies. The first illusion places Kratos in a scenario where the <a href="/wiki/King_of_Sparta" title="King of Sparta">King of Sparta</a> wants to pay homage to him, and the second illusion places Kratos in his home, where he is reunited with his wife and child, Lysandra and Calliope. Even though the second illusion managed to trick him, Kratos immediately realized it was fake after seeing the ring that belonged to Lysandra.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5a/Kratos_Ascension_16.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612133506" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 16" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 16.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_16.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5a/Kratos_Ascension_16.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612133506"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5a/Kratos_Ascension_16.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240612133506" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Ascension 16" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5a/Kratos_Ascension_16.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612133506" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Ascension 16.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_Ascension_16.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5a/Kratos_Ascension_16.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240612133506"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Alecto once again tried to persuade Kratos to return to Ares' side with the lure that Kratos could live forever in the illusion of being with his family. But seeing the Eyes of Truth hanging on Alecto's hip, Kratos immediately refused, making Alecto furious and threatening to kill him if he did not agree to serve Ares. By using the Oath Stone, Kratos managed to escape from Alecto's snares and reclaim the Eyes of Truth. Tisiphone rejoins Alecto, but because he now had the power of the Eyes of Truth, the illusions of the Furies could be destroyed. 
</p><p>The Furies then created an illusion in the form of a large whirlpool, and Alecto changes form into a giant sea monster. Kratos mustered all his strength to face Alecto and Tisiphone, and by using the Eyes of Truth, he managed to subdue Daimon, Tisiphone's pet, which forces Alecto back into her human form, ending the illusion. In a last-ditch effort, Tisiphone changed into Lysandra, making Kratos hesitate for a moment, but he quickly remembered that it was just an illusion. Tisiphone then transformed herself into the <a href="/wiki/Village_Oracle" title="Village Oracle">Oracle</a> from the village of <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a> who was ignored by Kratos, claiming that “they” (referring to Lysandra and Calliope) were not at the village by coincidence, but her efforts were in vain.
</p><p><b>Part V</b>
</p><p>Kratos could no longer be influenced and Tisiphone died at the Spartan’s hands. With only Alecto left, Kratos drew his <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a> and stabbed Alecto through the chest, instantly killing her. Following the death of the Furies, Kratos returned to Sparta and met Orkos, who congratulated him. But at the same time, he also revealed that when the Furies caught him, he had been made Kratos' oath- keeper. This meant that the oath between Kratos and Ares had not been severed. Orkos also did not want to live as an oath keeper who is still bound by Ares. For that, he asked Kratos to give him an honourable death. 
</p><p>Initially, Kratos refuses, not wanting to shed any more innocent blood, but in order to free Orkos and exact revenge on Ares, he is forced to do so. With the death of Orkos, Kratos' oath bond with Ares was finally broken. but his actions restored the memories of his dark past, when he killed his own wife and child. Kratos then burned down his house with Orkos' body inside. Now, free from the Furies but still tormented by the truth of his past, Kratos leaves Sparta and sets out to undo his wrongdoings. 
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_3"></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War:_Chains_of_Olympus">God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Chains_of_Olympus" title="God of War: Chains of Olympus">Chains of Olympus</a></span></h3>

<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/40/GOW_COO_Poster_5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230501140816" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/GOW_COO_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230501140901" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/GOW_COO_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230501140901" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GOW COO Poster 6" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/GOW_COO_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230501140901" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="300" height="169" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GOW COO Poster 6.jpg" data-image-key="GOW_COO_Poster_6.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/GOW_COO_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230501140901"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><b>Part I</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Kratos_COL_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620112448" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 1.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Kratos_COL_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620112448"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Kratos_COL_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620112448" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Kratos_COL_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620112448" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 1.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Kratos_COL_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620112448"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Free from the <a href="/wiki/The_Furies" title="The Furies">Furies</a> but still tormented with the truth of his past, Kratos decides to faithfully serve the <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Gods of Olympus</a> for the next ten years, hoping that in this way, he can redeem himself and his past sins can be forgiven. In his fifth year of service, Kratos was ordered to join the <a href="/wiki/Attica" title="Attica">Attica</a> warriors in their struggle against the incoming <a href="/wiki/Persian_Warrior" title="Persian Warrior">Persian</a> soldiers attacking with a giant monster named <a href="/wiki/Basilisk" title="Basilisk">Basilisk</a>. Seeing the beast moving from place to place, climbing walls, and burning the city of Attica, Kratos chased after it, but in the middle of this chase, he accidentally met the <a href="/wiki/Persian_King" title="Persian King">King of Persia</a> who was threatening two defensless women in a prison cell. 
</p><p>Kratos confronts him and the King of Persia informs that he wants to deliver <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a> into the hands of the Persian Empire. This situation led Kratos to beat him until he fell helpless and begged to be forgiven, promising to give Kratos all his wealth. Ignoring his pleading, Kratos killed him and took his power to summon <a href="/wiki/Efreet" title="Efreet">Efreet</a>. Later on, after taking a quick rest, Kratos continues his pursuit of the Basilisk and subdues it. With this, he successfully completed the task given by the Gods of Olympus. But that alone is not enough for him. He climbed a cliff and asked the Gods what he should do next.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/cf/Kratos_COL_7.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620113106" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 7" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 7.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_7.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/cf/Kratos_COL_7.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620113106"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/cf/Kratos_COL_7.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620113106" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 7" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/cf/Kratos_COL_7.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620113106" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 7.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_7.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/cf/Kratos_COL_7.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620113106"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Suddenly, Kratos saw the sun fall from the sky and disappear, leaving the world in complete darkness. Kratos knew what he just saw wasn't a sign from the Gods, but something sinister, so he decided to investigate the place where the sun had fallen, where a mysterious light was shining. The mysterious light that brought Kratos to the city of <a href="/wiki/Marathon" title="Marathon">Marathon</a> was slowly being devoured by a black mist with the presence of several <a href="/wiki/Shadows" title="Shadows">shadow warriors</a>, which was the work of <a href="/wiki/Morpheus" title="Morpheus">Morpheus</a>, the God of Dreams. Kratos fights his way through the city of Marathon while trying to fight the influence of the black mist, while taking notice of a familiar melody.  
</p><p>Even though the influence of the black mist was quite strong, Kratos managed to get through it and found the ruins of what was later revealed to be the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Helios" title="Temple of Helios">Temple of Helios</a>. Inside, he was met by a Statue of Athena, who told him that <a href="/wiki/Helios" title="Helios">Helios</a> had been kidnapped from the sky by an unknown force, and the Temple where Kratos was currently is actually the horse-drawn carriage used by Helios to travel around the sky every day. Now without a master to order them, Helios' chariot fell to the Earth and the sky was filled with darkness. Morpheus then took advantage of this situation to put the Gods of Olympus into a deep sleep and started spreading a black mist all over <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a>.  
</p><p><b>Part II</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/Kratos_COL_12.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620113657" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 12" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 12.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_12.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/Kratos_COL_12.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620113657"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/Kratos_COL_12.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620113657" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 12" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/Kratos_COL_12.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620113657" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 12.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_12.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/Kratos_COL_12.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620113657"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>For this reason, before Morpheus succeeded in his goal, Kratos was assigned to find Helios and return him to the sky. Exploring the Temple of Helios, Kratos meets a statue of <a href="/wiki/Eos" title="Eos">Eos</a>, the Goddess of Dawn, who immediately informs him that <a href="/wiki/Atlas" title="Atlas">Atlas</a> had somehow been freed from the pits of <a href="/wiki/Tartarus" title="Tartarus">Tartarus</a> and kidnapped her brother, Helios, the God of Sun. Furthermore, she explained that Helios had extraordinary powers which can be used to destroy the whole world and now that Atlas has it, the world is in danger. For that, Eos asked Kratos to take Helios' shield, called the <a href="/wiki/Sun_Shield" title="Sun Shield">Sun Shield</a>, which would help him on his journey. 
</p><p>After taking the Sun Shield and using it to open access to several doors in the Temple of Helios, Kratos met again with Eos in the Cave of Olympus, where it was revealed that Atlas was very dependent on the power of Helios, because after the Sun disappeared, his strength also slowly disappeared. Eos asked Kratos to save her brother and by doing so, she promised to make Helios try to convince <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> to erase the nightmares that Kratos experienced, memories of his past actions that he would never be able to forget. Although, he doesn't believe in Eos' promise because it has been given so many times by the Gods of Olympus. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/25/Kratos_COL_15.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620114041" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 15" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 15.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_15.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/25/Kratos_COL_15.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620114041"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/25/Kratos_COL_15.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620114041" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 15" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/25/Kratos_COL_15.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620114041" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 15.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_15.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/25/Kratos_COL_15.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620114041"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos still follows Eos' advice to wake up Helios' fire horse which will take him to where Helios was being held captive, because after all, without Helios' absence, the world would be pitch black and everyone that is in it sooner or later will die. Kratos takes the <a href="/wiki/Primordial_Fire" title="Primordial Fire">Primordial Fire</a>, a fire which is the source of Helios’ power, and uses it to awaken Helios' fire horse. However, when he left the Temple of Helios and was about to ride the horse-drawn carriage, the same melody was heard once again, and this time, Kratos recognized the music as the tune his daughter, <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a>, used to play on the flute. 
</p><p>Kratos was confused for a moment, but then realized that it was just the influence of Morpheus' black fog, and rode the horse-drawn carriage which, according to Eos, would take him to the place where Helios was being held. In the middle of the journey, Morpheus' black mist that covered the area managed to put Kratos into a deep sleep, and in his dream, he returned to the past, to the time when Calliope greeted him happily when he returned from war. Kratos also remembers the day when he made a bamboo flute for his daughter, and from there, Calliope would start to play a beautiful melody. 
</p><p><b>Part III</b>
</p><p>Unfortunately, that pleasant memory was soon destroyed by the bad memories which continued to plague Kratos’ mind. Kratos then woke up in the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a>, Hades' residence, which was not enveloped by Morpheus' black fog. But the Primordial Fire which was the source of the carriage's power was not welcome here, so the light of the horse carriage suddenly dimmed and Kratos fell into the depths of the Underworld. Luckily, before touching the fires of the Underworld, Kratos grabbed onto the rocks and managed to climb back to the surface. From a distance, he saw the Light of Helios located right in front of the <a href="/wiki/Pillar_of_the_World" title="Pillar of the World">Pillar of the World</a>, the pillar that supports the Greek World. 
</p><p>But on the way there, he realized that to reach that place, he had to cross the <a href="/wiki/River_Styx" title="River Styx">River Styx</a>, so he rang a bell to summon a ship driven by <a href="/wiki/Charon" title="Charon">Charon</a>, a shipbuilder in the Underworld who was enslaved by Hades to transport the souls of the dead across River Styx. Charon refuses to help Kratos cross River Styx on the grounds that Kratos is still alive, leaving Kratos no any other choice but to face him. Unfortunately, Charon was too strong for Kratos, to the point where even Kratos is overwhelmed and thrown into the depths of Tartarus where the <a href="/wiki/Titans" title="Titans">Titans</a> were imprisoned by Zeus after losing in the <a href="/wiki/Titanomachy" title="Titanomachy">Great War</a>. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Kratos_COL_33.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620121139" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 33" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 33.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_33.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Kratos_COL_33.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620121139"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Kratos_COL_33.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620121139" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 33" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Kratos_COL_33.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620121139" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 33.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_33.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Kratos_COL_33.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620121139"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>As he woke up in the depths of Tartarus, Kratos freed himself from the chains that bound him and battled a multitude of enemies, before then reaching the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Zeus" title="Temple of Zeus">Temple of Zeus</a> located in the Prison of Tartarus, where he found the <a href="/wiki/Gauntlet_of_Zeus" title="Gauntlet of Zeus">Gauntlet of Zeus</a>, the weapon <a href="/wiki/Hephaestus" title="Hephaestus">Hephaestus</a> forged for Zeus to bind the Titans in the depths of Tartarus after the Great War ended. With the Gauntlet of Zeus in his hand, Kratos tries to find a way out, and in the midst of his efforts, he realizes that what Eos told him is true, Atlas has managed to escape, leaving the chains that bound him broken. 
</p><p>After a dangerous journey, Kratos finally managed to climb out and meet again with Charon. Now by utilizing the power of the Gauntlet of Zeus, he easily conquered Charon and used a ship to cross River Styx. He grew closer to Helios' light which seemed to illuminate the darkness of the Underworld, but when he was almost at the pier, Kratos' attention was drawn to the appearance of his daughter, Calliope who was playing the flute, and singing the same beautiful melody. Unfortunately, before Kratos can reach it, Calliope disappeared. 
</p><p><b>Part IV</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ca/Kratos_COL_40.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620122725" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 40" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 40.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_40.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ca/Kratos_COL_40.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620122725"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ca/Kratos_COL_40.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620122725" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 40" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ca/Kratos_COL_40.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620122725" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 40.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_40.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ca/Kratos_COL_40.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620122725"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>As if guided, Kratos followed Calliope into the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Persephone" title="Temple of Persephone">Temple of Persephone</a> until he reached the Pillar of the World, which was located at the top of the temple, where he met <a href="/wiki/Persephone" title="Persephone">Persephone</a>, the Goddess of the Ground. Persephone had been kidnapped annd brought into the Underworld and forced to marry <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a>, making her his wife and Queen. Persephone realized that at this point, Kratos was fed up with the task given by the Gods of Olympus to save Helios, so she tried to get him to cooperate by telling him that she have also felt the same way. Moreover, she was also tricked by Hades into eating a pomegranate which turned out to be a curse, binding her to the Underworld forever.
</p><p>But Kratos did not care and insisted she deliver him to his daughter, who according to Persephone, was in the <a href="/wiki/Elysium_Fields" title="Elysium Fields">Elysium Field</a>, a part of the Underworld which is for the good and pure souls. Persephone granted his request, but to enter the Fields, Kratos must first surrender his powers before he can enter. Kratos immediately transferred his power into the <a href="/wiki/Forsaken_Tree" title="Forsaken Tree">Forsaken Tree</a> and entered the Elysium Fields, where he finally met Calliope and immediately hugged her, making this the first time that Kratos has been happy since his service as the 'Ghost of Sparta'. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/76/Kratos_COL_44.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620123444" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 44" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 44.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_44.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/76/Kratos_COL_44.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620123444"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/76/Kratos_COL_44.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620123444" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 44" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/76/Kratos_COL_44.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620123444" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 44.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_44.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/76/Kratos_COL_44.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620123444"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>But in the midst of hugging her, Persephone comes to Kratos and reveals that it was she who freed Atlas from Tartarus and allied with Morpheus. Since childhood, Persephone has lost the life she longed for, she was kidnapped by Hades with the help of Zeus, forced to marry Hades, and has to care for the dead in the Underworld forever. Fed up with her life, Persephone frees Atlas and then assigns him to capture Helios. She also plans to use the destructive power that is in Helios to destroy the Pillar of the World, which would lead to the destruction of the Greek World.
</p><p><b>Part V</b>
</p><p>After Helios was caught and the sky became pitch black, she asked Morpheus to make the Gods of Olympus fall into a deep sleep so that her plans couldn't be thwarted. Realizing the Elysium Fields will also collapse as a result from the destruction of the Pillar of the World, Kratos realized that he had made the wrong choice to surrender all his power to the Forsaken Tree. For this reason, with a heavy heart, he forced himself to return to being the 'Ghost of Sparta' by pushing Calliope away and killing the innocent souls in the Elysium Fields regaining his strength. Now, Kratos understands that he will never have the opportunity to be with his daughter again.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_COL_48.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620123939" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos COL 48" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos COL 48.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_48.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_COL_48.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620123939"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_COL_48.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240620123939" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos COL 48" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_COL_48.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620123939" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos COL 48.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_COL_48.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_COL_48.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240620123939"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>And when he heard Calliope's crying, his hatred for the Gods of Olympus deepened. Kratos chased after Persephone and faced her at the top of the Pillar of the World. With the anger and the power he has now, he managed to defeat Persephone's temptation, chained Atlas to the Pillar of the World and in the end killed the Queen. The Pillar of the World was partially destroyed as a result of the fight between Kratos and Persephone, forcing Atlas to stand over him and hold all of Greece on his shoulders. Before Kratos left the Underworld, Atlas asked whether Kratos really believes that the Gods will keep their promise to relieve Kratos of his nightmares.
</p><p>Kratos replies that this is the only hope for him for now, because he can no longer return to the Elysium field. By killing Persephone and chaining Atlas to the Pillar of the World, Kratos has saved mankind. However, this meant nothing to him. Kratos then left the Underworld. Together with Helios, they used the fire-horse carriage to light up the world again. In the middle of this journey, Kratos, who was exhausted after taking such a dangerous journey, fell from the carriage. But he was saved by Athena and Helios. They both stripped him of his strength and equipment, before then leaving him unconscious on a cliff overlooking the <a href="/wiki/Aegean_Sea" title="Aegean Sea">Aegean Sea</a>.
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_4"></div></div><h3><span id="God_of_War_.282005.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War_(2005)">God of War (<a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(2005)" title="God of War (2005)">2005</a>)</span></h3>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6e/GOW_I_Poster_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230501141446" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block;
