<p><b>Part I</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Gow2005_8.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802140003" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 8" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 8.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_8.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Gow2005_8.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802140003"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Gow2005_8.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802140003" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 8" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Gow2005_8.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802140003" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 8.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_8.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Gow2005_8.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802140003"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Ten years into his service, he was assigned to bring peace in the <a href="/wiki/Aegean_Sea" title="Aegean Sea">Aegean Sea</a> by killing a massive sea serpent monster named <a href="/wiki/Hydra" title="Hydra">Hydra</a>. On the way, Kratos was given the power of lightning by <a href="/wiki/Poseidon" title="Poseidon">Poseidon</a>, the God of Sea, which proved to be effective in conquering the Hydra's heads. He then entered the sea monster's throat to retrieve the ship's key from the <a href="/wiki/Captain" title="Captain">Captain</a> who seemed to be trying to climb out. But instead of helping the Captain, Kratos only took the key he needed and dropped the ship's captain into the Hydra's stomach, immediately killing him. 
</p><p>With the ship's key in his hand, Kratos entered to the Captain’s cabin and slaughtered all of the <a href="/wiki/Undead_Legionnaire" title="Undead Legionnaire">undead legionnaires</a> that have killed the people who had taken shelter within. This terrible sight once again reminds Kratos of his past. In an effort to forget what he did in the past, Kratos celebrates victory with wine and women, but none of that helps and his visions continued to plague him. Enraged, he called out to <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>, and talked about how he has faithfully served the Gods of <a href="/wiki/Mount_Olympus" title="Mount Olympus">Olympus</a> for ten years, but has yet to get what he wants, redemption for his past.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/Gow2005_13.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802141232" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 13" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 13.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_13.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/Gow2005_13.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141232"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/Gow2005_13.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802141232" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 13" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/Gow2005_13.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141232" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 13.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_13.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/Gow2005_13.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141232"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Hearing Kratos' anger, Athena gave him one final task; namely to find <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Pandora's Box</a> and use the power inside it to conquer Ares. Athena wanted Kratos to travel to kill Ares, because at this very moment, Ares had surrounded the city of <a href="/wiki/Athens" title="Athens">Athens</a>, the capital of <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a>. The reason Ares had invaded the city of Athens was because he was jealous of Athena. But now, Athena can only send Kratos to conquer Ares. This last task gives Kratos the opportunity to take revenge on Ares for the death of his wife and child. He then asked that will all the Gods can get rid of his bad dreams after this task is over.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Gow2005_14.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802141330" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 14" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 14.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_14.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Gow2005_14.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141330"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Gow2005_14.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802141330" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 14" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Gow2005_14.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141330" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 14.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_14.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Gow2005_14.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141330"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Athena promised that should he succeed, the Gods would forgive Kratos' sins. Kratos then sailed to the city of Athens, motivated by the opportunity to take revenge against his former master. Arriving at the port of Athens, Kratos orders the <a href="/wiki/Topless_Women" title="Topless Women">women</a> in his bed to gather their things and leave, despite their requests to stay with him longer. Deboarding the ship, Kratos made his way through the city, battling repeatedly with the forces of Ares’ army. During his journey through the city, he would receive additional gifts from the Gods of Olympus; <a href="/wiki/Aphrodite" title="Aphrodite">Aphrodite</a> would give him the head of <a href="/wiki/Medusa" title="Medusa">Medusa</a> to petrify his enemies, and <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> would bestow the Spartan with the ability to hurl <a href="/wiki/The_Thunderbolts_of_Zeus" title="The Thunderbolts of Zeus">lightning bolts</a> at his targets.  
</p><p><b>Part II</b>
</p><p>By using these powers lent by the Gods, Kratos was able to conquer Ares’ soldiers more easily. Making his way deeper into the city, he would eventually be met with an illusionary image of the <a href="/wiki/Oracle_of_Athens" title="Oracle of Athens">Oracle of Athens</a>, who asked Kratos to meet her at the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_the_Oracle" title="Temple of the Oracle">Oracle’s Temple</a> in order to teach him “how to murder a God”. Progressing further, Kratos sees a titanic Ares battling the forces of Athens in the distance. The Spartan swears he will take his revenge against the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a> before continuing his journey. Eventually, Kratos succeeds and reaches the Oracle's shrine, but there, he sees the Oracle being attacked and captured by a group of <a href="/wiki/Harpies" title="Harpies">Harpies</a>.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c4/Gow2005_17.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802141549" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 17" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 17.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_17.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c4/Gow2005_17.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141549"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c4/Gow2005_17.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802141549" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 17" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c4/Gow2005_17.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141549" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 17.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_17.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c4/Gow2005_17.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802141549"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Giving chase, Kratos eventually reaches the Oracle's Temple. Upon getting to the outer courtyard, the Spartan was met with by a mysterious <a href="/wiki/Grave_Digger" title="Grave Digger">Grave Digger</a>. While the old man did not reveal his identity, he seemed to have uncanny knowledge of what was going on among the Gods. Confused as to why the Grave Digger was making a grave in the middle of a battle, Kratos asked who the grave the man was digging was meant for. The Grave Digger responded that it was for Kratos, who was taken aback by this answer. The old man told him not to worry, as all would be revealed in good time, and that when all hope seemed lost, he would be there to help.  
</p><p>Confused by this, Kratos left him and continued his pursuit of the Oracle, who he managed to save when she almost fell from a rope. The Oracle immediately suspects that Kratos is motivated by something other than a desire to do good, so she decided to find out by looking through his memories despite his protests. The whole of Kratos’ past is revealed to her, from his brutal tactics in battle to his ambitions of having Sparta’s glory be known throughout the world. Horrified by these revelations, the Oracle wonders why Athena chose him as her champion. Angry, Kratos pushes the Oracle aside, warning her to stay out of his head.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/98/Gow2005_21.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802142427" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 21" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 21.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_21.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/98/Gow2005_21.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802142427"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/98/Gow2005_21.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802142427" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 21" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/98/Gow2005_21.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802142427" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 21.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_21.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/98/Gow2005_21.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802142427"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>The Oracle informed Kratos that a mere mortal would not be able to defeat Ares. The only power that can be used to stand a chance against the Gods is the power stored in <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Box</a>, which could be found in <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Temple" title="Pandora's Temple">Pandora's Temple</a>, located in the <a href="/wiki/Desert_of_Lost_Souls" title="Desert of Lost Souls">Desert of Lost Souls</a>. The Oracle warns Kratos that there is not a single person who had succeeded in retrieving the Box, but Kratos was undeterred. Following the Oracle's directions, Kratos travels to the Desert of Lost Souls. While on the way towards the entrance of the desert, it is where a <a href="/wiki/Statue_of_Athena" title="Statue of Athena">Statue of Athena</a> appeared before him and told him that to reach Pandora's Temple, Kratos must follow the direction of the three <a href="/wiki/Siren" title="Siren">Siren</a>'s chants.  
Furthermore, she explains that Pandora's Temple is on the back of the <a href="/wiki/Cronos" title="Cronos">Titan Cronos</a>. Unlike the other Titans imprisoned in <a href="/wiki/Tartarus" title="Tartarus">Tartarus</a>, Cronos was punished by Zeus to walk in the empty desert while carrying the Temple of Pandora on his back for eternity. Kratos finds the three Sirens and kills them, as he sent the souls of the three to start opening a door to which led a platform where he found a <a href="/wiki/Titan_Horn" title="Titan Horn">Titan's Trumpet</a>. Blowing into the horn, Kratos is able to summon Cronos. With Cronos arriving on the platform, Kratos jumps onto the Titan’s shoulders, after which he would climb for three days until he reached the Temple of Pandora. 
</p><p><b>Part III</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/GOW_2005_25.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805142025" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="GOW 2005 25" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="GOW 2005 25.jpg" data-image-key="GOW_2005_25.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/GOW_2005_25.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805142025"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/GOW_2005_25.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805142025" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GOW 2005 25" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/GOW_2005_25.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805142025" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GOW 2005 25.jpg" data-image-key="GOW_2005_25.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/GOW_2005_25.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805142025"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Just outside the Temple's entrance, Kratos meets the Gate Keeper. He is the first person who tried to enter Pandora's Temple but failed to make through, and is now a living corpse. Upon his failure, the Gods forced him to guard the Temple's entrance and set fire to the bodies of everyone who failed to conquer the Temple of Pandora. Convinced that Kratos will end up failing like the others, the Gate Keeper ushered him into Pandora's Temple. Once inside, Kratos once again receives a gift from the Gods, this time from the Goddess <a href="/wiki/Artemis" title="Artemis">Artemis</a>, who bestows the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Artemis" title="Blade of Artemis">Blade of Artemis</a> upon him.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/GOW_2005_28.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805142219" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="GOW 2005 28" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="GOW 2005 28.jpg" data-image-key="GOW_2005_28.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/GOW_2005_28.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805142219"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/GOW_2005_28.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805142219" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GOW 2005 28" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/GOW_2005_28.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805142219" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GOW 2005 28.jpg" data-image-key="GOW_2005_28.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3e/GOW_2005_28.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805142219"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>During his journey through Pandora's Temple as well, Kratos faces countless monsters, including a giant armoured <a href="/wiki/Minotaur" title="Minotaur">minotaur</a>. Making his way through various trials and obstacles, he finds <a href="/wiki/Poseidon%27s_Trident" title="Poseidon's Trident">Poseidon's Trident</a>, which gives him the power to breathe underwater, and is met by <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a>, who gives him the ability to call upon the <a href="/wiki/Soul_of_Hades_(Power)" title="Soul of Hades (Power)">Souls of Hades</a> to aid him in battle. After completing all the trials of Pandora's Temple, Kratos is at last able to retrieve Pandora's Box, making him the first human to do so. Athena appeared and asked Kratos to bring Pandora's Box back to Athens and use it there so he can finally defeat Ares. 
</p><p>Kratos began pushing the Box out of the Temple, but his actions did not go unnoticed by Ares. Ares, who at that time was busy continuing his large-scale attack on the city, immediately realized that Kratos had managed to find Pandora's Box. In order to stop him, he picked up a broken pillar and threw it towards the Desert of Lost Souls, bidding farewell to his former servant. The pillar eventually reached Kratos and skewered him against the wall. Watching helplessly as Ares’ Harpies carry the Box away, Kratos was reminded of the night he murdered his wife and daughter before he died. Kratos then fell into the depths of the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a>.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5e/Gow2005_41.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805144020" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 41" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 41.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_41.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5e/Gow2005_41.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144020"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5e/Gow2005_41.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805144020" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 41" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5e/Gow2005_41.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144020" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 41.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_41.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5e/Gow2005_41.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144020"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>But before he fell into the <a href="/wiki/River_Styx" title="River Styx">River Styx</a>, Kratos clings to the feet of the <a href="/wiki/Captain" title="Captain">Boat Captain</a>, hanging from the side of a platform in an attempt to avoid falling into the river himself. The Captain demanded that Kratos let go of him, lest they both end up falling, but the Spartan retorted that he still had business in the world of the living before stabbing the Captain with one of his Blades in order to pull himself up onto the platform. The Boat Captain recognizes Kratos in alarm before being kicked off the edge by the Spartan, leaving him to fall screaming into the river. Kratos made his way through the Underworld, slaughtering enemies and overcoming obstacles before he came across a rope.  
</p><p><b>Part IV</b>
</p><p>Upon seeing the rope in front of him, he would climb upwards as it led him into the sky. While climbing the rope, it brought him back to the surface near the grave that the old Grave Digger had been making outside the Oracle’s Shrine. The old man comments that Kratos had arrived not a moment too soon, as he had only just finished digging the grave. Confused, Kratos once again asked who the Grave Digger really was, but the mysterious old man only told the Spartan that Athena wasn't the only God watching over Kratos. An explosion rang out nearby, distracting Kratos briefly.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ce/Gow2005_42.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805144106" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 42" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 42.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_42.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ce/Gow2005_42.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144106"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ce/Gow2005_42.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805144106" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 42" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ce/Gow2005_42.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144106" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 42.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_42.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/ce/Gow2005_42.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144106"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>When he turned to look at the Grave Digger again, he found that the old man had seemingly vanished into thin air, leaving only his shovel behind. Not having anymore time to lose, Kratos rushes through the Temple of Pandora to reach Ares, and encounters the Oracle once again, finding her critically injured. The Oracle said that Kratos was too late, as Ares had managed to take over Athens, and that all hope was lost. However, Kratos was unmoved by these words, making his way back to the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_the_Gods" title="Blade of the Gods">Blade of the Gods</a>, where he would see Ares gloating to Zeus over his apparent victory, stating his intent to use Pandora’s Box to overthrow Olympus.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Gow2005_48.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805144615" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 48" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 48.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_48.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Gow2005_48.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144615"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Gow2005_48.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805144615" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 48" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Gow2005_48.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144615" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 48.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_48.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Gow2005_48.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805144615"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>However, Ares turned around to find Kratos still alive. Nonetheless, he still felt the Spartan was no threat to him, mocking Zeus for sending a “broken mortal” to fight for him. While Ares was distracted, Kratos throws a lightning bolt to knock Pandora’s Box out of Ares’ hand. Kratos then opened the Box, absorbing the power within, making him grow to massive size. Kratos battles Ares viciously, using all the powers and skills he had acquired throughout his journey to overpower the God of War, but when it seems as though he has beaten him, Ares summons the power to trap Kratos in a psychological void, where there Kratos is transported back to the Temple where his family was killed. 
</p><p>He sees <a href="/wiki/Lysandra" title="Lysandra">Lysandra</a> and <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a> inside, before a series of demonic versions of himself appear and try to kill his wife and child. Kratos battles his illusionary selves to try and protect his family, eventually succeeding and declaring to Ares that he would not lose his family again. However, Ares mocked the Spartan before he ripped the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a> from his arms and used them to kill Kratos' family anyway, leaving Kratos horrified and distraught. Just as Ares was about to deliver the finishing blow, Kratos noticed the Blade of the Gods and his fighting spirit was restored. He dodged out of the way of Ares’ attack, grabbing the massive sword and declaring that he still had allies on Olympus. 
</p><p><b>Part V</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/Gow2005_53.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805145316" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 53" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 53.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_53.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/Gow2005_53.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805145316"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/Gow2005_53.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805145316" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 53" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/Gow2005_53.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805145316" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 53.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_53.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d3/Gow2005_53.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250805145316"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos battled Ares once more, eventually overpowering and critically wounding him. Ares reminded Kratos that it was him who had saved him from dying at Alrik’s hands all those years ago, to which he replied that he hadn't forgotten. The God of War claimed that, in making Kratos kill his family, all he had wanted was to make the Spartan into a great warrior. Kratos coldly replied, “You succeeded.” before stabbing Ares through the heart with the Blade of the Gods, killing him. With Ares dead, Kratos did what was thought impossible, a mere mortal slaying a God, and saved Athens from destruction. 
</p><p>However, Kratos found that he would not receive the same salvation. When he asked Athena to rid him of his nightmares, she informs him that while the Gods of Olympus would keep their promise to forgive Kratos' sins, they never promised to free him from his nightmares, as no one could forget the terrible things he had done. Realizing that he would never be free from his torment, Kratos goes to the <a href="/wiki/Suicide_Bluffs" title="Suicide Bluffs">Suicide Bluff</a> overlooking the Aegean Sea. Believing that the Gods had abandoned him, and that there was no hope for him, he threw himself from the cliffs, believing that death would be his escape from his madness. 
</p><p>However, the Gods of Olympus had other plans for him. Athena raised Kratos from the water and back onto the cliff, stating that someone who had accomplished what he had could not be allowed to die by his own hand. As a form of gratitude for serving the Gods, Athena offered him the vacant throne of Ares, as well as the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Athena" title="Blades of Athena">Blades of Athena</a> as replacements for the Blades of Chaos. Ascending the steps of Olympus, Kratos made his way to the <a href="/wiki/Kratos%27_Throne_Room" title="Kratos' Throne Room">Throne Room</a> and took Ares’ throne for himself. From then on, Kratos would be known across all of Greece as the mortal who ascended to godhood and became the new God of War.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/95/Gow2005_65.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250805150207" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_5"></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War:_Greek_Comics">God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(DC/Wildstorm_comic_series)" title="God of War (DC/Wildstorm comic series)">Greek Comics</a></span></h3>

<p><b>Part I</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/Kratos11.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100909172934" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos11" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="135" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos11.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos11.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/Kratos11.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100909172934"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/Kratos11.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100909172934" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos11" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/Kratos11.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100909172934" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="135" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos11.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos11.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/09/Kratos11.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100909172934"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a>, the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a> has died. Now his throne is occupied by Kratos, a <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> warrior being managed to kill the God with the power of <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Pandora's Box</a>. One day, Kratos heard the news about Ares' loyal subordinates who were planning to revive their master by using the magical potion, the Ambrosia.
</p><p><b>Part II</b>
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Ambrosia" title="Ambrosia">Ambrosia</a> is a healing potion concocted by the God of Healing <a href="/wiki/Asclepius" title="Asclepius">Asclepius</a>, which was used in the past by Kratos to cure <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a> of a mysterious plague infection. Kratos immediately rushes off to Tartarus, find a better way to avoid any obstacles, and then destroy the Ambrosia before it is too late. 
</p><p><b>Part III</b>
</p><p>In his journey, he managed to conquer a giant monster named <a href="/wiki/Giant_Arachnid" title="Giant Arachnid">Arachnid</a> and several times was approached by <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a> who tried warned of the dangers that lay in <a href="/wiki/Tartarus" title="Tartarus">Tartarus</a>. Kratos however ignored Athena's warning, and even thought about to himself that nothing could ever stop him in his path.
</p><p><b>Part IV</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/49/Hermes_comics.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100804193152" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Hermes comics" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="166" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Hermes comics.jpg" data-image-key="Hermes_comics.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/49/Hermes_comics.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100804193152"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/49/Hermes_comics.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100804193152" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Hermes comics" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/49/Hermes_comics.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100804193152" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="166" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Hermes comics.jpg" data-image-key="Hermes_comics.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/49/Hermes_comics.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100804193152"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Continuing the search, Kratos finds a corpse of the <a href="/wiki/Kratos%27_Army" title="Kratos' Army">Spartan Army</a> who once lived but died at the hands of the <a href="/wiki/Army_of_Hades" title="Army of Hades">Army of Hades</a> in order to take Ambrosia from <a href="/wiki/Alrik" title="Alrik">Alrik</a>. Now the corpses of the Spartan Armies have risen again and they were trying to kill Kratos in revenge for leaving them behind in the past. 
</p><p><b>Part V</b>
</p><p>Kratos managed to kill all the Spartan Army and he has successfully arrived in the <a href="/wiki/Tree_of_Life" title="Tree of Life">Tree of Life</a>. He also met Gyges and burn him to death using the <a href="/wiki/Apollo%27s_Flame" title="Apollo's Flame">Flame of Apollo</a>. Kratos then left the area, knowing that Ares' followers will hunt him down for ruining their last opportunity to revive their Fallen God. 
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_6"></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War:_Ghost_of_Sparta">God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Ghost_of_Sparta" title="God of War: Ghost of Sparta">Ghost of Sparta</a></span></h3>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9d/GOW_GOS_Poster_1..jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230628093707" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <p><b>Part I</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	 <a href="https://godofwar.fandom.com/wiki/File:04._God_of_War_-_Ghost_of_Sparta_PS3_-_Callisto_-_Kratos_Mother" class="video video-thumbnail xsmall "> 	<img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" alt="04._God_of_War_-_Ghost_of_Sparta_PS3_-_Callisto_-_Kratos_Mother" height="101" width="180" data-video-key="04._God_of_War_-_Ghost_of_Sparta_PS3_-_Callisto_-_Kratos_Mother" data-video-name="04. God of War - Ghost of Sparta PS3 - Callisto - Kratos Mother" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c6/04._God_of_War_-_Ghost_of_Sparta_PS3_-_Callisto_-_Kratos_Mother/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20160410203154" class="lazyload"> 	<span class="thumbnail-play-icon-container"> 		<svg class="thumbnail-play-icon wds-icon"><use xlink:href="#wds-player-icon-play"></use></svg>	</span> </a>  	 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 			<p class="title">04. God of War - Ghost of Sparta PS3 - Callisto - Kratos Mother</p> 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Although Kratos had been appointed the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a> to replace Ares, the memories of his past lingered. One day, he received a vision of his mother, <a href="/wiki/Callisto" title="Callisto">Callisto</a>, being held captive in the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Poseidon" title="Temple of Poseidon">Temple of Poseidon</a> in <a href="/wiki/Atlantis" title="Atlantis">Atlantis</a>. Kratos knew it wasn't an ordinary dream, and as such, he travelled to Poseidon’s Temple. During his voyage, <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a> appeared and tried to prevent Kratos from carrying out his mission, saying that everything Kratos saw was only a dream, but her plea fell on deaf ears. When almost to his destination, the ship was attacked and was destroyed by <a href="/wiki/Scylla" title="Scylla">Scylla</a>, a monster sent by Poseidon, and Kratos crashes into the mainland of Atlantis. 
</p><p>After successfully driving Scylla away, Kratos makes his way to the Temple of Poseidon and came across his mother lying on a bed, weakened and frail. Callisto told her approaching son that she had missed him. At first, Kratos assumed that it was a trick by the <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a> due to thinking that his mother was dead, but she assured him that it was truly her. After he closely examined her, Kratos realized that it was indeed his mother to which he was shocked to see her again. Surprised by this revelation, Kratos became furious, asking her who his father was and why Callisto had been lying about him for the death of his long lost brother, <a href="/wiki/Deimos" title="Deimos">Deimos</a>. 
</p><p>Callisto replied that Kratos' father forbade her to speak of that, but before she could tell who Kratos' real father was, she turned into a massive creature and attacked Kratos. Kratos was forced to fight his transformed mother, and after being seriously injured, Callisto returned to her original form. Before she succumbed to her injuries, she thanked Kratos for freeing her from the curse and asked him to save Deimos. To open the gate to the <a href="/wiki/Domain_of_Death" title="Domain of Death">Domain of Death</a>, Kratos needed a key called the <a href="/wiki/The_Skull_of_Keres" title="The Skull of Keres">Skull of Keres</a> which, according to Callisto, is stored in the city of <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>, Kratos' birthplace. Angry that the Gods had once again caused him to lose another of his family members, Kratos embarked on a journey to save his brother.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d7/God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140810001730" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d7/God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20140810001730"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d7/God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140810001730" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d7/God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20140810001730" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d7/God-of-war-ghost-of-sparta-001.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20140810001730"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><b>Part II</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/God_of_War_Ghost_of_Sparta_Playthrough_Part_4_05563.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20101025011425" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God of War Ghost of Sparta Playthrough Part 4 05563" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God of War Ghost of Sparta Playthrough Part 4 05563.jpg" data-image-key="God_of_War_Ghost_of_Sparta_Playthrough_Part_4_05563.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/God_of_War_Ghost_of_Sparta_Playthrough_Part_4_05563.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20101025011425"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/God_of_War_Ghost_of_Sparta_Playthrough_Part_4_05563.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20101025011425" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God of War Ghost of Sparta Playthrough Part 4 05563" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/God_of_War_Ghost_of_Sparta_Playthrough_Part_4_05563.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20101025011425" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God of War Ghost of Sparta Playthrough Part 4 05563.jpg" data-image-key="God_of_War_Ghost_of_Sparta_Playthrough_Part_4_05563.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7e/God_of_War_Ghost_of_Sparta_Playthrough_Part_4_05563.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20101025011425"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>On the way to Sparta, Scylla once again appeared and attacked Kratos, who fell into the depths of the <a href="/wiki/Methana_Volcano" title="Methana Volcano">Methana Volcano</a>. There he met the Titan <a href="/wiki/Thera" title="Thera">Thera</a>, who was imprisoned in the Methana Volcano by Poseidon. Thera asked Kratos to save him, or otherwise, he wouldn't be able to escape. For this reason, Kratos stabs the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Athena" title="Blades of Athena">Blades of Athena</a> into Thera's chest and gains the strength of <a href="/wiki/Thera%27s_Bane" title="Thera's Bane">Thera's Bane</a>, a power that can imbue burning coals into the Blades of Athena and use them destroy the closed doors on the Methana Volcano. By doing so, Thera is now free from the chains that bind him. Kratos harnesses the power of Thera's Bane to battle a multitude of armoured enemies and smashing through various doors that impeded him.
</p><p>After a long and dangerous journey, which included killing Scylla who once again interferes in his efforts to escape, Kratos managed to escape the Methana Volcano right when the mountain erupted, drowning the city of Atlantis and the entirety of Poseidon's Temple. Crashed far away to the Island of <a href="/wiki/Crete" title="Crete">Crete</a>, Kratos reaches Athena's <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Athena_(Ghost_of_Sparta)" title="Temple of Athena (Ghost of Sparta)">Temple</a> and vents his anger on Athena who had not told him that Deimos was still alive. Athena replied that Kratos still doesn't fully understand, and she asks Kratos to cease his mission, but upon hearing this, Kratos becomes furious and destroys the <a href="/wiki/Statue_of_Athena" title="Statue of Athena">Statue of Athena</a>, before he continued the journey to the city of Sparta. 
</p><p>On the way, he once again met with the same <a href="/wiki/Grave_Digger" title="Grave Digger">Grave Digger</a> who previously helped him escape the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a>. The Grave Digger talks about how Kratos has made a mistake by sinking Atlantis, and how Kratos would be unable to find Deimos. Just like Athena, he also asked Kratos to stop his quest. However, Kratos did not care about the words of the Grave Digger, but after this encounter, he would soon find his journey once again hampered. In the mountains of <a href="/wiki/Mounts_of_Aroania" title="Mounts of Aroania">Aroania</a>, he saw Erinys, the daughter of Thanatos, who was threatening the life of a Spartan while asking for the whereabouts of the Ghost of Sparta. 
</p><p><b>Part III</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dc/Rsz_god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta_006.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20101014152849" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Rsz god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta 006" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="117" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Rsz god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta 006.jpg" data-image-key="Rsz_god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta_006.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dc/Rsz_god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta_006.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20101014152849"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dc/Rsz_god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta_006.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20101014152849" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Rsz god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta 006" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dc/Rsz_god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta_006.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20101014152849" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="117" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Rsz god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta 006.jpg" data-image-key="Rsz_god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta_006.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dc/Rsz_god-of-war-ghost-of-sparta_006.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20101014152849"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Sent by <a href="/wiki/Thanatos" title="Thanatos">Thanatos</a> after the city of Atlantis sank, <a href="/wiki/Erinys" title="Erinys">Erinys</a> is assigned to stop Kratos from reaching the Domain of Death. When the Spartan soldier admits that he does not understand Kratos' whereabouts, Erinys immediately slams him and stabbed him, leaving him to die on a rock. Kratos honours the death of the Spartan warrior and goes to Erinys who appears to have killed another group of Spartan warriors. The two of them engaged in a fight, during which Kratos managed to tear both of her wings. However, Erinys' wings grew back and she transformed into a giant armoured bird monster, forcing Kratos to use the power of Thera's Bane, stab it into her armour, and kill her. 
</p><p>After Erinys' death, Kratos finally made it to the city of Sparta. There, he took a secret path through the dungeon to enter the Temple of Ares. After reaching a loyal subordinate of Ares who was locked up, Kratos arrived at <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Ares" title="Temple of Ares">Ares' Temple</a> which is now in the process of being converted into something strange and mysterious. In order to get the Skull of Keres which is the key to the gate of the Domain of Death, Kratos must first confront the shadows of his past. And now with the key in his hand, Kratos knows that he must return to the sinking city of Atlantis. However, Kratos' journey back to the city of Atlantis is not easy.
</p><p>He had met Thanatos who asked him to stand down and immediately sent his troops when Kratos refused. Dealing with <a href="/wiki/Midas" title="Midas">King Midas</a>, the King who has the ability to turn everything he touches into gold, Kratos used him as a bridge for him to cross the lava; until finally reaching the ocean where a huge whirlpool had formed as a result for the destruction of Atlantis. The huge whirlpool and the lightning overhead shook the ship Kratos was on and dumps him in the city, where he is warned by Poseidon through one of his broken statues that he would make Kratos pay for the destruction of Atlantis.  
</p><p><b>Part IV</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8c/City_of_Sparta_-Ghost_of_Sparta-_PSP-.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20230824023935" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="City of Sparta -Ghost of Sparta- PSP-" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="City of Sparta -Ghost of Sparta- PSP-.jpeg" data-image-key="City_of_Sparta_-Ghost_of_Sparta-_PSP-.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8c/City_of_Sparta_-Ghost_of_Sparta-_PSP-.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230824023935"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8c/City_of_Sparta_-Ghost_of_Sparta-_PSP-.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20230824023935" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="City of Sparta -Ghost of Sparta- PSP-" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8c/City_of_Sparta_-Ghost_of_Sparta-_PSP-.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230824023935" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="City of Sparta -Ghost of Sparta- PSP-.jpeg" data-image-key="City_of_Sparta_-Ghost_of_Sparta-_PSP-.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8c/City_of_Sparta_-Ghost_of_Sparta-_PSP-.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230824023935"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>While Kratos was looking for the gate of the Domain of Death, Athena once again appeared to ask him to stop his search for Deimos, telling him that Deimos was a threat to Olympus before she apologized to him. Hearing Athena's apology, Kratos immediately recalled the day when Deimos was taken from him. At that time, before leaving Kratos, Athena also apologized. Her voice and manner of speaking matched Athena's apology at that moment, and because of that, Kratos realized that Athena was the one who took Deimos away from him. Enraged, Kratos asks why Athena didn't save Deimos then, but she didn't answer.  
</p><p>Kratos warned Athena not to hinder his efforts in rescuing Deimos. Following this, he went to open the gates of the Domain of Death using the Skull of Keres. Kratos arrives in the Domain of Death, a dark realm that lies between the lands of the living and world of the dead, a purgatory ruled by Thanatos that even Gods do not dare to enter. Walking further, Kratos enters the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Thanatos" title="Temple of Thanatos">Temple of Thanatos</a> and for the first time, he reunites with Deimos. Kratos immediately frees Deimos, but Deimos isn't happy with the arrival of his brother. He blamed Kratos for not helping him when he needed it the most, and for that, he attacked Kratos.    
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/DeimosKratosStaredown.png/revision/latest?cb=20130908195237" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="DeimosKratosStaredown" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="105" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="DeimosKratosStaredown.png" data-image-key="DeimosKratosStaredown.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/DeimosKratosStaredown.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130908195237"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/DeimosKratosStaredown.png/revision/latest?cb=20130908195237" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="DeimosKratosStaredown" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/DeimosKratosStaredown.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130908195237" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="105" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="DeimosKratosStaredown.png" data-image-key="DeimosKratosStaredown.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/DeimosKratosStaredown.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130908195237"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Deimos is shown to be a tough opponent, dropping Kratos from a great height and beating him without stopping until Kratos' was left bloodied and wounded. However, Kratos never retaliated against his brother. In the middle of this fight, Thanatos grabbed Deimos and carried him away. Barely able to stand as a result from Deimos' beating, Kratos follows Thanatos to a cliff and quickly saves Deimos. After reuniting, Kratos and Deimos join forces to face Thanatos. Thanatos talks about how the Oracle's predictions did come true, a 'marked warrior' will bring destruction to Olympus, however Athena and Ares mistook Deimos for the warrior. 
</p><p><b>Part V</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png/revision/latest?cb=20130908200029" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="ThanatosHoldingDeimos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="104" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png" data-image-key="ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130908200029"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png/revision/latest?cb=20130908200029" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="ThanatosHoldingDeimos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130908200029" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="104" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png" data-image-key="ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/ThanatosHoldingDeimos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130908200029"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos is the one referred to by the Oracle as the 'marked warrior' and supposed to be brought to the Domain of Death. However, none of that mattered anymore, because Thanatos had a plan- to kill them both. After engaging in a fierce fight, Thanatos turned into a giant monster resembling a dragon, but Deimos manages to stab Thanatos in the eye. However, Thanatos fought back by crushing him and threw his body aside, instantly killing Deimos. Deimos' death culminated in more anger as Kratos immediately exerted all his strength to kill Thanatos. Kratos then took his brother's lifeless body to an already empty grave prepared by none other than the Grave Digger, telling his brother that he was free now. 
</p><p>He once again attempts to kill himself by jumping the cliff, but immediately stops by asking himself what he has done and what he is now. The Grave Digger answers that Kratos had become "Death, the Destroyer of Worlds" before mysteriously disappearing. Athena attempts to elevate Kratos to full godhood, only to have the Spartan stop her from doing so. Kratos then returns to Olympus stating the Gods will pay for what they have done. As Kratos leaves, Athena quietly asks Kratos to forgive her before calling him “brother", marking the first time Athena acknowledges that they are siblings. Later, the Grave Digger is shown laying Callisto to her grave, saying "Now, only one remains". 
</p><p>A third grave is seen, implied to have been dug for Kratos. The scene shifts to Kratos on his throne, wearing his <a href="/wiki/God_Armor" title="God Armor">newly forged armour</a>, furious and determined to exact vengeance on the Gods of Olympus. Kratos, driven by his rage and the loss of his brother and mother, leads the Spartans into a vicious battle to take over the city of <a href="/wiki/Rhodes" title="Rhodes">Rhodes</a>.
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_7"></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War:_Betrayal">God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Betrayal" title="God of War: Betrayal">Betrayal</a></span></h3>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0e/Gow_Betrayal_Poster_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230628092840" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <p><b>Part I</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/16/Legionnaires_gow_betrayal.webp/revision/latest?cb=20240421022744" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Legionnaires gow betrayal" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="132" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Legionnaires gow betrayal.webp" data-image-key="Legionnaires_gow_betrayal.webp" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/16/Legionnaires_gow_betrayal.webp/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240421022744"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/16/Legionnaires_gow_betrayal.webp/revision/latest?cb=20240421022744" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Legionnaires gow betrayal" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/16/Legionnaires_gow_betrayal.webp/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240421022744" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="132" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Legionnaires gow betrayal.webp" data-image-key="Legionnaires_gow_betrayal.webp" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/16/Legionnaires_gow_betrayal.webp/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240421022744"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Since the death of his brother <a href="/wiki/Deimos" title="Deimos">Deimos</a>, Kratos has isolated himself from the other <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a> and spent most of his time helping <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a> in conquering Greece. He, along together with the <a href="/wiki/Kratos%27_Army" title="Kratos' Army">Spartan Army</a> carried out an attack on a city, and this action angered the Gods, so in the midst of the struggle, Kratos is attacked by <a href="/wiki/Argos" title="Argos">Argos</a>, the pet of Zeus' wife, <a href="/wiki/Hera" title="Hera">Hera</a>.  
</p><p><b>Part II</b>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Argos" title="Argos">Argos</a> fled several times, but Kratos luckily manages to catch up to him by pushing him into a big ditch, where Argos was killed at the hands of a mysterious <a href="/wiki/Assassin" title="Assassin">Assassin</a>. When approached, the Assassin doesn't say anything and runs away, forcing Kratos to chase after him.  
</p><p><b>Part III</b>
</p><p>But in his pursuit, he is repeatedly hampered by Hades' forces, making him believe that the Assassin is <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a>, trying to ruin his reputation as the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a>. Kratos believes that all of this could make sense, considering the fact that he had killed Hades' wife, <a href="/wiki/Persephone" title="Persephone">Persephone</a>.  
</p><p><b>Part IV</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 152px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/48/Assassin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100119100205" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Assassin" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="152" height="206" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Assassin.jpg" data-image-key="Assassin.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/48/Assassin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100119100205"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/48/Assassin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100119100205" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Assassin" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/48/Assassin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100119100205" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="152" height="206" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Assassin.jpg" data-image-key="Assassin.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/48/Assassin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100119100205"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>After successfully eliminating Hades' troops, Kratos' pursuit was stopped by <a href="/wiki/Ceryx" title="Ceryx">Ceryx</a>, the son of <a href="/wiki/Hermes" title="Hermes">Hermes</a>, who allowed the Assassin to escape. By order of Zeus, Ceryx asks Kratos to stop his pursuit. 
</p><p><b>Part V</b>
</p><p>But Kratos doesn't care and immediately confronted Ceryx. While fighting him, Ceryx ultimately dies at Kratos' hands, and Kratos soon realizes that <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> will not remain silent on this deed. And so, the Assassin was never seen again after this.
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_8"></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War_II">God of War <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_II" title="God of War II">II</a></span></h3>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/11/GOW_II_Poster_1..jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230516220055" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block;
