<p><b>Part I</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Zora%26LoraII2.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20200927012541" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Zora&amp;LoraII2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Zora&amp;LoraII2.jpeg" data-image-key="Zora%26LoraII2.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Zora%26LoraII2.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20200927012541"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Zora%26LoraII2.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20200927012541" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Zora&amp;LoraII2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Zora%26LoraII2.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20200927012541" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Zora&amp;LoraII2.jpeg" data-image-key="Zora%26LoraII2.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/57/Zora%26LoraII2.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20200927012541"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos doesn't care about his misdeeds and he continues <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>'s war campaign. He ordered his army to attack <a href="/wiki/Rhodes" title="Rhodes">Rhodes</a>, the major <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greek</a> port city. <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a> begs Kratos to stop, because the <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Gods of Olympus</a> have started to become furious with him for his destructive behaviour, and she would no longer be able to protect him. But once again, Kratos ignored her warning, telling her he didn't need her protection, before he descended to Earth, where he helps his Spartan Army destroy the city of Rhodes. In the middle of the battle, an eagle suddenly appears and drains a portion of Kratos’ godly power, reducing him to normal human size, which the Spartan believes is Athena’s doing. This power is then bestowed on the <a href="/wiki/Colossus_of_Rhodes" title="Colossus of Rhodes">Colossus of Rhodes</a>, bringing it to life and making it fight against Kratos and his Spartan Army.
</p><p>Even so, Kratos still possessed most of his godly power, allowing him to defeat the enemies before him with little effort. However, he had a hard time dealing with the Colossus, due to its sheer size and titanic strength. As a result, <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> bestows Kratos with the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a>, the very weapon that the had used to end the <a href="/wiki/Titanomachy" title="Titanomachy">Titanomachy</a>. Kratos asked why Zeus was helping him, to which Zeus replied that what he did was for the good of <a href="/wiki/Mount_Olympus" title="Mount Olympus">Olympus</a>. Kratos, not caring about Zeus’ cryptic answer, went to get the Blade of Olympus. He drained his remaining godly power into the Blade, rendering him <a href="/wiki/Greek_Mortals" title="Greek Mortals">mortal</a> once more but allowing him to effectively battle the Colossus.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3b/Colosus3.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20110303150646" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Colosus3" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Colosus3.JPG" data-image-key="Colosus3.JPG" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3b/Colosus3.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110303150646"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3b/Colosus3.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20110303150646" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Colosus3" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3b/Colosus3.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110303150646" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Colosus3.JPG" data-image-key="Colosus3.JPG" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3b/Colosus3.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110303150646"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>With this, he started destroying the Colossus' foundations from within, and in the end, succeeded in conquering the animated statue. Kratos shouted into the sky, asking if the <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a> needed any more proof than this to see that they could not stop him, not noticing the Colossus collapsing behind him. The giant statue’s hand fell and crushed him, destroying his armour and knocking the Blade of Olympus away from him. Mortally injured without the power of the Gods, Kratos knew his only hope for survival lay with the Blade. He slowly stumbled his way towards the Blade of Olympus, trying to retrieve it. However, before he made it to the Blade, the same eagle that took his powers appeared and revealed itself as Zeus.
</p><p>Zeus had planned all of this from the beginning, deliberately making Kratos sacrifice his godly power into the Blade in order to force Kratos to surrender and submit to him. He was afraid that Kratos would try to kill him like he had done to Ares. Feeling betrayed, an angry Kratos refuses to submit, claiming that the choices the Gods gave were as useless as the Gods themselves. Zeus then impales Kratos with the Blade of Olympus. After leaving Kratos to die, Zeus uses the power of the Blade of Olympus to kill everyone present in the battle of Rhodes. Horrified and enraged, Kratos swore revenge against Zeus for his betrayal before dying.
</p><p>Because of his death, Kratos is dragged down into the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a> once again. As he is pulled into <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a>’ depths, he receives a visit from the Titaness <a href="/wiki/Gaia" title="Gaia">Gaia</a>. As she appeared before him, Gaia explains that she had watched over Kratos his entire life. She asks Kratos to help the <a href="/wiki/Titans" title="Titans">Titans</a> escape their confinement in exchange for helping him take his revenge against Zeus. Gaia informed him that the only way to defeat Zeus is to use the power of the <a href="/wiki/Sisters_of_Fate" title="Sisters of Fate">Sisters of Fate</a>, who have the power to alter the fate of every God, Beast, or Titan. Only with that power can Kratos change his fate.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/41/Kratos_dead.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100912131753" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos dead" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="134" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos dead.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_dead.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/41/Kratos_dead.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100912131753"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/41/Kratos_dead.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100912131753" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos dead" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/41/Kratos_dead.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100912131753" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="134" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos dead.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_dead.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/41/Kratos_dead.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100912131753"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><b>Part II</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/00/Pegasus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080713173837" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Pegasus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="158" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Pegasus.jpg" data-image-key="Pegasus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/00/Pegasus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080713173837"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/00/Pegasus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080713173837" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Pegasus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/00/Pegasus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080713173837" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="158" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Pegasus.jpg" data-image-key="Pegasus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/00/Pegasus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080713173837"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Refusing to die, Kratos agreed to help Gaia, who healed his wounds before he began attacking the Underworld's hands that ensnared him, and managed to climb out of the Underworld once again. Rising from the dead for a second time, he found himself back in the city of Rhodes. Kratos commands the <a href="/wiki/Last_Spartan" title="Last Spartan">last Spartan warrior</a> to return to Sparta and prepare for battle. He then rode the <a href="/wiki/Pegasus" title="Pegasus">Pegasus</a> prepared by Gaia and headed for Olympus to seek his revenge. However, partway there, Gaia informs Kratos that he can no longer enter Olympus, due to him not being a God anymore. Instead, Gaia orders Kratos to find the Sisters of Fate and use their power to travel back in time to the moment where Zeus betrayed him.  
</p><p>That way, Kratos can take the Blade of Olympus and use it to kill Zeus. And so, he set out for the <a href="/wiki/Island_of_Creation" title="Island of Creation">Island of Creation</a>, where the Sisters of Fate reside. When passing through the ice mountains which is the place Titan <a href="/wiki/Typhon" title="Typhon">Typhon</a> was imprisoned, Pegasus was crushed under Typhon's hand, leaving Kratos no other choice but to find a way to free him. He ventured across the mountains and coincidentally encountered <a href="/wiki/Prometheus" title="Prometheus">Prometheus</a>.
</p><p>Prometheus is seen being chained and his body torn apart by an eagle, having been imprisoned by Zeus after being caught stealing the <a href="/wiki/Primordial_Fire" title="Primordial Fire">Primordial Fire</a> and gave it to mortals. As a punishment for his actions, Prometheus was tied up on the rocks to then have his organs eaten by a giant eagle and at night, they would grow back to be eaten again the next day. Prometheus begged Kratos to free him from his torture.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0a/Typhonsbane1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080717233543" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Typhonsbane1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="139" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Typhonsbane1.jpg" data-image-key="Typhonsbane1.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0a/Typhonsbane1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080717233543"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0a/Typhonsbane1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080717233543" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Typhonsbane1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0a/Typhonsbane1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080717233543" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="139" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Typhonsbane1.jpg" data-image-key="Typhonsbane1.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0a/Typhonsbane1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080717233543"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos steals the <a href="/wiki/Typhon%27s_Bane" title="Typhon's Bane">Typhon's Bane</a> from Typhon and uses it to break the chains that held Prometheus, dropping him into the Primordial Fire and burning him alive, freeing him from his endless torment. Gaining great strength from the ashes of Prometheus, Kratos is imbued with the power of the Titans. Using that power, Kratos knocked Typhon’s hand away and released Pegasus, continuing his journey to the Island of Creation. But as he made his way towards the island, a swarm of <a href="/wiki/Griffin" title="Griffin">Griffins</a> attacked the moment they saw Pegasus, forcing Kratos to fend them off. When Kratos was about to arrive at the Island of Creation, a Griffin succeeded in weakening Pegasus and he is forced to make a death-defying leap towards the Island of Creation.
</p><p>Luckily, he was saved by using the Blades of Athena to latch onto the rocks and climb onto solid ground. To reach the <a href="/wiki/Palace_of_the_Fates" title="Palace of the Fates">Palace of Fates</a>, Kratos had to use the <a href="/wiki/Steeds_of_Time" title="Steeds of Time">Steeds of Time</a>. Exploring the Island of Creation, Kratos asked Gaia's reason for helping him, and Gaia told him about the <a href="/wiki/Titanomachy" title="Titanomachy">Great War</a> that made the Titans holds a grudge against Zeus to this day. Armed with this knowledge, Kratos reaches the Steeds of Time and realized that in order to control the horses, a special key, kept by <a href="/wiki/Theseus" title="Theseus">Theseus</a>, was needed. For that, he went to find the key and encountered Theseus, who immediately laughed out loud when he learned of Kratos' intention to kill Zeus.
</p><p><b>Part III</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest?cb=20201012233155" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Theseus vs Kratos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Theseus vs Kratos.png" data-image-key="Theseus_vs_Kratos.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201012233155"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest?cb=20201012233155" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Theseus vs Kratos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201012233155" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Theseus vs Kratos.png" data-image-key="Theseus_vs_Kratos.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201012233155"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Theseus knew that Kratos no longer has the powers of a God, so he challenges him to a fight, thinking he will easily beat Kratos. But quickly thereafter, Kratos' power frightened Theseus and he summoned a hoard of monsters to fight for him. Kratos used Typhon's Bane to force Theseus down and then kill him by crushing his head with the Horse Keeper’s door. After Theseus' death, Kratos takes the <a href="/wiki/Horse_Keeper%27s_Key" title="Horse Keeper's Key">Horse Keeper's Key</a> attached to the door and uses it to move the Steeds of Time, bringing the Island of Creation closer to the Palace of Fates. During this journey, he was warned by a statue of <a href="/wiki/Lahkesis" title="Lahkesis">Lahkesis</a>, one of the Sisters of Fate, that Kratos' fate has been shaped and cannot be changed, but Kratos doesn't listen and destroys the statue, before then continuing journey through a swamp, where he reunited with <a href="/wiki/Alrik" title="Alrik">Alrik</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Barbarians" title="Barbarians">Barbarian</a> King. 
</p><p>It is revealed that Alrik escaped Hades' torment and went on a long journey headed for the Island of Creation for two reasons, to change his fate and to further get revenge on Kratos. For that, the two of them once again engaged in a fierce battle and Alrik summons the souls of the dead, including the soul of the <a href="/wiki/Captain" title="Captain">Boat Captain</a> Kratos had killed over thirteen years prior. However, in the end, Kratos manages to eliminate this enemies, seize Alrik's <a href="/wiki/Barbarian_Hammer" title="Barbarian Hammer">Barbarian Hammer</a>, and use it to crush his skull, killing him once more. Continuing the journey to Palace of Fates, he must face <a href="/wiki/Cerberus" title="Cerberus">Cerberus</a> and obtain the <a href="/wiki/Golden_Fleece" title="Golden Fleece">Golden Fleece</a> from him, an enchanted armour which he later used to kill <a href="/wiki/Euryale" title="Euryale">Euryale</a>, <a href="/wiki/Medusa" title="Medusa">Medusa</a>'s sister, and take her head.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240221033650" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Perseus with his Sling" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Perseus with his Sling.jpg" data-image-key="Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240221033650"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240221033650" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Perseus with his Sling" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240221033650" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Perseus with his Sling.jpg" data-image-key="Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240221033650"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>While he was there, Kratos also met <a href="/wiki/Perseus" title="Perseus">Perseus</a>, his half-brother, trapped in the bathhouse. Perseus wished to see the Fates in order to resurrect his wife, <a href="/wiki/Andromeda" title="Andromeda">Andromeda</a>. However, he became trapped in the bathhouse instead. Thinking the arrival of Kratos is a trial given to him by the Fates, Perseus challenges Kratos to a duel, hoping the Sisters of Fate would witness it and give him a chance to revive his wife. Or if not, at least he would be known as the person who managed to kill the Ghost of Sparta. But in fact, Perseus is no match for Kratos, and although he can make himself invisible with Hades’ helmet, Kratos easily attacked and then threw him into a large hook, impaling and killing him. Taking Perseus' <a href="/wiki/Shield_of_Perseus" title="Shield of Perseus">Shield</a>, Kratos uses it to open access to the lowlands, where he realized that to reach the Palace of Fates, he had to cross a great chasm. Before he could cross, he was accosted by <a href="/wiki/Icarus" title="Icarus">Icarus</a>, now an old man who at this point had lost his sanity.
</p><p>This happened because previously, Icarus had died and entered the Underworld, where he was tortured relentlessly until he lost his sanity. After spending dozens of years repairing his wings, he finally managed to escape from the Underworld, and tried to reach the Sisters of Fate to change his destiny. During this meeting, Icarus tries to stop Kratos' attempts to find the Sisters of Fate, saying that it was a trial he was given, rambling on about how Kratos will not make it across the great chasm, while he himself will succeed by using its wings. Hearing this, Kratos plans to use <a href="/wiki/Icarus_Wings" title="Icarus Wings">Icarus' wings</a> to cross the great abyss, but Icarus resisted and both of them fell into the abyss.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dd/Icarus_4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100729225036" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Icarus 4" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="125" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Icarus 4.jpg" data-image-key="Icarus_4.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dd/Icarus_4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100729225036"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dd/Icarus_4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100729225036" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Icarus 4" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dd/Icarus_4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100729225036" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="125" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Icarus 4.jpg" data-image-key="Icarus_4.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dd/Icarus_4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100729225036"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos struggles briefly with Icarus and tore off both of his wings, letting him fall once more into the Underworld, while he managed to fly to safety by landing on Atlas. On his way back to the surface, Kratos broke some of the chains that bound <a href="/wiki/Atlas" title="Atlas">Atlas</a>' body, lightening some of the burden and catching the Titan’s attention. Noticing Kratos' presence, Atlas became furious, considering Kratos was the one who chained his body to the Earth when facing <a href="/wiki/Persephone" title="Persephone">Persephone</a>. Atlas tries to crush Kratos, but then stops his attempts after learning that Kratos is now the enemy of Zeus, and he even plans to change his destiny for the sake of killing the God.
</p><p><b>Part IV</b>
</p><p>After telling Kratos how Zeus created Blade of Olympus during the Great War and used it to drive the Titans into the depths of Tartarus, Atlas gives Kratos some of his powers and brings him back to the surface. Using Icarus' wings, Kratos arrives at the Palace of Fates. There, he forced two scholars to read incantations and sacrifice themselves as a condition for meeting the Sisters of Fate, before they met an ordinary soldier trying to reach the Sisters of Fate himself, forcing Kratos to confront him in a very dimly lit room. Kratos managed to defeat him and throw him out of the window, only to discover that it was the Last Spartan. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/2f/LastSpartan2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100504161316" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="LastSpartan2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="136" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="LastSpartan2.jpg" data-image-key="LastSpartan2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/2f/LastSpartan2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100504161316"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/2f/LastSpartan2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100504161316" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="LastSpartan2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/2f/LastSpartan2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100504161316" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="136" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="LastSpartan2.jpg" data-image-key="LastSpartan2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/2/2f/LastSpartan2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100504161316"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>When Kratos demands to know why the soldier did not return to Sparta, the Last Spartan told him that Sparta has been destroyed, and that Zeus was responsible. After killing Kratos, Zeus came to the city of Sparta and destroyed it. The Spartan people called out for Kratos to help them, but he never came. This left the Last Spartan no choice but to take a long journey to the Palace of Fates to reach the Sisters of Fate and change the fate of the city and Sparta. Before breathing his last breath, the Spartan soldier placed his hope on Kratos. The death of the Spartan warrior enrages Kratos, who calls Zeus a coward and demanded he come down and face him. Amidst this despair, the <a href="/wiki/Kraken" title="Kraken">Kraken</a> came up from behind and grabbed Kratos. The Spartan struggled against the beast’s grip, but proved unable to free himself as the Kraken began crushing him.
</p><p>At that moment, Kratos experienced a vision of Sparta in ruins, where he would see <a href="/wiki/Lysandra" title="Lysandra">Lysandra</a> (Gaia in disguise) standing on a hill. Kratos apologized to his wife and begged her to forgive him. Gaia encourages him to continue the struggle, for if Kratos surrenders, then Zeus will send his soul to Hades to be tortured for eternity. Furthermore, Gaia informs him that the Titans want Kratos to lead them in battle against the Gods of Olympus, before empowering him with an even stronger <a href="/wiki/Rage_of_the_Titans" title="Rage of the Titans">Rage of the Titans</a>. With mounting anger, Kratos manages to free himself from the kraken’s grip and kill it. Using the <a href="/wiki/Phoenix" title="Phoenix">Phoenix</a> that he freed from the <a href="/wiki/Phoenix_Chamber" title="Phoenix Chamber">Phoenix Chamber</a>, Kratos finally reaches the main shrine of the Sisters of Fate. Kratos enters the shrine and encounters one of the Sisters, Lahkesis. <a href="/wiki/Lahkesis" title="Lahkesis">Lahkesis</a> him tells that destiny can only be shaped by the Sisters of Fate, and that Kratos was never fated to kill Zeus.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/ec/Lahkesis_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100731033139" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Lahkesis 1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="125" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Lahkesis 1.jpg" data-image-key="Lahkesis_1.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/ec/Lahkesis_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100731033139"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/ec/Lahkesis_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100731033139" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Lahkesis 1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/ec/Lahkesis_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100731033139" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="125" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Lahkesis 1.jpg" data-image-key="Lahkesis_1.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/ec/Lahkesis_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100731033139"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In fact, Kratos' presence there was also part of the destiny created by the Sisters of Fate. Refusing to believe Lahkesis, Kratos retorted that his destiny was formed because of his own doing, threatening to kill her if Lahkesis did not let him pass, getting the two involved in a fight. When Kratos almost succeeded in defeating her, Lahkesis summons her sister, <a href="/wiki/Atropos" title="Atropos">Atropos</a>, who then takes Kratos to the past, to his battle with Ares. Atropos tries to destroy the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_the_Gods" title="Blade of the Gods">Blade of the Gods</a>, the sword Kratos used to kill Ares, so that Kratos would die at the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a>’s hand, but this effort is quickly thwarted by Kratos, and the two return to the present in the <a href="/wiki/Temple_of_Lahkesis" title="Temple of Lahkesis">Temple of Lahkesis</a>. Lahkesis is annoyed by this failed attempt and attacks Kratos once again, only now being assisted by Atropos from behind the room’s mirrors.
</p><p>After a long and fierce battle, Kratos managed to trap Lahkesis and Atropos in the mirror and destroys it, imprisoning them forever. Kratos then continued his journey to meet the last Sister of Fate, <a href="/wiki/Clotho" title="Clotho">Clotho</a>. Due to her gigantic, misshapen body being covered in a multitude of arms, Kratos first had to pin her many limbs down in order to climb up and reach her head, before he impaled her through her skull and killed her. The deaths of the Fates gave Kratos a chance to change his destiny by using the <a href="/wiki/Mirrors_of_Destiny" title="Mirrors of Destiny">Mirror of Destiny</a> located in the <a href="/wiki/Loom_Chamber" title="Loom Chamber">Loom Chamber</a>. He returns to the time when Zeus betrayed him, and, having regained his godly powers, immediately attacked Zeus as he was killing the Kratos from the past.
</p><p><b>Part V</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9f/Summit4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100723195049" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Summit4" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="125" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Summit4.jpg" data-image-key="Summit4.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9f/Summit4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100723195049"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9f/Summit4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100723195049" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Summit4" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9f/Summit4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100723195049" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="125" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Summit4.jpg" data-image-key="Summit4.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9f/Summit4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100723195049"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Zeus was surprised by Kratos' presence and assumed that the Sisters of Fate had helped him, but while pulling the Blade of Olympus, Kratos informed that the Sisters of Fate were dead. This made Zeus realize that he had underestimated Kratos and immediately attacked him. The two of them engaged in a battle in the sky and landed on the <a href="/wiki/Summit_of_Sacrifice" title="Summit of Sacrifice">Summit of Sacrifice</a>, where <a href="/wiki/Rhea" title="Rhea">Rhea</a> had given her children to Cronos for him to consume. It was also here that Rhea saved baby Zeus' life by tricking <a href="/wiki/Cronos" title="Cronos">Cronos</a> into eating a stone. In his full God form, Zeus summons an army of <a href="/wiki/Siren" title="Siren">Sirens</a> and throws thunderbolts, but Kratos manages to fight back by paralyzing him with the Sirens’ screams.
</p><p>Kratos then impaled Zeus' hand with the Blade of Olympus, causing him to shrink back to normal size. In a very intense battle, Zeus seized the Blade of Olympus from Kratos, but the Spartan soon reclaimed it before stabbing and throwing Zeus into a pillar. Kratos attempts to knock the pillar onto Zeus, but Zeus manages to destroy it and this time, he uses the power of his lightning to weaken Kratos. Feigning defeat, Kratos claimed to surrender to Zeus and dropped the Blade of Olympus, begging Zeus to kill him and release him from his suffering. Zeus returned to human size and picks up the Blade of Olympus, saying he would end the Spartan’s life, but that his torment was just about to begin.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c9/Athena_%285%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191002071920" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Athena (5)" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Athena (5).jpg" data-image-key="Athena_%285%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c9/Athena_%285%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20191002071920"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c9/Athena_%285%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191002071920" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Athena (5)" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c9/Athena_%285%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20191002071920" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Athena (5).jpg" data-image-key="Athena_%285%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c9/Athena_%285%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20191002071920"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>However, Kratos quickly dodged the incoming attack and overpowered Zeus once more. When Zeus fell powerless, Kratos took the Blade of Olympus and prepared to deliver the finishing blow. But his attempt to kill Zeus was thwarted by Athena, who suddenly appeared and blocked the attack, begging Kratos to stop. Zeus took advantage of this situation and tried to escape, claiming that Kratos had started a war that he couldn't win. Before Zeus escaped, Kratos made one last effort to kill him, pushing Athena away and charging at Zeus. But when Kratos thrust his sword forward, Athena jumped in front of it, taking the blow meant for her father.
</p><p>Zeus managed to escape, while Kratos, horrified by what he had done, asked why Athena sacrificed herself. Athena replied that she had done it for the safety of Olympus. Furthermore, Athena revealed that the reason Zeus wanted to kill Kratos was because he was afraid that what happened to his father would happen again. Ouranus was killed by Cronos; Cronos was overthrown by, Zeus; and now, Zeus feared being killed by his own son: Kratos. Zeus' main intention was to break the Cycle of Patricide. Kratos was shocked by this sudden revelation, and before taking her last breath, Athena begs Kratos to stop seeking revenge, warning him that all the Gods of Olympus would unite against him and that if Zeus died, the world would be destroyed. 
</p><p>At this point, Kratos had succumbed to his madness, and he vowed that if all of Olympus would stand against him, then all of Olympus would die, before Athena passed away. After this, he used the Fates’ Loom Chamber once again and traveled back in time to the Great War. Kratos brings the Titans with him to the present day in Ryder to face the Gods. Meanwhile, Zeus, still injured from his fight with Kratos, held a meeting with the other Gods to join forces to face the Ghost of Sparta. At that instant, <a href="/wiki/Mount_Olympus" title="Mount Olympus">Mount Olympus</a> started to shake and when the Gods looked down, they saw a very terrible sight: the Titans were climbing up the mountain with Kratos on Gaia's shoulders. Armed with the Blade of Olympus, he shouted at his father, declaring that his son had come back, and that the end of Olympus was at hand.
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_9"></div></div><h3><span class="mw-headline" id="God_of_War_III">God of War <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_III" title="God of War III">III</a></span></h3>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/dc/GOW_III_Poster_1..jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230916143711" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/GOW_III_Poster_3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230516222352" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f0/GOW_III_Poster_5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230516222614" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 300px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/78/GOW_III_Poster_6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230516222730" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block;
