bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090802120718" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GOW 3 Kratos ( in game picture )" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20090802120718" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GOW 3 Kratos ( in game picture ).jpg" data-image-key="GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5b/GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20090802120718"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Furthermore, he was initially willing to spare <a href="/wiki/Helios" title="Helios">Helios</a> and giving him only one and final chance to help him find the <a href="/wiki/Flame_of_Olympus" title="Flame of Olympus">Flame of Olympus</a> and only resorting to killing him after Helios remained defiant and tried to cruelly trick him. Reminded of his own daughter later on, Kratos developed a strong bond with <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a> and was unwilling to sacrifice her to acquire the power needed to kill Zeus and destroy <a href="/wiki/Mount_Olympus" title="Mount Olympus">Olympus</a> entirely. Her sacrifice affected him dearly, causing him to bitterly lament she died for his vengeance and being inspired by her to discover the power of <a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a>, and it was the fact that her sacrifice was in a sense meaningless that finally overcame his desire for vengeance and sacrifice himself to release Hope for humanity as Pandora had wished. 
</p><p><b>Norse Era</b>
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/97/God-of-war-atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180724161833" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God-of-war-atreus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God-of-war-atreus.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/97/God-of-war-atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180724161833"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/97/God-of-war-atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180724161833" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God-of-war-atreus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/97/God-of-war-atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180724161833" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God-of-war-atreus.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/97/God-of-war-atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180724161833"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>During his time in the <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Norse Pantheon</a>, Kratos has accepted full responsibility for his actions in <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a>, displaying extreme sadness and regret, and at times even falling into a state of depression, when confronted about his past behavior. He also now dreads being called the "<b>Ghost of Sparta</b>", angrily telling <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a> not to call him that. This remorse and shame is due to the fact that Kratos has realized how meaningless and hollow vengeance feels, as despite succeeding in killing <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Olympians" title="Olympians">Olympians</a>, it amounted to nothing but burdening Kratos with the ultimate sin of leaving Greece near-completely destroyed and gave him absolutely no solace or joy, causing him to genuinely regret killing his father, realizing how horrible and selfish the act was. He shows genuine empathy towards <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a> for attempting to get revenge on <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a>, after learning how she ruined his life by taking away his ability to feel, viewing it as similar to his old quest for revenge against Zeus, and tries to talk him out of it, understanding that Freya only did what she did out of love, even if it was misguided and overprotective, and is willing to kill him only when he attempts to do so, wishing to end the cycle of children killing their parents.
</p><p>At first, Kratos saw the godhood of him and his son as a curse, going to great lengths to cover up his past as a <a href="/wiki/God" class="mw-redirect" title="God">God</a> from <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a> and at first wishing that Atreus would just live as a normal human. However, after seeing how his secrecy nearly killed his son, Kratos came to terms with the fact that Gods, including him and his son, have the responsibility with the power they have to not be reckless. As such, Kratos becomes the voice of reason towards Atreus when his godhood makes Atreus arrogant and ruthless—which concerned the former as he used to be like that, eventually successfully getting through him. His love for his son proved to be Kratos' redeeming point, as despite initially attempting to hide his past, realizing that his secrecy would only lead to Atreus suffering allowed him to overcome his shame and anguish over his past and confess to Atreus a summary of everything he did back in Greece. He was even willing to take up the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a> in order to save his son, despite his tormented feelings over his past and strong attempts to leave it be.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f2/GOD_OF_WAR_%282018%29_Athena.png/revision/latest?cb=20180421112048" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="GOD OF WAR (2018) Athena" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="105" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="GOD OF WAR (2018) Athena.png" data-image-key="GOD_OF_WAR_%282018%29_Athena.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f2/GOD_OF_WAR_%282018%29_Athena.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180421112048"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f2/GOD_OF_WAR_%282018%29_Athena.png/revision/latest?cb=20180421112048" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GOD OF WAR (2018) Athena" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f2/GOD_OF_WAR_%282018%29_Athena.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180421112048" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="105" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GOD OF WAR (2018) Athena.png" data-image-key="GOD_OF_WAR_%282018%29_Athena.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f2/GOD_OF_WAR_%282018%29_Athena.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180421112048"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>While Kratos still resents the <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Gods of Olympus</a>, as displayed by his cold response to the spirit of <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>, and distrusts divine beings, he has become much more reasonable in dealing with them. Kratos shows no desire to oppose the <a href="/wiki/Norse_Gods" title="Norse Gods">Norse Gods</a>, simply wishing to avoid interactions with them, having come to realize that the consequences of killing a God can be catastrophic for the world around him and not wishing to repeat what he had done in Greece, and is even willing to accept them as allies should they prove worthy of his trust. Kratos also willingly trusted Mimir, after the latter showed genuine desire to help him and his son and eventually came to be fond of him later on, confiding in him his deepest doubts and darkest secrets, and viewing him as a brother figure, even calling him "brother" once and eventually getting interested in Mimir's own life and struggles such as his relationship with Sigrun, whereas he would be unconcerned with other's affairs before.     
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180524041421" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God-of-war-freya" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180524041421"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180524041421" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God-of-war-freya" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180524041421" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180524041421"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Despite having always been on the edge with Freya and growing to distrust her completely after learning she was a God, he was able to come to trust and care for her after she saved his son, and even learning Freya had bewitched Mimir to prevent them from learning Baldur's weakness did not dwindle Kratos' reasonable side, as he cared enough for her to fight Baldur for her and later saved her life by killing Baldur when he attempted to choke her to death. He did not harm her when she swore vengeance on him, understanding the pain she feels, having felt the same after killing his family, and believes that time will eventually cause her to forgive him. Once Kratos and Freya make amends, his trust further deepens, even admitting to Mimir, he valued her as a friend though he expressed his doubts about whether she saw him as a friend or simply found him useful, only for Mimir to scoff at the doubts. Moreover, upon meeting the real <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a>, and having heard of his good deeds, he also came to deeply respect and trust him and took the time to listen to his advice, as the latter was genuine in his desire to help Kratos come to terms with his past in Valhalla and offer wisdom. He also accepted <a href="/wiki/Freyr" title="Freyr">Freyr</a>, and later on <a href="/wiki/Sif" title="Sif">Sif</a> and <a href="/wiki/Thr%C3%BAd" title="Thrúd">Thrúd</a> as allies once he saw their goodness or they managed to redeem themselves.     
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/Kratos_blows_Gjallarhorn.png/revision/latest?cb=20221127004724" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos blows Gjallarhorn" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos blows Gjallarhorn.png" data-image-key="Kratos_blows_Gjallarhorn.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/Kratos_blows_Gjallarhorn.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221127004724"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/Kratos_blows_Gjallarhorn.png/revision/latest?cb=20221127004724" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos blows Gjallarhorn" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/Kratos_blows_Gjallarhorn.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221127004724" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos blows Gjallarhorn.png" data-image-key="Kratos_blows_Gjallarhorn.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/72/Kratos_blows_Gjallarhorn.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221127004724"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Over the years since their last journey, the bond between his companions had only grew stronger, but also making efforts to further being more inclined to show affection through both gestures and words. However, Kratos was still not without his flaws, struggling with Atreus' increasing independence due to how much it contrasted the discipline taught to him and his <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> brethren, causing him to still retain a degree of stern distance and commanding presence over his son. This was also due to Kratos having seen prophecy in <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tunheim" title="Jötunheim">Jötunheim</a> foretelling his death, becoming more determined to prepare him to survive on his own. With it, he even shows a degree of hypocrisy, as he is angered by the revelation that Atreus was sneaking out without permission, despite the fact Kratos too had kept secrets for so long from Atreus. Moreover, upon meeting <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a> and recognizing the latter's violent and destructive behavior and how he was being manipulated by <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a>, he developed sympathy towards him—likely viewing his situation as having been similar to his and Zeus' in the past—and tried to convince him to let go of his hatred and violent behavior by reminding him of his love for his daughter, eventually succeeding in getting through to him only for it to not amount to anything as Thor is callously killed by Odin for disobeying.  He eventually realized how much his attitude was wrong, toxic and cruel. This realization ultimately compelled Kratos to sincerely apologize to his son and finally show support of his decisions, culminating in Kratos accepting Atreus' path to leave the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Norse</a> lands to search for the <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Giants</a> and showing great pride that his son has matured and no longer requires him.
</p><p>On the other hand, Kratos initially refused to lead during <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a> because he was haunted by his past mistakes, where his reckless actions led to disaster. But by the end of this war, he realized that Gods could be both good and bad, which made him embrace his godhood. He accepted the responsibility of using his powers to help others but didn't want to be officially recognized as a God. Fearing he might fall back into his old ways again, he chose not to join Freya's council and decided to be a helpful God without holding any authority. After facing the trials of <a href="/wiki/Valhalla" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a> and receiving encouragement from <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a>, Mimir, Freya, and the <a href="/wiki/Valkyries" title="Valkyries">Valkyries</a>, Kratos came to greatly feel remorse for several meaningless murders he committed in Greece, such as the <a href="/wiki/Captain" title="Captain">Boat Captain</a> and <a href="/wiki/Helios" title="Helios">Helios</a>. He addressed his remorse while undergoing his trials in Valhalla to come to terms with his past life. He eventually realized that his actions of releasing <a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a> into Greece and helping the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a> were enough to atone for his sins. This led him to dedicate himself to again becoming the "God of War".
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest?cb=20231213194714" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Helios in gow Valhalla" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Helios in gow Valhalla.png" data-image-key="Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231213194714"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest?cb=20231213194714" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Helios in gow Valhalla" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231213194714" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Helios in gow Valhalla.png" data-image-key="Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231213194714"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_17"></div></div><h4><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War:_Ascension">In God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Ascension" title="God of War: Ascension">Ascension</a></span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3c/Orkos_Close-up.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130319210538" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Orkos Close-up" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="100" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Orkos Close-up.jpg" data-image-key="Orkos_Close-up.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3c/Orkos_Close-up.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130319210538"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3c/Orkos_Close-up.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130319210538" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Orkos Close-up" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3c/Orkos_Close-up.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130319210538" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="100" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Orkos Close-up.jpg" data-image-key="Orkos_Close-up.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/3c/Orkos_Close-up.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130319210538"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos starts by experiencing an illusion of being with his wife, <a href="/wiki/Lysandra" title="Lysandra">Lysandra</a>, at their home in <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>. The <a href="/wiki/The_Furies" title="The Furies">Furies</a> create this illusion, but <a href="/wiki/Orkos" title="Orkos">Orkos</a> helps Kratos see that it isn't real. This moment highlights Kratos' deep pain and his ability to recognize and reject deception. Orkos then tasks Kratos with finding the Oracle, <a href="/wiki/Aletheia" title="Aletheia">Aletheia</a>. Kratos' acceptance of this mission shows his willingness to seek the truth and break free from his ties to <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a>, driven by his desire for redemption. Upon reaching his destination, Kratos encounters <a href="/wiki/Castor_and_Pollux" title="Castor and Pollux">Castor and Pollux</a>. Their impatience leads to a fight, where Kratos' combat skills and fighting styles shine through.    
</p><p>He then finds Aletheia, who is dying from her injuries. She tells him about the <a href="/wiki/Eyes_of_Truth" title="Eyes of Truth">Eyes of Truth</a> and directs him to the island of <a href="/wiki/Delos" title="Delos">Delos</a>. This interaction shows a more thoughtful side of him. While traveling to Delos, Kratos meets Orkos again in a ship. Orkos reveals more about Ares' past, adding depth to Kratos' understanding of his situation and fueling his determination to break free. On the island of Delos, Kratos explores the ruins of <a href="/wiki/Statue_of_Apollo" title="Statue of Apollo">Apollo's Statue</a> and fights many enemies. He is once again deceived by the Furies, who create illusions of his dead wife and daughter <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a>, his <a href="/wiki/King_of_Sparta" title="King of Sparta">King</a>, and a <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> soldier. These illusions torment Kratos, reflecting his ongoing struggle with guilt and grief. 
</p><p>Unfortunately, Kratos is recaptured and tortured by the Furies in the <a href="/wiki/Prison_of_the_Damned" title="Prison of the Damned">Prison of the Damned</a> for two weeks. Despite their efforts to persuade him to return to Ares' service, Kratos remains defiant. His resilience and refusal to give up showcase his strong will. After defeating the Furies, Kratos returns to Sparta and meets Orkos (for the final time). Orkos asks Kratos to kill him to break the bond with Ares. Kratos complies, freeing himself but also restoring painful memories of killing his wife and child. This act highlights Kratos' inner conflict and the heavy burden of his past.
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_18"></div></div><h4><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War:_Chains_of_Olympus">In God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Chains_of_Olympus" title="God of War: Chains of Olympus">Chains of Olympus</a></span></h4>
<p>Kratos starts by helping the <a href="/wiki/Attica" title="Attica">Attica</a> warriors fight off the <a href="/wiki/Persians" title="Persians">Persian</a> forces and their <a href="/wiki/Persian_King" title="Persian King">king</a>. His relentless drive and combat skills are clear as he takes on both human soldiers and mythical creatures like the <a href="/wiki/Basilisk" title="Basilisk">Basilisk</a> without hesitation. After defeating the Persian king, Kratos notices the sky turning gray, signaling something ominous. In the city of <a href="/wiki/Marathon" title="Marathon">Marathon</a>, he battles shadow warriors, showing his ability to face both physical and supernatural threats. Kratos explores various temples and meets <a href="/wiki/Eos" title="Eos">Eos</a>, the Goddess of dawn. Through her, he learns about <a href="/wiki/Morpheus" title="Morpheus">Morpheus</a>, <a href="/wiki/Atlas" title="Atlas">Atlas</a>, and more. These encounters reveal Kratos' willingness to seek knowledge and understand the larger conflicts at play.  
</p><p>He also acquires the <a href="/wiki/Sun_Shield" title="Sun Shield">Sun Shield</a> and <a href="/wiki/Primordial_Fire" title="Primordial Fire">Primordial Fire</a>, demonstrating his resourcefulness. These items are crucial for his journey, highlighting his ability to adapt and use whatever tools are available. Hearing his daughter Calliope's flute is a deeply emotional moment for Kratos. It shows his vulnerable side and the pain he carries from losing his family. Kratos then enters the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a> and faces <a href="/wiki/Charon" title="Charon">Charon</a>, the ferryman of the dead. After being defeated and sent to <a href="/wiki/Tartarus" title="Tartarus">Tartarus</a>, he discovers <a href="/wiki/Gauntlet_of_Zeus" title="Gauntlet of Zeus">Zeus' Gauntlet</a>. This newfound power allows him to return and defeat Charon, showcasing his resilience and determination. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Calliope_and_kratos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100716003847" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Calliope and kratos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Calliope and kratos.jpg" data-image-key="Calliope_and_kratos.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Calliope_and_kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100716003847"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Calliope_and_kratos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100716003847" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Calliope and kratos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Calliope_and_kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100716003847" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Calliope and kratos.jpg" data-image-key="Calliope_and_kratos.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/54/Calliope_and_kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100716003847"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos suddenly decides to meet <a href="/wiki/Persephone" title="Persephone">Persephone</a> and learns about her tragic and sad life. Desperate to reunite with his daughter <a href="/wiki/Calliope" title="Calliope">Calliope</a>, he sacrifices his power, only to be betrayed by Persephone. This betrayal forces him to reclaim his strength and confront her, showing his ability to push himself even the deepest emotional manipulations. In the end, Kratos overcomes her challenges and defeats Persephone, chaining <a href="/wiki/Atlas" title="Atlas">Atlas</a> to the <a href="/wiki/Pillar_of_the_World" title="Pillar of the World">Pillar of the World</a>. However, despite him saving the <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greek</a> world, the Gods will not free him of his past nightmares.
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_19"></div></div><h4><span id="In_God_of_War_.282005.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War_(2005)">In God of War (<a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(2005)" title="God of War (2005)">2005</a>)</span></h4>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4f/Gow2005_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802134534" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow2005 2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow2005 2.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4f/Gow2005_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802134534"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4f/Gow2005_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250802134534" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow2005 2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4f/Gow2005_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802134534" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow2005 2.jpg" data-image-key="Gow2005_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4f/Gow2005_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250802134534"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>The game begins with Kratos standing on a cliff, contemplating suicide. This sets the stage for his character—a man consumed by guilt and despair, seeking an end to his suffering. The scene then shifts to Kratos battling the <a href="/wiki/Hydra" title="Hydra">Hydra</a> on a ship. Here, his combat skills and fierce determination are on full display. He fights with a brutal efficiency, showing no fear against the monstrous creature. After defeating the Hydra, Kratos talks to <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>. She tasks him with defeating <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a>, who is attacking her city. Kratos agrees because he is tired of his long service with the Gods. 
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/Athens" title="Athens">Athens</a>, Kratos fights countless enemies, showcasing his tactical brilliance and unyielding will. His encounters with the <a href="/wiki/Olympians" title="Olympians">Gods of Olympus</a> also reveals his complicated sense of duty towards them, adding depth to his character. Kratos meets the <a href="/wiki/Oracle_of_Athens" title="Oracle of Athens">Oracle of Athens</a> who is kidnapped by <a href="/wiki/Harpies" title="Harpies">Harpies</a>, and this fuels his determination to continue his quest. The appearance of the <a href="/wiki/Grave_Digger" title="Grave Digger">Grave Digger</a> also adds a bit of mystery while continuing his way. In the <a href="/wiki/Desert_of_Lost_Souls" title="Desert of Lost Souls">Desert</a> of Souls, Kratos finds a statue of Athena and blows the Titan's <a href="/wiki/Titan_Horn" title="Titan Horn">trumpet</a>. He then rides on the back of Cronos, showing his boldness and willingness to face immense challenges head-on. 
</p><p>Throughout his journey, Kratos acquires powerful items like the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Artemis" title="Blade of Artemis">Blade of Artemis</a> and <a href="/wiki/Poseidon%27s_Trident" title="Poseidon's Trident">Poseidon’s Trident</a>. These weapons symbolize his adaptability and increasing power as he faces new threats. Kratos then fell into the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a> because of Ares finding out that he is opening <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Box</a>. His escape and climbing back to the living world highlight his indomitable will and refusal to give up. In his final showdown with Ares, Kratos uses the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_the_Gods" title="Blade of the Gods">Blade of the Gods</a> to defeat him. This victory shows his strength, and strategic mind. However, even in this victory, he remains haunted by his past.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War:_Ghost_of_Sparta">In God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Ghost_of_Sparta" title="God of War: Ghost of Sparta">Ghost of Sparta</a></span></h4>
<p>During the events of "<b>Ghost of Sparta</b>", early in his tenure as the "<b>God of War</b>", Kratos was suffering from visions of his mother and brother, people he believed to be long dead. Despite <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>'s pleas to ignore these visions, Kratos ventured to find out the truth. Kratos first found his mother, who was old and ill, and is also cursed to forbid into telling Kratos about who his real father is. However, she reveals to him that his long lost brother is still alive all this time. This news fills Kratos with hope and guilt, as he has always blamed himself for <a href="/wiki/Deimos" title="Deimos">Deimos</a>' abduction by the <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a>. Sadly, <a href="/wiki/Callisto" title="Callisto">Callisto</a>'s transformation into a monster and her death deepen Kratos' hatred for the Gods and this boils his determination to save Deimos.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ac/Kratos_levando_porrada.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20110208111132" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos levando porrada" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="135" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos levando porrada.JPG" data-image-key="Kratos_levando_porrada.JPG" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ac/Kratos_levando_porrada.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110208111132"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ac/Kratos_levando_porrada.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20110208111132" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos levando porrada" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ac/Kratos_levando_porrada.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110208111132" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="135" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos levando porrada.JPG" data-image-key="Kratos_levando_porrada.JPG" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ac/Kratos_levando_porrada.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110208111132"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Traveling to <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>, Kratos faces his past. The visions of his younger self and the reactions of the Spartans to him as a God highlight his inner conflict. When encountering his another Spartan soldier again, this event also reveals a more vulnerable side of Kratos, showing that beneath his fierce exterior lies a man driven by the pain of his past. The loss of his camaraderie (because of <a href="/wiki/Erinys" title="Erinys">Erinys</a>' abuse) intensifies his quest, pushing him to confront his deepest fears and memories as he sets out to rescue Deimos. Beforehand, he also learns that Deimos is held in the <a href="/wiki/Domain_of_Death" title="Domain of Death">Domain of Death</a>, ruled by Thanatos. With the help from the Titaness <a href="/wiki/Thera" title="Thera">Thera</a>, Kratos fights his way from lots of obstacles.   
</p><p>Kratos later found his brother, Deimos, mentally broken and harboring a great rage towards Kratos for failing to save him during their childhood. His breaking point that destroyed any potential of happiness was during his battle against the God of Death, <a href="/wiki/Thanatos" title="Thanatos">Thanatos</a>. Throughout this, Deimos was eventually killed without mercy. This was the moment that sent Kratos down his spiral of utter hatred and madness, with the last person he ever cared about being stolen from him by the Gods. With the death of both his family, his hatred reached its highest peak after learning of their role in his mother’s and brother's suffering. As a result to all of this, he defiantly swore vengeance upon the <a href="/wiki/Olympians" title="Olympians">Gods of Olympus</a>. 
</p>
<div class="incontent_leaderboard"><div id="incontent_leaderboard_20"></div></div><h4><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War:_Betrayal">In God of War: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War:_Betrayal" title="God of War: Betrayal">Betrayal</a></span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a7/Undead_Soldiers_in_God_of_War_Betrayal.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240130164857" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Undead Soldiers in God of War Betrayal" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="93" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Undead Soldiers in God of War Betrayal.jpg" data-image-key="Undead_Soldiers_in_God_of_War_Betrayal.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a7/Undead_Soldiers_in_God_of_War_Betrayal.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240130164857"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a7/Undead_Soldiers_in_God_of_War_Betrayal.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240130164857" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Undead Soldiers in God of War Betrayal" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a7/Undead_Soldiers_in_God_of_War_Betrayal.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240130164857" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="93" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Undead Soldiers in God of War Betrayal.jpg" data-image-key="Undead_Soldiers_in_God_of_War_Betrayal.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a7/Undead_Soldiers_in_God_of_War_Betrayal.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240130164857"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Since the death of his brother <a href="/wiki/Deimos" title="Deimos">Deimos</a>, Kratos feels a lot of guilt. He isolates himself from the Gods and focuses on helping <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a> conquer an unnamed <a href="/wiki/Unnamed_Greek_City" title="Unnamed Greek City">Greek city</a>. This shows his inner struggle and grief. During an attack on a city with the Spartan Army, Kratos' actions anger the Gods, like <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hera" title="Hera">Hera</a>. He ends up fighting Argos, Hera's pet, showing his anger and combat skills. 
</p><p>Kratos then chases a mysterious <a href="/wiki/Assassin" title="Assassin">Assassin</a> who kills <a href="/wiki/Argos" title="Argos">Argos</a>, facing obstacles from Hades' forces along the way. He believes Hades is behind it, seeking more answers on why he is doing this. Defying Zeus' orders, Kratos confronts <a href="/wiki/Ceryx" title="Ceryx">Ceryx</a>, son of <a href="/wiki/Hermes" title="Hermes">Hermes</a>. This shows his rebellious nature and determination to find the answers. He doesn't care about the risks and continues to pursue justice. 
</p><p>The whole reason on why Zeus actually sends Ceryx is to deliver a message, wants to slow this relentless pursuit and lets Kratos understand the destruction he has already caused. The game then concludes as Kratos kills Ceryx and the <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan Soldiers</a> celebrate, but observing the dead God's body, he realizes that Zeus would eventually take action for this act of defiance.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War_II">In God of War <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_II" title="God of War II">II</a></span></h4>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Zeus_Threaten_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130110212320" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Zeus Threaten Kratos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="135" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Zeus Threaten Kratos.jpg" data-image-key="Zeus_Threaten_Kratos.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Zeus_Threaten_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130110212320"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Zeus_Threaten_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130110212320" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Zeus Threaten Kratos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Zeus_Threaten_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130110212320" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="135" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Zeus Threaten Kratos.jpg" data-image-key="Zeus_Threaten_Kratos.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Zeus_Threaten_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130110212320"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Even with Kratos as the new "<b>God of War</b>", he is still haunted by the memories of his family's death. Because of this, Kratos is more aggressive and relentless, often acting without considering the consequences. Kratos leads the <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> army to conquer <a href="/wiki/Rhodes" title="Rhodes">Rhodes</a>. <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>, his current ally right now, warns him to stop his destructive ways, but Kratos ignores her. <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a>, disguised as an eagle, drains Kratos of his godly powers and brings the <a href="/wiki/Colossus_of_Rhodes" title="Colossus of Rhodes">Colossus</a> of Rhodes to life. Even without his powers, Kratos fights enemies and the Colossus with sheer determination. He retrieves the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a>, using it to defeat the Colossus, but it collapses on him, leaving him severely injured. As Kratos lies dying, Zeus reveals his betrayal and kills him.   
</p><p>Sent to the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a>, Kratos is saved by <a href="/wiki/Gaia" title="Gaia">Gaia</a>, a Titaness, who tells him that Zeus feared him. Gaia advises Kratos to find the <a href="/wiki/Sisters_of_Fate" title="Sisters of Fate">Sisters of Fate</a> to change his destiny. Fueled by vengeance, Kratos escapes the Underworld and sets off on his journey. On his quest, Kratos encounters more <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Greek Gods</a>, battling them with his characteristic ruthlessness. He also learns later on that Zeus is his father, which deepens his sense of betrayal and rage. Determined to change his fate, Kratos eventually reaches the Sisters of Fate. He defeats them and forces them to send him back to the moment Zeus killed him. 
</p><p>Back in the past, Kratos confronts Zeus again, this time overpowering him. As Kratos is about to kill Zeus, Athena intervenes and sacrifices herself to save Zeus. She warns Kratos that all of Olympus will unite against him if he continues his quest for revenge. Unmoved, Kratos vows to destroy Zeus and the other gods. In the game's final scenes, Kratos allies with the <a href="/wiki/Titans" title="Titans">Titans</a> and leads them in an assault on <a href="/wiki/Mount_Olympus" title="Mount Olympus">Mount Olympus</a>, declaring war on the Gods. Right now, he is further driven by such intense anger as he seeks final revenge against Zeus and the <a href="/wiki/Olympians" title="Olympians">Gods of Olympus</a> once and for all.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War_III">In God of War <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_III" title="God of War III">III</a></span></h4>
<p>The story continues with Kratos, driven by an intense need for revenge against <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a>. Riding on the Titaness <a href="/wiki/Gaia" title="Gaia">Gaia</a>, he shows his relentless determination to climb <a href="/wiki/Mount_Olympus" title="Mount Olympus">Mount Olympus</a> and kill Zeus. Kratos' ruthless nature is clear when he fights <a href="/wiki/Poseidon" title="Poseidon">Poseidon</a>, the God of sea. He brutally kills Poseidon, causing massive floods, showing he doesn't care about the chaos he creates as long as he gets his revenge. Gaia then betrays Kratos, letting him fall into the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a>. Stripped of his powers, Kratos' sheer willpower keeps him going. With guidance from Athena, he regains his strength and continues his quest to defeat Zeus.  
</p><p>In the Underworld, Kratos' tenacity is evident. He defeats <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a>, reclaiming some of his powers. His perseverance, even in the face of death, highlights his unyielding spirit. Back on Olympus, Kratos' aggression is unrestrained. He kills <a href="/wiki/Helios" title="Helios">Helios</a>, plunging the world into darkness, and <a href="/wiki/Hermes" title="Hermes">Hermes</a>, causing a plague. His single-minded pursuit of revenge shows no concern for the devastating consequences. Kratos' softer side also appears with <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a>. He shows protective instincts and empathy, seeking to save her. Despite <a href="/wiki/Hephaestus" title="Hephaestus">Hephaestus</a>' trickery, Kratos has a strong awareness of others, while remaining focus on his goal. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e6/Gow_III.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100913075715" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Gow III" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Gow III.jpg" data-image-key="Gow_III.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e6/Gow_III.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100913075715"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e6/Gow_III.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100913075715" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Gow III" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e6/Gow_III.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100913075715" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Gow III.jpg" data-image-key="Gow_III.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e6/Gow_III.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100913075715"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos continues his vengeful rampage, killing <a href="/wiki/Hercules" title="Hercules">Hercules</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hera" title="Hera">Hera</a>, causing more chaos. Each death shows his unstoppable nature, driven solely by his hatred for the <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a>. The final battle with Zeus is fierce, reflecting Kratos' peak rage and desire for retribution. Inside Gaia's heart, he fights with relentless fury and ultimately kills Zeus. After Zeus' death, Kratos confronts his guilt and past sins. This reveals his inner struggle and potential for change. Guided by Pandora's spirit, he embraces hope and self-forgiveness, showing a glimmer of redemption. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>'s demand for the power of <a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a> leads Kratos to a final act of defiance. By impaling himself with the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a>, he releases hope into the <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greek world</a>, demonstrating a self-sacrificial side. This act highlights his complex personality, capable of change. As the story finishes, a post-credits scene shows the Blade abandoned on the ground, with a trail of blood leading to the cliff's edge, indicating that Kratos has survived and left, with his ultimate fate being unknown.
</p>
<h4><span id="In_God_of_War_.282018.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War_(2018)">In God of War (<a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(2018)" title="God of War (2018)">2018</a>)</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span><b><a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a></b>: "<i>You are just an animal! Passing on your cruelty and rage; you will never change!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Kratos</b>: "<i>Then you do not know me.</i>"</dd>
<dd>―<a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a> and Kratos</dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png/revision/latest?cb=20180513090315" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png" data-image-key="God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180513090315"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png/revision/latest?cb=20180513090315" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180513090315" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png" data-image-key="God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/God-of-war-kratos-and-atreus.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180513090315"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos, now living in the <a href="/wiki/Norse_Mythology" title="Norse Mythology">Norse</a> realm of <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a>, mourns the death of his wife <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Laufey</a>. He is now stern and a quiet man, struggling to raise his son <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>. Faye's last wish was for them to spread her ashes from the highest peak in all the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine realms</a>. Kratos and Atreus begin their journey. Kratos is harsh and distant, focused on teaching Atreus survival skills but not showing much affection. His strictness comes from his fear of his own violent past and wanting to protect Atreus. They are then attacked by <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a>, a strange God who can't feel pain. Kratos fights fiercely to protect Atreus, revealing his still-powerful warrior instincts. After defeating Baldur, Kratos becomes more cautious and determined to keep moving.   
</p><p>They meet <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a>, a kind witch who helps them. Kratos is wary and mistrustful, but he accepts her aid when Atreus falls ill. This shows Kratos' deep care for his son, even if he doesn't show it well. Kratos and Atreus continue their journey, encountering the friendly <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6rmungandr" title="Jörmungandr">World Serpent</a> and the helpful dwarves, <a href="/wiki/Sindri" title="Sindri">Sindri</a> and <a href="/wiki/Brok" title="Brok">Brok</a>. These interactions reveal Kratos' practical and sometimes humorous side, though he remains focused on their mission. They reach the mountain peak in Midgard and meet <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a>, a God of wisdom. Kratos' practical side shows when he decapitates Mimir to gain his knowledge, and his acceptance of unlikely allies reflects his commitment to fulfilling Faye's wish. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180701084234" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus.jpg" data-image-key="Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180701084234"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180701084234" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180701084234" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus.jpg" data-image-key="Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180701084234"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>When Atreus learns he is part-god, he becomes arrogant. Kratos is frustrated and worried, fearing Atreus might follow his dark path. He tries to teach Atreus humility and control, showing his protective instincts. Kratos goes to <a href="/wiki/Helheim" title="Helheim">Helheim</a> to save Atreus from an illness, confronting his past by retrieving the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a>. This painful journey shows Kratos' growth in accepting his past while striving to be better for Atreus. They finally confront Baldur. Despite Freya's pleas, Kratos kills Baldur to save her, showing his willingness to make hard decisions to protect others. This act demonstrates his evolving understanding of being a father and protector. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/God-of-War-Thor.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180513074812" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God-of-War-Thor" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God-of-War-Thor.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-War-Thor.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/God-of-War-Thor.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180513074812"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/God-of-War-Thor.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180513074812" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God-of-War-Thor" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/God-of-War-Thor.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180513074812" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God-of-War-Thor.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-War-Thor.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/47/God-of-War-Thor.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180513074812"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>At the highest peak in <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tunheim" title="Jötunheim">Jötunheim</a>, Kratos and Atreus spread Faye’s ashes. Kratos’ reverence shows his deep love for Faye and respect for her wishes. They also learn about their unique identities, which Kratos accepts. Returning to <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a>, Kratos begins to show more warmth towards Atreus. The journey has softened him, making him more open. They dream of <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>’s arrival, hinting at future challenges, but Kratos is now a more understanding and protective father.
</p>
<h4><span id="In_God_of_War_Ragnar.C3.B6k"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War_Ragnarök">In God of War <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="God of War Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a></span></h4>
<table class="cquote" style="margin:auto;">
<tbody><tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:20px; font-size:36px; font-family:'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight:bold; text-align:left; padding:3px;">“
</td>
<td valign="top" style="padding:3px;"><i><a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Son</a>, listen closely. You feel their pain because that is who you are. And you must never sacrifice that. Never. Not for anyone. I was wrong, Atreus. I was wrong. Open your heart. Open your heart to their suffering. That is your <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">mother's</a> wish, and mine as well. Today, son... Today, we will be better.</i>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" style="width:20px; font-size:36px; font-family:'Times New Roman', serif; font-weight:bold; text-align:right; padding:3px;">”
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="3" style="padding-top:10px;"><p style="font-size:smaller; text-align:right;"><cite style="font-style:normal;">–Kratos expressing remorse for his earlier indifference towards the suffering of civilians and encouraging <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a> and himself to help them</cite></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221117150732" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2.jpg" data-image-key="Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150732"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221117150732" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150732" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2.jpg" data-image-key="Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150732"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Three years after his quest to scatter his late wife's (<a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Faye</a>) ashes with <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>, Kratos has mellowed and softened significantly. While he still maintains his brusque, imposing demeanor, he proactively helps others and readily calls them friends, openly admitting that he cares for them. His bond with his son, Atreus, and the <a href="/wiki/Huldra" title="Huldra">Huldra</a> brothers has noticeably grown stronger. By the time his second journey begins, Kratos has matured to the point where he now properly addresses individuals by their names rather than pronouns, demonstrating his ability to maintain strong bonds of friendship and show tolerance towards his allies.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/14/God_of_war_ragnarok_sindri_house_meal_3840.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240107202945" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God of war ragnarok sindri house meal 3840" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God of war ragnarok sindri house meal 3840.jpg" data-image-key="God_of_war_ragnarok_sindri_house_meal_3840.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/14/God_of_war_ragnarok_sindri_house_meal_3840.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240107202945"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/14/God_of_war_ragnarok_sindri_house_meal_3840.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240107202945" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God of war ragnarok sindri house meal 3840" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/14/God_of_war_ragnarok_sindri_house_meal_3840.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240107202945" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God of war ragnarok sindri house meal 3840.jpg" data-image-key="God_of_war_ragnarok_sindri_house_meal_3840.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/14/God_of_war_ragnarok_sindri_house_meal_3840.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240107202945"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Aside from his consistent efforts to be there for his son, Kratos openly asks <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brok" title="Brok">Brok</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Sindri" title="Sindri">Sindri</a> for their opinions, takes their suggestions to heart, and is more than willing to comfort them when they are down. He also refuses to fight Freya because he still sees her as a friend, repeatedly holding himself back and sincerely helping her free herself in an effort to redeem himself in her eyes, despite knowing she might decide to kill him afterwards. He even spares <a href="/wiki/Heimdall" title="Heimdall">Heimdall</a>, despite the prophecy that Heimdall would slay Atreus, only resorting to killing him when Heimdall proves too insane to be intimidated by a warning. Finally, Kratos refuses to deliver the fatal blow to <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>.  
</p><p>Kratos also sets aside his pride to learn how to read and write runes from Atreus, and writes in his journal about how, while he would never actually admit it to him, he is proud of the man his son is becoming. The former "<b>God of War</b>" has even developed a dry sense of humor, often pointing out the repetitiveness in others' snide remarks. However, Kratos struggles with the fact that Atreus is becoming independent, not knowing how to react to this since, as he stated to Mimir, "<a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartans</a> are taught discipline". Despite this, Kratos maintains his stern behavior, authoritative attitude, and strict demeanor towards Atreus.
</p><p>Throughout the three years of <a href="/wiki/Fimbulwinter" title="Fimbulwinter">Fimbulwinter</a>, Kratos has rigorously trained Atreus, much to his son's annoyance and frustration. Unbeknownst to Atreus, Kratos saw a prophecy in <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tunheim" title="Jötunheim">Jötunheim</a> foretelling his own death, and his harsh training is meant to prepare Atreus to survive on his own and anticipate the coming of that time. Because of this prophecy and his own disastrous history with apocalyptic wars and predictions, Kratos is initially adamant about sheltering Atreus under the guise of training, dismissing his son's desire to find his own identity.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Kratos%2C_Atreus_and_M%C3%B3tsognir.png/revision/latest?cb=20180514093135" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos, Atreus and Mótsognir" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="92" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos, Atreus and Mótsognir.png" data-image-key="Kratos%2C_Atreus_and_M%C3%B3tsognir.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Kratos%2C_Atreus_and_M%C3%B3tsognir.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180514093135"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Kratos%2C_Atreus_and_M%C3%B3tsognir.png/revision/latest?cb=20180514093135" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos, Atreus and Mótsognir" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Kratos%2C_Atreus_and_M%C3%B3tsognir.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180514093135" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="92" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos, Atreus and Mótsognir.png" data-image-key="Kratos%2C_Atreus_and_M%C3%B3tsognir.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b7/Kratos%2C_Atreus_and_M%C3%B3tsognir.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180514093135"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>As a result, Kratos is understandably angered when he discovers that Atreus has been sneaking out without his permission. Atreus points out that Kratos has been hypocritically keeping secrets from him for most of his life, despite Kratos' best intentions. While Kratos went along with Atreus' requests to fulfill various <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Jötnar</a> prophecies, he did so primarily to protect his son. He takes extreme offense when Atreus begins to embrace his Jötnar name, "<b>Loki</b>", angrily declaring that "[<b>he</b>] is Atreus, [<b>his</b>] son." Also, Kratos still retained his dislike for debts. He angrily reprimanded Freya when she angrily reminded him of a debt he owed her, while saying he would have always helped her, despite everything that happened between them. This was following a brief hostile spat between them where she told him to kill.   
</p><p>When Atreus refuses to elaborate after disappearing for two days, Kratos reaches his breaking point and tells him to choose between being a liar or "his son." This ultimatum drives Atreus to run away, feeling that his father will not allow him to have his own identity.
