However, Kratos' encounters with the <a href="/wiki/Nornir" title="Nornir">Norns</a> and his travels through <a href="/wiki/Helheim" title="Helheim">Helheim</a> to deal with <a href="/wiki/Garm" title="Garm">Garm</a> ultimately lead him to realize that he was wrong to depend on his son to remain tethered to his humanity and to dictate as much of his path as possible. He shows great remorse for his actions and sincerely apologizes to Atreus, becoming supportive of his son's decisions. Kratos eventually accepts Atreus' path to leave the <a href="/wiki/Norse_Mythology" title="Norse Mythology">Norse</a> lands to search for the <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Giants</a>, showing great pride in his son's maturity and independence. 
</p><p>Kratos' greatest change comes when he confronts the Norns and discovers the truth about destiny: there is no actual predestined fate. Prophecies are merely the result of seers predicting the consequences of individuals' actions. To subvert prophecy, one must face their flaws and strive to be better. Realizing he can be better than the monster he once was, Kratos takes this newfound understanding to heart. He makes great efforts to change, developing a sense of compassion previously unseen in him, and learns to distinguish between justice and vengeance.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/94/Funeral.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231224013957" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Funeral" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Funeral.jpg" data-image-key="Funeral.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/94/Funeral.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231224013957"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/94/Funeral.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231224013957" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Funeral" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/94/Funeral.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231224013957" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Funeral.jpg" data-image-key="Funeral.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/94/Funeral.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231224013957"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Because of this, it is shown that while Kratos activated <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a> after Brok's death to defeat <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a> and end his tyranny once and for all, he refused to abandon the innocent <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Æsir</a> and <a href="/wiki/Midgardians" title="Midgardians">Midgardians</a> in <a href="/wiki/Asgard" title="Asgard">Asgard</a>. He willingly risked his and Atreus' lives to give the innocents a chance to escape the destruction of Asgard. After seeing Faye's mural, which foresaw that he would become a revered God beloved by the people, Kratos was visibly overjoyed, driven to tears by the revelation. He openly seeks to repair all the damage that <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a> and Odin caused to the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a>, finally becoming a true hero dedicated to helping others.
</p>
<h4><span id="In_God_of_War_Ragnar.C3.B6k:_Valhalla"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="In_God_of_War_Ragnarök:_Valhalla">In God of War Ragnarök: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Ragnar%C3%B6k:_Valhalla" title="God of War Ragnarök: Valhalla">Valhalla</a></span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Valhalla.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231214091115" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Valhalla" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Valhalla.jpg" data-image-key="Valhalla.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Valhalla.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231214091115"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Valhalla.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231214091115" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Valhalla" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Valhalla.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231214091115" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Valhalla.jpg" data-image-key="Valhalla.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/84/Valhalla.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231214091115"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><br>
Upon entering <a href="/wiki/Valhalla" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a> and undergoing its trials when considering taking up Týr's position as the "<b>God of War</b>", Kratos matured further and finally accepted responsibility and expressed deep remorse for some of the vile actions from his past, such as killing <a href="/wiki/Helios" title="Helios">Helios</a>, especially after an illusion of the latter manifested itself at times and taunted him, and the <a href="/wiki/Captain" title="Captain">Boat Captain</a>, finally accepting that he was unnecessarily cruel towards the latter, who had not harmed in any way and was only fearful for his life at the time due to coming up against a <a href="/wiki/Hydra" title="Hydra">monster</a> he could not beat. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest?cb=20231213194714" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Helios in gow Valhalla" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Helios in gow Valhalla.png" data-image-key="Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231213194714"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest?cb=20231213194714" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Helios in gow Valhalla" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231213194714" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Helios in gow Valhalla.png" data-image-key="Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/65/Helios_in_gow_Valhalla.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231213194714"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Furthermore, he took pity on Magni and Modi, despite having no sympathy for them whatsoever prior to their deaths, after realizing that they were dealt an unfair hand at life due to being abused by their <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">father</a>, sent to their deaths by their <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">uncle</a> and belittled by their <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">grandfather</a> following their passing, even realizing that Atreus could have turned out like them had he been raised in the Spartan ways which were brutal, abusive and unforgiving. Also, his relationship with Mimir has grown even further to the point where he would take interest in knowing more about the latter's relationship with <a href="/wiki/Sigr%C3%BAn" title="Sigrún">Sigrun</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Appearance">Appearance</span></h3>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Kratos_GreekEra1.png/revision/latest?cb=20230118170518" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos GreekEra1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="330" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos GreekEra1.png" data-image-key="Kratos_GreekEra1.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Kratos_GreekEra1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230118170518"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Kratos_GreekEra1.png/revision/latest?cb=20230118170518" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos GreekEra1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Kratos_GreekEra1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230118170518" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="330" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos GreekEra1.png" data-image-key="Kratos_GreekEra1.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Kratos_GreekEra1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230118170518"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos is the epitome of what a <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> soldier is in that he is essentially made for battle. He is very tall, being 2.34 metres (7 ft 8 in) at <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a>, and 1.94 metres (6 ft 4 in) throughout the <a href="/wiki/Norse_Gods" title="Norse Gods">Norse</a> Pantheon. Kratos also currently weights in at roughly 250 pounds (110 kg). Due to his long lifetime as a warrior, Kratos is in peak physical condition of a large, athletic frame with a well-defined and muscular build. 
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/Young_Kratos_and_Deimos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221027080631" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Young Kratos and Deimos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="233" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Young Kratos and Deimos.jpg" data-image-key="Young_Kratos_and_Deimos.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/Young_Kratos_and_Deimos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221027080631"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/Young_Kratos_and_Deimos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221027080631" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Young Kratos and Deimos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/Young_Kratos_and_Deimos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221027080631" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="233" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Young Kratos and Deimos.jpg" data-image-key="Young_Kratos_and_Deimos.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b2/Young_Kratos_and_Deimos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221027080631"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>During his youth, Kratos wore a brown cloth draped over his shoulders, while a Spartan blanket with orange patterns hung down near his legs, adding a touch of Spartan heritage to his attire. His left arm was wrapped in bandages to protect himself from injuries. He even trained barefoot, a common practice to toughen his feet and improve his agility. Then he also has a teenage deep voice and while training with his younger brother <a href="/wiki/Deimos" title="Deimos">Deimos</a>, Kratos carries a wooden spear with him and a shield sometimes. 
</p><p>As Kratos matures, he sported a red tattoo going down the majority of his upper body and up to his face, a tattoo he wore in honour of his brother, Deimos. On his face, besides the aforementioned tattoo, he has a scar on his right eye and a black goatee and hazel brown eyes. The scar was caused by <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a> when Kratos was a child and tried to save his brother from the raid of <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a> on Sparta. When he was promoted as a Spartan general, Kratos wore a sleeveless bronze chestplate, showing his muscular arms. The armor featured a orange symbol in the center, marking his high rank and authority to his army. Besides that, he wore a simple loincloth, allowing him to keep his equipments. Kratos also carries the <a href="/wiki/Sword_of_Valor" title="Sword of Valor">Sword of Valor</a> during his battles, and it seems sharp and deadly. For his feet as well, Kratos wore a metalic sandal. 
</p><p>As time went on in the Greek era, his skin turns ashen white, a result of being covered in the ashes of his dead family, a mark of his past and a curse. His prominent red tattoo running from his left eye, over his head, and down his left shoulder made this his distinctive look. Kratos typically wears a Greek-style armored skirt, that is made of leather and metal strips. This offers warmth while allowing for freedom of movement in battle. He also has armbands, providing protection for his arms while also having metal greaves for his lower legs. Apart from his armor and weapons, Kratos’ attire is quite minimal, which also shows his muscles and some scars on his skin. Other than that, he does wield other mythical weapons, such as the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a>, and more extra equipments each adding to his arsenal during combat.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/ff/Kratos_Norse_Era1.png/revision/latest?cb=20230306220308" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos Norse Era1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="316" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos Norse Era1.png" data-image-key="Kratos_Norse_Era1.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/ff/Kratos_Norse_Era1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230306220308"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/ff/Kratos_Norse_Era1.png/revision/latest?cb=20230306220308" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos Norse Era1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/ff/Kratos_Norse_Era1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230306220308" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="316" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos Norse Era1.png" data-image-key="Kratos_Norse_Era1.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/ff/Kratos_Norse_Era1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230306220308"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In the Norse era, Kratos changes significantly to reflect his age, experience, and the cold climate of <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a>. As an older man, he wears leather armor, black pants and flat boots suited for the harsh Norse terrain. Kratos also sports a bushy, thick beard, giving him a rugged look. He even has a significant scar on his abdomen from when he impaled himself with the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a> at the end of <i><a href="/wiki/God_of_War_III" title="God of War III">God of War III.</a></i> During combat, Kratos would carry his <a href="/wiki/Leviathan_Axe" title="Leviathan Axe">Leviathan Axe</a>, <a href="/wiki/Guardian_Shield" title="Guardian Shield">Guardian Shield</a> and even the Blades of Chaos later on. Throughout <a href="/wiki/Fimbulwinter" title="Fimbulwinter">Fimbulwinter</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a>, Kratos' appearance becomes even more battle-worn. He wears solid leather armor, with three pieces on his shoulders for added defense. Initially, he dons a fur cloak, which he loses during a fight with <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a>. His legs are also all covered in brown bandages again, hiding his black pants. Kratos' skin looks more paler due to the cold climate. Also, <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a>’s head hangs from a small metal bit on Kratos’ waist, serving as a constant companion and source of wisdom.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="On_the_Greek_Era_and_Norse_Era">On the Greek Era and Norse Era</span></h4>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="On_God_of_War_II">On God of War <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_II" title="God of War II">II</a></span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e9/KratosGOWII.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240628095018" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="KratosGOWII" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="135" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="KratosGOWII.jpg" data-image-key="KratosGOWII.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e9/KratosGOWII.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240628095018"><div style="position: absolute; <figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/18/KratosGOW2K18.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240628095211" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <h4><span id="On_God_of_War_Ragnar.C3.B6k:_Valhalla"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="On_God_of_War_Ragnarök:_Valhalla">On God of War Ragnarök: <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Ragnar%C3%B6k:_Valhalla" title="God of War Ragnarök: Valhalla">Valhalla</a></span></h4>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-center show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/51/KratosVAL.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240628095429" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; <h2><span id="Powers_.26_Abilities"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Powers_&amp;_Abilities">Powers &amp; Abilities</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Powers">Powers</span></h3>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_vs._Thor_Round_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221121031144" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos vs. Thor Round 2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos vs. Thor Round 2.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_vs._Thor_Round_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_vs._Thor_Round_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221121031144"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_vs._Thor_Round_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221121031144" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos vs. Thor Round 2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_vs._Thor_Round_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221121031144" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos vs. Thor Round 2.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_vs._Thor_Round_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e1/Kratos_vs._Thor_Round_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221121031144"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b>Transcendental God Physiology:</b> As the son of <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> and to the mortal woman <a href="/wiki/Callisto" title="Callisto">Callisto</a>, Kratos was born a <a href="/wiki/Demigod" title="Demigod">demigod</a>, already granting him superhuman physical prowess. Already beyond most mortals and monsters, to where armies of them pose no threat to him, his acquiring of the power of <a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a> and becoming a true <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">God</a>; the <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a>, as well as numerous absorption and exposure of various powers during his life dramatically enhanced Kratos' powers, allowing him to kill all the <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Olympian Gods</a> and <a href="/wiki/Titans" title="Titans">Titans</a>. After leaving Greece, with the magics he had lost to him, and being older, it's ambiguous whether Kratos' godly physical prowess and abilities have grown or reduced over time. Despite suppressing his power, Kratos is still far more powerful and capable of dispatching armies of monsters in the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a>. He can also easily fight on par with and overpower <a href="/wiki/Norse_Gods" title="Norse Gods">Norse Gods</a> on the level of Magni, Modi, Heimdall, Baldur, Thor and Týr, the former two being the powerful sons of Thor and the latter four being among the strongest of the Æsir as the sons of Odin. Kratos even managed to match blows with and eventually defeat Thor, the physically strongest and second most powerful <a href="/wiki/Norse_Gods" title="Norse Gods">Norse God</a>, in their battle at <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a>. The idea of his interference in Ragnarök makes even Odin afraid of him, with him avoiding conflict with him until Kratos was weakened before their final fight and Kratos, while weakened from his fights in the Twilight of Asgard, especially against Thor after overcoming the hordes of Asgard's army, being the one who primarily handled the All-Father between himself, Atreus, and Freya. In Valhalla, after overcoming many trials of the realm, he was able to fight on par with and defeat his Norse counterpart Týr, during four arduous rounds, having being recognized by him after coming to terms with his past and forgiving himself. Thus, Týr eventually considers him a worthy successor as the God of War of the Nine Realms.
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Immortal" title="Immortal">Immortality</a>:</b> As an ancient <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Greek god</a> and now the <a href="/wiki/Norse_Gods" title="Norse Gods">Norse god</a> of war, Kratos is immortal. Only a weapon of exceptional power or a being of extreme strength can kill him. Kratos was cursed to walk the Earth forever for his terrible sins, rendering him incapable of dying. This is how he survived his suicide attempt with <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">the Blade of Olympus</a>. Despite aging physically, he will not die of old age, and his aging seems to have frozen in time when he was an old man: he remained in his fifties from the time he met his second wife until the end of his adventures in the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Norse realm</a>.</li>
<li><figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	 <a href="https://godofwar.fandom.com/wiki/File:God_of_War_Ascension_Aegaeon_the_Hecatonchires_Boss_Fight" class="video video-thumbnail xsmall "> 	<img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" alt="God_of_War_Ascension_Aegaeon_the_Hecatonchires_Boss_Fight" height="101" width="180" data-video-key="God_of_War_Ascension_Aegaeon_the_Hecatonchires_Boss_Fight" data-video-name="God of War Ascension Aegaeon the Hecatonchires Boss Fight" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/56/God_of_War_Ascension_Aegaeon_the_Hecatonchires_Boss_Fight/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20150402032935" class="lazyload"> 	<span class="thumbnail-play-icon-container"> 		<svg class="thumbnail-play-icon wds-icon"><use xlink:href="#wds-player-icon-play"></use></svg>	</span> </a>  	 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 			<p class="title">God of War Ascension Aegaeon the Hecatonchires Boss Fight</p> 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure><b>Immeasurable Strength:</b> Kratos possesses incredible superhuman strength, which only grows over time, eventually reaching immeasurable levels. While being originally defeated by <a href="/wiki/Alrik" title="Alrik">Alrik</a>, later, he was able to easily subdue and rip apart many large and powerful beasts and creatures such as <a href="/wiki/Undead_Legionnaire" title="Undead Legionnaire">Undead Legionnaires</a>, infected humans, monsters, and magical beings using only his bare hands, including even the <a href="/wiki/Hydra" title="Hydra">Hydra</a>. Kratos was later capable of matching, overpowering and even killing the Gods themselves with his raw strength, such as <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a>, <a href="/wiki/Helios" title="Helios">Helios</a>, who he casually decapitated with his bare hands, <a href="/wiki/Poseidon" title="Poseidon">Poseidon</a>, who he ripped out of his watery construct, beat down with his bare hands, gouged his eyes and snapped his neck, <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a>, who he pushed back and then ripped out the soul of using the <a href="/wiki/Claws_of_Hades" title="Claws of Hades">Claws of Hades</a>, and finally Zeus, who he was able to beat to death. He also prevented both Cronos and <a href="/wiki/Atlas" title="Atlas">Atlas</a>, the two strongest Titans, from crushing him with their fingers and even overpowered <a href="/wiki/Cronos" title="Cronos">Cronos</a> when he tried to crush him with two hands. In his battle against <a href="/wiki/Hercules" title="Hercules">Hercules</a>, who is considered to be unrivaled in terms of sheer strength, Kratos proved himself stronger, capable of stopping his charges and even forcing him backward and also able to break free from his bear hugs, throwing Hercules with great ease over a great distance, overpowering and pummeling him to death despite his brother's invulnerability. Even after becoming older, rusty and suppressing his power, Kratos still remains extraordinarily strong in Midgard. He could effortlessly lift and throw massive boulders, easily exert more than enough force to overpower and slaughter monsters with raw strength alone, such as snapping the neck of a troll, crushing the head of a monster, tearing apart the rock-like forms of certain creatures, and lift enormous weights, as shown when he pushed the World Bridge surrounding <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr%27s_Temple" title="Týr's Temple">Týr's Temple</a> with little effort and flipped the entire Tyr´s temple with similar ease. Kratos also still has more than enough strength to take on and defeat powerful Norse Gods as he effortlessly overpowered <a href="/wiki/Modi" title="Modi">Modi</a>, easily ripping his mace from him and stunning and wounding him enough with a single punch to make him retreat, instantly pushed aside <a href="/wiki/Magni" title="Magni">Magni</a>, and overpowered Baldur in raw strength with considerable effort, managing to restrain him firmly, free himself from Baldur's grasp, and ultimately snap his neck. After the death of Baldur, he trains together with Atreus throughout <a href="/wiki/Fimbulwinter" title="Fimbulwinter">Fimbulwinter</a> to prepare for more upcoming threats, eventually returning to peak shape. By the time Kratos encounters <a href="/wiki/Heimdall" title="Heimdall">Heimdall</a>, he easily overpowered him in terms of strength, casually gaining the upper hand in grapples and drawing blood with a single punch before utterly beating him badly with three slams to the ground, killing him by choking him to death within a matter of moments. He could physically overpower and subdue the <a href="/wiki/Valkyries" title="Valkyries">Valkyries</a>, using his bare hands to rip apart their wings and break out of their grip. With only one hand, Kratos physically overpowered <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a>, tossing her sword attack aside with his shield, freeing himself from Freya holding him down, and ripping Freya's sword off him despite her resistance. Kratos was also strong enough to contend with Thor, the Norse God of Strength and the physically strongest of them all, when both of them were holding back (Kratos due to his usual insistence on not becoming the old monster he once was and Thor due to Odin's orders); he was able to draw blood from Thor, eventually break free of his grips, and repeatedly hold a well-matched physical struggle with Thor, such as when he pushed Thor a distance away with the <a href="/wiki/Guardian_Shield" title="Guardian Shield">Guardian Shield</a> and kept him at bay before he divided his hand into summoning the <a href="/wiki/Leviathan_Axe" title="Leviathan Axe">Leviathan Axe</a> and when they grappled with Thor's <a href="/wiki/Mj%C3%B6lnir" title="Mjölnir">Mjölnir</a> on even terms over the air with the Leviathan Axe, with Thor having to physically slam him down with his free hand. Despite being overwhelmed by Thor's tenacity and briefly restrained by a chokehold to the neck, by unleashing his true strength due to being completely enraged, Kratos was strong enough to break free and deliver a blow that sent Thor staggering and knocked a tooth off him. Later on, when they fought in <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a>, while fighting seriously and holding back to a much lesser extent than before, Kratos ultimately proved to be stronger than the Æsir-Jötnar hybrid, managing to successfully pin him down and pummel him for a short time before Thor knocked him backwards, wrench his hand free from Thor's grip to impale him with the <a href="/wiki/Draupnir_Spear" title="Draupnir Spear">Draupnir Spear</a>, physically lift and hurl Thor into the roof of the Great Lodge with enormous strength, and clashed the Leviathan Axe into Mjölnir with sufficient force to eventually knock the hammer out of Thor's hand, before lifting him into the air with the Axe lodged in his stomach and knocking him down to the ground. Soon after defeating Thor, Kratos retained enough strength to battle with Odin, manhandling and throwing the All-Father away and his blows having visibly greater impact on Odin compared to Atreus and Freya as they worked together to critically injure and overpower the King of the Æsir. While traveling in <a href="/wiki/Valhalla" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a>, Kratos was twice able to defy the makings of Valhalla through sheer strength alone, first when he forcefully opened the sealed doors of the realm, a feat that even Freya and Sigrun found insurmountable, and when he managed to rip open the cage he accidentally trapped Mimir in to be sacrificed, although both occasions proved ultimately fruitless, as he was still susceptible to the curse of breaching Valhalla and could not escape the consequences of breaking the rules of Valhalla when he saved Mimir. With moderate effort, Kratos was able to outmatch Týr in battle, physically overpowering the taller Norse God of War in a grapple, stunning and knocking him a few feet back with a single punch to the face, and even casually lifting and throwing him to the ground, his punch when blocked by Týr causing a shockwave.</li>
<li><figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Kratos_vs_beast.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130119095607" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos vs beast" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos vs beast.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_vs_beast.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Kratos_vs_beast.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130119095607"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Kratos_vs_beast.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130119095607" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos vs beast" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Kratos_vs_beast.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130119095607" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos vs beast.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_vs_beast.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Kratos_vs_beast.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20130119095607"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure><b>Nigh-Invulnerability:</b> Kratos is extraordinarily durable. He can easily fall from great heights and walk away unharmed, and could easily withstand crushing, stabbings, beatings, and powerful magical attacks with little injuries, attacks that would instantly kill any normal human, beast or even other demigods, having taken numerous exceedingly strong physical attacks from the Gods and Titans and mostly survived with only minor wounds and damage. In the Norse Realm, Kratos remains tremendously durable despite his age, although initially hampered by his lack of fighting against threatening opponents and also due to Kratos holding himself back. He withstood multiple harsh attacks from <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a>, with Baldur needing three rounds of fighting to beat him to a bloody pulp and even then Kratos was better off than Baldur in terms of physical injuries by the end of their first fight. Even with his continued restraint of his full power, Kratos managed to withstand multiple extremely strong blows from <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>, whose blows were stated by him to be as heavy as any he had felt, although he was briefly knocked out by the God of Thunder before being revived to continue their fight. At peak shape, Kratos proved capable of withstanding several attacks from an utterly bloodlusted and enraged Thor, being thrown around, punched and even shrugging off a hit with <a href="/wiki/Mj%C3%B6lnir" title="Mjölnir">Mjölnir</a> to the head with little damage. Afterwards, Kratos withstood being pierced by Gungnir, quickly blocking the blade before it could penetrate any further whilst physically overpowering Odin and tossing him aside. He is also fully capable of surviving in extreme environments, as he was unaffected by the cold of <a href="/wiki/Hel" title="Hel">Hel</a>, which not even <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a> could physically survive without using a spell, nor the heat of <a href="/wiki/Muspelheim" title="Muspelheim">Muspelheim</a>, and was able to withstand the flow of <a href="/wiki/Surtr" title="Surtr">Surtr</a>'s flames into his Blades of Chaos with only minimum pain. With considerable effort, Kratos was able to withstand the Light of Alfheim to enter and collect the light needed to continue his journey with Atreus, with him being completely unfazed by attempting to breach the Light whereas just touching it burned Atreus' hand and knocked him back, a feat that Odin, disguised as Týr, found highly shocking and implied not even he or anyone else could achieve.</li>
<li><b>Superhuman Speed and Reflexes:</b> Kratos is incredibly fast, having wielding tremendous superhuman speed, and also has stupendous fighting reflexes, capable of matching the likes of Zeus who has the speed of lightning, and <a href="/wiki/Castor_and_Pollux" title="Castor and Pollux">Castor and Pollux</a> using Chronokinesis in combat. He was also able to keep up with <a href="/wiki/Hermes" title="Hermes">Hermes</a> using his boots enough to successfully stay on his tracks and after he was weakened, defeat him. His speed surpassed the <a href="/wiki/Sisters_of_Fate" title="Sisters of Fate">Sisters of Fate</a>, as shown when he could easily fight and outpace two of them at once, tagging them while also avoiding their attacks. His old age seemed to have not diminished his speed, as he still remained exceptionally fast. He was able to deliver multiple fatal blows to Magni within seconds without the demigod being able to react at all. With considerable effort, he was able to eventually overcome Baldur's light speed, and Heimdall's near-teleportational speeds, successfully reacting to their attacks, keeping up with them in vicious exchanges, and eventually delivering attacks that defeated them. Even in a physically drained state, Kratos was able to battle with Thor, delivering numerous blows on the God of Thunder and reacting to a decent amount of Thor's attacks, before he was eventually caught, and in their final battle, Kratos was eventually able to outpace Thor with considerable effort, managing to avoid Thor's fierce charge and swiftly beat up on him and impale his hand before he could get up.</li>
<li><b>Superhuman Agility:</b> Kratos has tremendous agility, capable of easily climbing mountains and buildings, jumping great heights and landing without any problems, and swinging on ropes to cross long gaps. His coordination is also remarkable, being able to easily stay on top of struggling beasts.</li>
<li><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Cestus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090304200044" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Cestus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="150" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Cestus.jpg" data-image-key="Cestus.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Cestus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20090304200044"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Cestus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090304200044" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Cestus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Cestus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20090304200044" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="150" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Cestus.jpg" data-image-key="Cestus.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Cestus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20090304200044"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure><b>Superhuman Stamina:</b> Kratos possesses an almost unlimited amount of stamina compared to a mortal man, allowing him to remain constantly active for days without tiring. This allows him to accomplish such feats as spending days scaling the temple of <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a> to reach <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Pandora's Box</a> or taking down enormous monsters that require him to stay on the move constantly. Should Kratos expend all his stamina, he only momentarily requires rest or food to restore it. In the Norse Realm, Kratos' old age has somewhat reduced his stamina and vitality, exacerbated by his lack of practice against powerful opponents, but he still remained exceptionally vigorous even at the beginning of his and Atreus' journey, being able to fight and defeat Baldur three times despite Baldur's invulnerability meant whenever Kratos killed him, he would quickly resurrect, and still had just enough strength to walk back to his home. As he continued to journey, his stamina steadily grew stronger as he started to become accustomed to performing at intense levels once again, traversing the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a> while defeating countless enemies with increasingly greater vigor and even besting Gods on Magni and Baldur's level, all while showing only minimum fatigue. By the end of Fimbulwinter, Kratos demonstrated greater stamina than before already from the start of his second journey, with Mimir commenting that at this point, Kratos could stay awake for days without trouble, as he was able to fight off Freya in an intense battle while showing no fatigue. After only a few moments to rest, he was able to search for Atreus for hours, overpower his bear form in a fierce fight without slowing down despite being noticeably challenged by his son's transformation, and with only a few moments of rest, had enough energy to reach a stalemate with Thor in a brutal prolonged battle with only minimum effect on his performance, and despite the clear strain and fatigue from the affair, managed to follow his son to the mural of the <a href="/wiki/Wolf" title="Wolf">Celestial Wolves</a> all the way to <a href="/wiki/Sindri" title="Sindri">Sindri</a>'s cabin. During Ragnarök, Kratos fought through numerous forces of Asgard, including the "endless" army of the <a href="/wiki/Einherjar" title="Einherjar">Einherjar</a>, up until he finally defeated Thor, still having enough strength afterwards to handle and defeat Odin with help from Atreus and Freya.</li>
<li><b>Regenerative Healing Factor:</b> Kratos' regenerative healing factor allows him to heal and regenerate from injuries at a fast rate, making him able to recover from attacks that would normally kill other beings. He can also regenerate even from being hit by divine beings or divine weaponry, although in case for divine weapons, they can still leave behind scratches and scars. If needed, Kratos can focus his energy and rage to heal himself almost instantly from even severe injuries, being able to heal from damage caused by the likes of Baldur and Thor.</li>
<li><b>Superhuman Senses:</b> Kratos’ senses are heightened, which make him heavily aware of his surroundings and able to sense danger when it's near.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Rage_Ability" title="Rage Ability">Rage Empowerment</a></b>: Kratos was able to tap into his <a href="/wiki/Rage_Ability" title="Rage Ability">rage</a> for greater physical prowess and the ability to increase his superhuman strength, speed, agility, stamina, and durability, making him much stronger than normal. He can also harness the ultimate powers of his rage in several magical weapons in his arsenal. In Greece, he was only able to channel his anger through the powers of the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Chaos" title="Blades of Chaos">Blades of Chaos</a>, <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a>, and the blessed ashes of <a href="/wiki/Prometheus" title="Prometheus">Prometheus</a> and the power of <a href="/wiki/Thera" title="Thera">Thera</a>, but by the time of his journeys in the Norse lands, Kratos' experience and relentless training to master his rage granted him the ability to freely call upon concentrated bursts of his powerful <a href="/wiki/Spartan_Rage" title="Spartan Rage">Spartan Rage</a>, allowing him to become more powerful and unleash a wild but focused aggressive barrage of attacks. He even managed to develop his skill with the ability to where he was able to manifest it in numerous forms, capable of only healing himself or unleashing a devastating attack from the power of his weapons.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a></b>: Tyr, at the end of <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_Ragnar%C3%B6k:_Valhalla" title="God of War Ragnarök: Valhalla">God of War: Valhalla</a>, states that some of the power of Hope still resides in him, but how much and the vastness of this power is unclear.</li>
<li><b>Fate Immunity</b>: Kratos was shown to be able to often escape his own destiny and prophecies, being able to contradict the prophecies of his own death in both Greek and Norse mythology.</li></ul></li></ul>
<h4><span id="Elemental_Powers_.28Greece.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Elemental_Powers_(Greece)">Elemental Powers (Greece)</span></h4>
<ul><li><b>Power Absorption:</b> Throughout his life, Kratos has been shown to absorb power from various sources, be it Gods or Titans. Among the greatest power, he has absorbed the Power of <a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a>, unlocked <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Pandora'</a><a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">s</a> Box, and even successfully went inside the Flame of Olympus. This therefore allowed him to kill the immortal Olympians and despite releasing it in his suicide attempt, it seems that the part of Hope is still inside him. Kratos also seems to absorb the greatest feature from Gods or out of powerful creatures he kills. He absorbed Hades' soul in <i>God of War</i> <i>III</i>, which was incredibly important to Kratos' power level. Kratos also became the God of Death in some ways, as he killed Thanatos, which most likely added to his already immense powers. These abilities were no longer present after he moved to and settled in Midgard. Kratos revealed that he tried to use some of these abilities, but could not, and Freya or Atreus commented this was possibly due to the destruction of his homeland. It is possible that Kratos' immense strength, durability, and resistance to magical and divine power are partly due to his constant exposure to and absorption of various different powers during his life, which are traits that he retains permanently despite the destruction of his homeland.</li>
<li><b>Atmokinesis:</b> With the Blade of Olympus, Kratos can summon a massive tornado by slamming the blade to the ground.</li>
<li><b>Aerokinesis:</b> With Typhon's Bane, Kratos can fire gusts of wind and homing wind blasts and generate whirlwinds and tempests.</li>
<li><b>Electrokinesis:</b> Kratos had gained the power to manipulate electricity from various sources throughout his life. First, he gained <a href="/wiki/Lightning_of_Zeus" title="Lightning of Zeus">Lightning of Zeus</a> from Python's Belly, allowing him to empower his blade with lightning to shock enemies and create electrical fields and mines as well as his chain and also create a large vortex of electric energy. He then acquired the Gauntlet of Zeus, which allowed him to use electricity to greatly increase his speed and enhance his blows with electricity as well as unleash lethal jolts. He was also given two versions of lightning magic: <b><a href="/wiki/Zeus%27_Fury" title="Zeus' Fury">Zeus' Fury</a></b>, which allowed him to generate powerful thunderbolts, and <b><a href="/wiki/Poseidon%27s_Rage" title="Poseidon's Rage">Poseidon's Rage</a></b>, which allowed him to generate a circle of electricity around himself and summon lightning bolts from the sky. <b><a href="/wiki/Eye_of_Atlantis" title="Eye of Atlantis">The Eye of Atlantis</a></b> granted Kratos the power to unleash furious strikes of lightning from the orb and generate arcs of lightning. Although he lost that power after Zeus stripped him of his godly powers, he was given back the power to manipulate lightning by <b><a href="/wiki/Cronos%27_Rage" title="Cronos' Rage">Chronos' Rage</a></b>, allowing him to create blue orbs of electricity and after sufficiently leveling it up, he can also cause the orb to explode at will. Hephaestus also granted Nemesis Whip, one of Kratos' weapons, the power to emit electricity to shock others and also unleash blasts of thunder energy.</li>
<li><b>Pyrokinesis:</b> Throughout his journey, Kratos has been gifted with several powers to manipulate fire. First was the <a href="/wiki/Fire_of_Ares" title="Fire of Ares">Fire of Ares</a>, which allowed him to empower his weapons to create fiery explosions with combos and overall enchant attacks with fire as well as create searing cores of fire. The second was the <a href="/wiki/Thera%27s_Bane" title="Thera's Bane">Thera's Bane</a>, which temporarily allowed him to greatly increase the power of the Blades of Athena and also create exploding searing cores. <a href="/wiki/Rage_of_the_Titans" title="Rage of the Titans">Rage of the Titans</a> was acquired when he freed Prometheus from his torment, allowing him to clad himself of fire and generate fiery bursts and torrents. Upon arriving in the Norse Realm, Kratos somehow acquired the power of <a href="/wiki/Spartan_Rage" title="Spartan Rage">Spartan Rage</a>, which allowed him to empower his fists with what appeared to be fire and empower thrown stones to explode upon impact. He can also use the Blades of Chaos to channel their fire energy, albeit only after he stabs his enemies.</li>
<li><b>Cryokinesis:</b> With the <a href="/wiki/Ice_of_Poseidon" title="Ice of Poseidon">Ice of Poseidon</a>, Kratos was granted the power to create tempests and waves of ice, empower his weapons with ice, fire ice shards and manifest spikes of ice. The Horn of Boreas allowed him to summon icy tempests. After arriving in the Norse Realm, Kratos' power to manipulate ice lies with the Leviathan Axe, which while wielded by Kratos can fire waves of ice energy and freeze enemies.</li>
<li><b>Geokinesis:</b> With <a href="/wiki/Atlas_Quake" title="Atlas Quake">Atlas Quake</a>, Kratos was capable of creating strong earthquakes and throwing large boulders. In the Norse Realm with the help of Spartan Rage, Kratos could also shake the ground and throw large boulders.</li>
<li><b>Chronokinesis:</b> With the Amulet of Uroborus, Kratos could manipulate time in a variety of ways, such as casting blasts able to decay enemies, healing himself, restoring massive broken structures, and slowing down enemies. He was also able to use the Loom Chamber's threads to go back in time before he was killed by Zeus. Also, with the help of the <a href="/wiki/Amulet_of_the_Fates" title="Amulet of the Fates">Amulet of the Fates</a>, Kratos could slow down time. In the Nordic Realm, Kratos could use the Talisman of the Worlds and other talismans, as well as enchantments to slow down time and enemies.</li>
<li><b>Photokinesis:</b> With the <a href="/wiki/Primordial_Fire" title="Primordial Fire">Primordial Fire</a>, Kratos could summon orbs of light and hurl them towards his enemies.</li>
<li><b>Soul Manipulation:</b> With the <a href="/wiki/Soul_of_Hades_(Power)" title="Soul of Hades (Power)">Soul of Hades</a>, Kratos was granted the power to summon blasts of soul energy and unleash the deceased souls that inhabit the Underworld upon enemies. The God of Death later granted Kratos the power to summon the souls of the Underworld in the form of the magic of the Army of Hades. Although he lost the power to do this after losing his godhood, Kratos received the <a href="/wiki/Blades_of_Exile" title="Blades of Exile">Blades of Exile</a> from Athena which grants him the power to resurrect and control the souls of his deceased Spartan brethren. He later obtains a stronger version of the power after obtaining the <a href="/wiki/Claws_of_Hades" title="Claws of Hades">Claws of Hades</a>, allowing him to rip out other's souls and control it to attack enemies as well as summon souls of the enemies he had defeated.</li>
<li><b>Divine Energy Manipulation:</b> With the Blade of Olympus, Kratos was able to fire powerful blasts of divine energy.</li>
<li><b>Void Creation:</b> With the Scourge of Erinys, Kratos was granted the power to create voids of darkness capable of sucking in enemies, stealing their life force and yielding it to Kratos.</li>
<li><b>Magical Reve</b><b>lation:</b> With the <a href="/wiki/Eyes_of_Truth" title="Eyes of Truth">Eyes of Truth</a>, Kratos was able to dispel all sorts of illusions, magic barriers and dark magic spells used by <a href="/wiki/The_Furies" title="The Furies">The Furies</a>.</li>
<li><b>Underwater Breathing:</b> With either Poseidon's Trident or Triton's Lance, Kratos could breathe underwater indefinitely and swim with incredible speed.</li>
<li><b>Clone Creation:</b> With the Oath Stone of Orkos, Kratos can create copies of himself to aid him against his enemies.</li>
<li><b>Petrification:</b> With either Medusa or Euryale's heads, Kratos can turn enemies into stone.</li>
<li><b>Flight:</b> Kratos, using Icarus' wings, could hover above the ground and fly through the air.</li></ul>
<h4><span id="Elemental_Powers_.28Norse.29"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Elemental_Powers_(Norse)">Elemental Powers (Norse)</span></h4>
<ul><li><b>Njörd's Tempest:</b> A rapidly-spinning melee attack. Creates an icy whirlwind around Kratos.</li>
<li><b>Fury of the Ice Troll:</b> Kratos charges the Leviathan Axe before sending out a shockwave that slows enemies and knocks them down while dealing Frost damage.</li>
<li><b>Tyr's Revenge:</b> Kratos throws the Leviathan Axe, which then grinds against the target for a few seconds before launching into the air and slamming back down, causing an explosion of Frost.</li>
<li><b>Leviathan's Wake:</b> Kratos throws the Leviathan Axe, the weapon plowing through any enemy in its way while causing an explosion that sends them flying.</li>
<li><b>Charge of the White Bear:</b> Kratos enhances the Guardian Shield with ice, charging forward with the shield in front before slamming into an enemy and throwing them upward. He can follow up the charge with a Shield slam attack that causes an icy wave to be sent forward.</li>
<li><b>Wrath of the Frost Ancient:</b> Kratos fires a frost beam from the Leviathan Axe, slowing down and damaging all enemies hit.</li>
<li><b>Strike of the Udgard:</b> Kratos swings the Leviathan Axe, creating an icy shockwave that lunges forward. Kratos can follow up the initial wave with two more.</li>
<li><b>Hel's Touch:</b> The Leviathan Axe releases an omnidirectional shockwave that knocks enemies back.</li>
<li><b>Thiazi's Talon:</b> A propulsive slice that sends out a vertical wave of frost energy. Kratos can follow up the initial wave with two additional ones after charging up the attack.</li>
<li><b>Ivaldi's Anvil:</b> Kratos slams the Leviathan Axe into the ground, creating a shockwave that freezes all enemies caught in the blast radius. It also creates a second, smaller shockwave when Kratos pulls the axe from the ground.</li>
<li><b>Mists of Helheim:</b> Kratos throws the Leviathan Axe at the ground, stabbing it into the surface and creating a circular area that deals Frost damage to enemies inside of it.</li>
<li><b>Frost Giant's Frenzy:</b> A set of slam attacks that launch the enemies and send them flying.</li>
<li><b>Blessings of the Frost:</b> A brief buff to the Leviathan Axe that enhances all damage dealt by it. Every hit also causes an explosion of Frost and sends out a wave of Frost.</li>
<li><b>The River of Knives:</b> Kratos drags his axe across the ground, sending out a trio of ice shards.</li>
<li><b>Glaive Storm:</b> Kratos throws his axe, which then seeks out and tracks enemies, dealing Frost damage.</li>
<li><b>Breath of Thamur:</b> Kratos summons a massive Frost storm that deals damage to enemies inside its radius.</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Abilities">Abilities</span></h3>
<ul><li><b>Gifted Intellect:</b> Though often knocked for just being a brute, Kratos could demonstrate a surprising amount of intelligence and wisdom to deal with numerous non-combative threats in his way. By the time he settled in the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Norse Pantheon</a>, Kratos' intelligence and wisdom has grown further due to his experiences. His intelligence primarily manifests itself in a remarkable degree of deductive analysis throughout his journeys, which has only sharpened in time as he experienced both numerous intellectually challenging situations and manipulations/deceits. Numerous times, he was able to solve complex puzzles and problems that were made by some of the greatest intellects of <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a>. During his travels across the Norse lands to spread <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Faye</a>'s ashes, Kratos swiftly figured out the right way through the numerous Nordic puzzles in his way, which were made by the likes of the <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Giants</a> and <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a>, among the greatest minds in the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a>, even managing to guide <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a> into solving the puzzle while he himself was trapped. Kratos has also developed an uncanny knack for deducing whenever something was wrong and if a person is hiding something from him, even with only minor hints, from his experience of being tricked numerous times, as displayed by his quick wariness with <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a> due to correctly deducing she was no mere mortal or witch, due to her godhood. He was also quick to deduce after learning Freya is <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a>'s mother that Freya bewitched <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mímir</a> to ensure he couldn't tell them Baldur's weakness, and even swiftly saw through Mimir's efforts to conceal knowledge about the <a href="/wiki/Valkyries" title="Valkyries">Valkyries</a>. He accurately predicted that a ghost's offer to reunite him and Atreus with Faye was but a mere trick, and his correct insight that Atreus was seriously thinking of going to Odin.
<ul><li><b>Master Tactician</b>: Kratos has proven to be quite cunning and resourceful, being able to make good use of the environment and available tools to come up with ways to systematically defeat his enemies and swiftly adapt to unexpected situations, as shown when he repeatedly turned his enemies' weapons against them, quickly figured out a way to break through the ice created by <a href="/wiki/Thamur" title="Thamur">Thamur</a> in his dying breath using Thamur's gigantic hammer, and came up with a successful plan to turn the War Machines used by <a href="/wiki/Asgard" title="Asgard">Asgard</a> against them by using it to destroy the <a href="/wiki/The_Great_Lodge" title="The Great Lodge">Great Lodge</a>.</li>
<li><b>Master Leader:</b> Kratos was an exceptionally effective leader, being the youngest captain of Sparta and later given the title of general of the <a href="/wiki/Kratos%27_Army" title="Kratos' Army">Spartan Army</a> and leading his soldiers to numerous victories, and later led his own men when he became the new <a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a> unchallenged until the <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a> themselves interfered. Even Atreus admits despite not getting along with Kratos that his father is definitely capable in leading the way for both of them, and usually follows him without hesitation. Despite his initial reluctance, Kratos was able to lead the armies of <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a> against Asgard effectively, giving decisive commands that were followed through without hesitation. Faye even foresaw that Kratos' leadership skills would allow him to unite all the Nine Realms after Ragnarök.</li>
<li><b>Expert Deceiver</b>: To a certain extent, Kratos has been able to trick his enemies by making use of their emotions to his advantage, using <a href="/wiki/Megaera" title="Megaera">Megaera</a>'s anger against him and feigning defeat to <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a> to catch him off-guard. During his first journey with Atreus, he was able to successfully keep up the facade of being a simply exceptional mortal rather than a God, limiting his powers to a sufficient degree to keep his son from suspecting it, before eventually coming clean.</li></ul></li>
<li><b>Indomitable Will:</b> Determined and dedicated to anything he sets his mind to, Kratos has demonstrated great willpower and fortitude during his journeys. During the <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Greek Era</a>, Kratos was driven by his need for vengeance and refused to give up until he killed those who wronged him, and was able to accomplish feats that were believed impossible, such as killing a God, getting into the <a href="/wiki/Domain_of_Death" title="Domain of Death">Domain of Death</a> to save his brother, obtaining <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a>'s Box, escaping from the <a href="/wiki/Underworld" title="Underworld">Underworld</a>, changing his fate, and killing Zeus. In the Norse Era, despite choosing to kill only in self-defense and to protect his son and allies, Kratos’ grit has remained unshaken. Even since his young days, Kratos was fearless and never backed down nor did he run from his enemies; whatever they were, even charging on Ares to save his brother. Later in his life, he showed no fear in any of his fights against the Aesir gods or any of the creatures he fought, never giving up until they were defeated. When the Norns told him that Heimdall intended to kill Atreus, Kratos became fixated on killing Heimdall, even after Mimir, a trusted friend, initially warned him several times that he had no way to reach Heimdall nor a method to overcome his foresight abilities, Kratos stubbornly remained focused, bluntly stating that Heimdall knowing that he desired to kill him was no advantage.  His enormous mental strength was depicted by how he could successfully break free from illusions and resist great magics, as shown when he broke free from the <a href="/wiki/The_Furies" title="The Furies">Furies</a>' illusions, stopped <a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a> from ripping his soul, and even resisted the seduction of <a href="/wiki/Aphrodite" title="Aphrodite">Aphrodite</a> herself. After moving to the Norse Realms and finding love again and having Atreus, Kratos' willpower, no longer driven by his rage, but instead by love for his newfound family, has only grown stronger due to being tempered by his experiences. Driven by a desire to be a good father to Atreus and ensure his son does not repeat his mistakes, Kratos' willingness allowed him to hold himself back even when Atreus acts defiant, simply and patiently telling him to follow and restraining his anger, and he refused to give up even as Atreus became more arrogant upon learning he was a God, persisting until he was finally able to make Atreus sense his emotions. Despite the loss of Faye and his grief over it, he was able to remain strong due to Atreus, and his love for Faye drove him to not only travel to the highest mountain in Midgard, but even willing to reach <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tunheim" title="Jötunheim">Jötunheim</a> despite the immense difficulty all for the sake of scattering her ashes as she wished in the right place.</li>
<li><figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6d/895px-GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_3_%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100103200609" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="895px-GOW 3 Kratos ( in game picture 3 )" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="895px-GOW 3 Kratos ( in game picture 3 ).jpg" data-image-key="895px-GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_3_%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6d/895px-GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_3_%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100103200609"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6d/895px-GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_3_%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100103200609" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="895px-GOW 3 Kratos ( in game picture 3 )" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6d/895px-GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_3_%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100103200609" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="895px-GOW 3 Kratos ( in game picture 3 ).jpg" data-image-key="895px-GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_3_%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6d/895px-GOW_3_Kratos_%28_in_game_picture_3_%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100103200609"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure><b>Master Combatant:</b> Supplementing Kratos' extraordinary physical powers is his nigh-unmatched battle prowess, being phenomenally lethal and dangerous in all forms of combat, both armed and unarmed, acquired from years of training as a <a href="/wiki/Spartan" title="Spartan">Spartan</a> warrior, which already sufficed to make him the youngest captain and later the greatest general of the Spartans, having killed and slain thousands of enemies for <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>. His combat skills was further honed by experiencing numerous difficult ordeals during his service to the <a href="/wiki/Greek_Gods" title="Greek Gods">Gods</a> and triumphing over armies and powerful monsters, eventually his prowess reached levels where with the divine weapons granted to him and his superior physical prowess, Kratos bested and killed all the Gods and <a href="/wiki/Titans" title="Titans">Titans</a> in his path, despite them having significantly greater experience in combat and also natural usage of divine magic, displaying evidently superior fighting skills. Upon settling in <a href="/wiki/Wildwoods" title="Wildwoods">Midgard</a>, despite having not engaged in combat with god-level enemies for decades and his old age, Kratos' fighting skills have only grown in time, relying more on his skills and experience, described by Mimir as the most proficient killer he had ever seen, even in comparison to most of the war-loving tribe of the <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Æsir</a>. Despite the restraints on his power and also being burdened by Atreus' fragility and his son's undeveloped physical abilities and skills, Kratos' combat skill made him more than capable of dispatching countless of monsters in battle. Despite the burdens on him, Kratos was able to aptly handle the formidable sons of <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>, while being particularly hindered by Atreus' emotions going wild by Modi's taunts, slaying <a href="/wiki/Magni" title="Magni">Magni</a> in combat and forcing <a href="/wiki/Modi" title="Modi">Modi</a> to escape in fear. In his first fight with Baldur, Kratos was capable of defeating the invulnerable and previously unbeatable finest tracker of <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a> three times, even with Baldur having the advantage as he revived with all the damage Kratos dealt to him gone and felt no exhaustion from the fight. Even while briefly overtaken and hampered by Atreus' arrogance at the time, Kratos still successfully fended off Baldur in their second fight and even had a slight edge before they were forced to conclude the fight in a stalemate. In their third fight, Kratos was ultimately able to defeat Baldur once again with minimum help from Atreus. He also successfully defeated the corrupted Valkyries, including even their formidable Regent Queen <a href="/wiki/Sigr%C3%BAn" title="Sigrún">Sigrún</a>, his skill leaving Sigrun utterly impressed to where she adamantly believed and insisted that Freya ally with Kratos instead of seeking vengeance, as he would be an invaluable ally against Asgard. He was also able to repeatedly survive the attempts of Freya, the true Queen of the Valkyries, to kill him and push her back, and fought with Freya when she had recovered her Valkyrie wings, temporarily only losing just because he recognized her and got distracted by this, with Freya noting Kratos never really fought her and was holding back all along. Despite being regarded by Thor himself as holding back in their first fight and lacking the full extent of his equipment, he was still able to contend with the mightiest warrior of Asgard for a prolonged period of time, skillfully holding off a decent amount of Thor's aggressive assault and managing to deliver numerous blows in his own right before Thor eventually gained the upper hand, with Thor admitting Kratos was indeed formidable and it was only natural his sons and brother would have lost to him. In their second fight, despite Kratos struggling in their  previous encounter and Thor going all-out this time, Kratos was able to evade Thor's blows, made full use of his arsenal and strategically countered Thor whenever he tried to use his hammer, leading to Kratos beating Thor decisively. Kratos was also able to successfully stay in combat with <a href="/wiki/Heimdall" title="Heimdall">Heimdall</a> despite him using his <a href="/wiki/Powers" title="Powers">Foresight</a> and eventually become the only person to not only land a single hit on the so-called undefeatable vigilant of the Æsir, but also defeat him, adapting to his precognition swiftly and quickly overpowering and killing Odin's left-hand man. Afterwards, despite all the battle he has been through in Ragnarök, Kratos was still able to hold his ground against Odin himself despite his usage of spells, even managing to overwhelm him at one point before Odin turned the tides using his magic to cast a binding spell, and with help from Atreus and Freya, he was able to overtake the All-Father and eventually defeat him. Kratos also defeated all the <a href="/wiki/Berserkers" title="Berserkers">Berserkers</a>, including their King <a href="/wiki/King_Hr%C3%B3lf_Kraki" title="King Hrólf Kraki">Hrólf Kraki</a> and defeated the <a href="/wiki/Valkyries" title="Valkyries">Valkyrie</a> Queen and the <a href="/wiki/Vanir" title="Vanir">Vanir</a> Goddess <a href="/wiki/Gn%C3%A1" title="Gná">Gná</a>, comparable in strength to Freya. While in <a href="/wiki/Valhalla" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a>, Kratos fought and overwhelmed <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a> repeatedly to the point of yielding and eventually admitting defeat in numerous fierce duels as part of the trial to prove his readiness to continue until the end and as preparation for him to take his place as the new God of War, despite Týr using fighting styles and weapons from lands foreign to Kratos, with the Norse God of War admitting Kratos as being his superior in combat and describing him as being “unstoppable”, even while refraining to deliver the final blow.
<ul><li><b>Sword Mastery:</b> Kratos is an exceptionally skilled swordsman, blades being among his most primary type of weaponry. He used the <a href="/wiki/Sword_of_Valor" title="Sword of Valor">Sword of Valor</a> to kill many enemies with masterful expertise as a Spartan general, and with divine swords such as the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_the_Gods" title="Blade of the Gods">Blade of the Gods</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a>, he was able to skillfully fight and slay powerful enemies such as <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a>, the Colossus of Rhodes, Cronos and Gaia. Despite rarely fighting with blades in the Norse Realm, Kratos is shown to retain his skill in swordsmanship whenever the occasions presented it, wielding a sword summoned by runic attacks to easily deliver devastating attacks as well as stealing and dispatching <a href="/wiki/Light_Elves" title="Light Elves">Light Elves</a> with their own weapon easily. Upon gaining the ability to manifest the Blade of Olympus, Kratos was able to wield it with the same level of grace and proficiency as he once did back on Greece, both against the hordes of enemies on Valhalla and even against <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a>.</li>
<li><b>Hammer Expertise:</b> Kratos was able to use the <a href="/wiki/Barbarian_Hammer" title="Barbarian Hammer">Barbarian Hammer</a> easily and with remarkable skill.</li>
