It was Athena who would deliver Kratos his next assignment during his service with the <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a>, she also tries to convince Zeus to relieve Kratos from his nightmares, saves him from a pointless suicide, and it was she who turned him into the new "<a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a>" after he killed <a href="/wiki/Ares" title="Ares">Ares</a> as reward for his services. She even saved Kratos when he was a child from Ares when they took <a href="/wiki/Deimos" title="Deimos">Deimos</a>, and asked Kratos for forgiveness afterwards, showing that while she thought she was protecting Olympus from the "<b>Marked Warrior</b>" prophecy, she had some regrets in doing so, even calling him "brother", showing that she was aware of his relationship to <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a>. Kratos himself respected Athena to a degree and was one of the few people he cared about outside his family. However, once Kratos began a conquest of Greece, he refused to listen to Athena’s pleas to stop, and she had no other choice but to help Olympus rid themselves of him.
</p><p>Athena discovered that Kratos was alive after Zeus betrayed him, showing that she was still keeping an eye on him. She tries to convince Kratos to abandon his revenge against Zeus, but her pleas fall on deaf ears. When Kratos was on the verge of killing Zeus, Athena intervened and Kratos accidentally killed her, an act he was more strongly affected by than even Zeus. As she lays dying, Athena tells Kratos the truth- that Zeus was his father and (by the extension their relation) and the reason why he tried to kill him. She told him this to end <a href="/wiki/The_Cycle_of_Patricide" title="The Cycle of Patricide">The Cycle of Patricide</a>, to make Kratos abandon his revenge on Zeus. Kratos refused, stating he has no father and Zeus initiated this conflict himself. Realizing that Kratos would never stop trying to kill Zeus, she warned him that the Gods would not stop pursuing Kratos, as Zeus was needed for Olympus would prevail. This did not deter Kratos, who stated that if all of Olympus denied him his vengeance, then all of Olympus would die.
</p><p>After turning into a spirit and realizing the truth of <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Pandora's Box,</a> Athena began aiding Kratos in his revenge against Zeus. While Kratos was initially suspicious of her, he agreed to her plans of using the <a href="/wiki/Flame_of_Olympus" title="Flame of Olympus">Flame of Olympus</a> to destroy Zeus. Once Zeus was killed and the Greek Pantheon was no more, Athena congratulated him and decided that mankind was ready to hear her message, but Kratos stated that the world was in ruins and her message was useless. She wanted to use the power of <a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a>, which Kratos used to kill Zeus, to rebuild the world in her image, but Kratos refused after realizing she was just using him like before. Rather than entrust the future to Athena, Kratos impales himself with the <a href="/wiki/Blade_of_Olympus" title="Blade of Olympus">Blade of Olympus</a>, releasing hope to the mortals so they could live without the Gods of Olympus. Enraged, Athena declared mortals would not know what to do with such power, and told Kratos that he had disappointed her. Removing the Blade from his body, Athena left Kratos to die.
</p><p>However, Kratos survived his suicide, and migrated to <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a>. During his time there, Kratos would experience hallucinations of Athena's spirit during his quest to find a cure for his son's illness. He apparently has dealt with her appearing before, because of his lack of surprise. These hallucinations taunted Kratos, saying that he was pretending to be something he is not, and that he would always be a monster. Kratos agreed with his sister's words, saying that while he was still a monster, he is no longer <i>her</i> monster, revealing he now resented her for having manipulated him.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Atlas" title="Atlas">Atlas</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Kratosvsatlas.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080320111009" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratosvsatlas" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratosvsatlas.jpg" data-image-key="Kratosvsatlas.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Kratosvsatlas.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080320111009"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Kratosvsatlas.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080320111009" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratosvsatlas" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Kratosvsatlas.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080320111009" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratosvsatlas.jpg" data-image-key="Kratosvsatlas.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Kratosvsatlas.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20080320111009"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Atlas despised Kratos for saving the Gods of Olympus and warned him that he would regret what he did. They met again when Kratos was searching for the Sisters of Fate. At first, Atlas tried to kill him but Kratos managed to convince him otherwise. Realizing he was an enemy of Zeus, Atlas tested him and when Kratos passed, he realized that Kratos was a worthy ally of the titans. He helped Kratos across the <a href="/wiki/Great_Chasm" title="Great Chasm">Great Chasm</a> and wished him luck in his quest.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Aphrodite" title="Aphrodite">Aphrodite</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/62/Aphrodite_chambers_.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100416200105" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Aphrodite chambers " src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="100" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Aphrodite chambers .jpg" data-image-key="Aphrodite_chambers_.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/62/Aphrodite_chambers_.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100416200105"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/62/Aphrodite_chambers_.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100416200105" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Aphrodite chambers " src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/62/Aphrodite_chambers_.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100416200105" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="100" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Aphrodite chambers .jpg" data-image-key="Aphrodite_chambers_.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/62/Aphrodite_chambers_.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100416200105"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Aphrodite aided Kratos during his quest to kill Ares by giving him Medusa's head. This allowed Kratos to turn his enemies into stone. During Kratos' war against the Gods of Olympus, Aphrodite didn't participate in defending Olympus, not caring that the other Gods were getting killed or that the world was ending and only cared about having sex. When Kratos first met her, she was being pleased by her handmaidens, but as soon as she saw Kratos, she wanted him to have sex with her. Kratos was unable to harm Aphrodite due to not being threat for him and never caused him any harm as well because of her powers. But fortunately for Kratos, he could resist her attempts to seduce him thanks to his willpower and as his revenge against Zeus was more important to him.
</p><p>An enraged Aphrodite told Kratos that it had been long since a real man came to see her- the bridges leading to her chambers have been nearly destroyed and Zeus refused to allow Daedalus to repair so he could continue working on the Labyrinth to imprison Pandora. Eventually, Aphrodite discovered that Kratos needed help with the bridges and that only Hephaestus could help him. She agreed to show him the way but only if she had sex with him. Kratos agreed, and after finishing, she was angry that Kratos wanted to have his revenge over having sex with her but kept her end of the deal and showed Kratos a portal that lead straight to Hephaestus. When Kratos returned, Aphrodite was ready for another round with him and he can chose to have sex with her or be on his way to continue his revenge.
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Hera" title="Hera">Hera</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Scre234.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227155607" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Scre234" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="107" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Scre234.png" data-image-key="Scre234.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Scre234.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227155607"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Scre234.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227155607" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Scre234" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Scre234.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227155607" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="107" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Scre234.png" data-image-key="Scre234.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Scre234.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227155607"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and his stepmother Hera</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Hera was Zeus' wife, but Zeus would constantly have affairs behind her back and would have children from these affairs. This is why she hated Kratos- because he was a living reminder that Zeus cheated on her. She told her husband to kill Kratos when he was a child, but Zeus instead took pity on him and refused, enraging Hera even more. Every time she met Kratos, she was insulting and hostile towards him while Kratos himself was surprisingly calm. In their final meeting, the goddess would later condemn him for his slaying of the gods because the world was suffering but Kratos simply brushed her aside. It is possible that since Hera was so weak, Kratos didn't see her as a threat and would have let her live if she hadn't insulted Pandora, who Kratos starting to bond with. However, due to Hera's bitterness and insults at Pandora, he killed her without a second thought afterwards.  
</p><p>Centuries later, Kratos still had no regrets killing her because of her cruel nature and listed her among the deserving of death by his hands. 
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Helios" title="Helios">Helios</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/19/Screenshot5678.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227150957" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Screenshot5678" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="97" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Screenshot5678.png" data-image-key="Screenshot5678.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/19/Screenshot5678.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227150957"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/19/Screenshot5678.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227150957" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Screenshot5678" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/19/Screenshot5678.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227150957" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="97" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Screenshot5678.png" data-image-key="Screenshot5678.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/19/Screenshot5678.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227150957"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Helios in his last moments trying to escape from Kratos</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos served Helios just like he served the other Gods of Olympus. When Helios was captured by Atlas, It was Kratos' mission to save him. When he succeeded and returned Helios to his rightful place in the sky, Helios was grateful and even wanted to help Kratos when he was found weak after the journey but was denied by Athena who knew he would live. They would see each other again when Kratos waged war against the Gods of Olympus, with Helios fighting for Olympus. Kratos aided Perses in his fight. With Helios weakened and at Kratos' mercy, he remembered the debt he still owed Kratos and begged Kratos to save him again, promising to repay him.
</p><p>Kratos was intrigued by the offer, but was still suspicious. He demanded Helios to tell him where the Flame of Olympus was. Helios refused to tell him and tried to use the power of the Sun to kill Kratos, but Kratos was able to withstand his attack and stepped on Helios. Helios tried to trick Kratos by making him touch the Flame of Olympus, but this didn't work, as Kratos already knew that doing so would end in his death. Realizing that his end was near, Helios told Kratos killing him would not lead him to Zeus. Kratos disagreed, and ripped Helios' head off and began using it as a lantern.
</p><p>Centuries later, while traveling Valhalla, it was revealed that a part of Kratos regretted killing Helios, as he had grew to realize that he didn't really need to kill the God of the Sun and had repaid Helios' previous saving of his life with his ruthless, relentless anger, especially as killing Helios greatly increased the suffering of Greece. Due to this, Helios would replace Mimir at certain times in accompanying him to Valhalla, and while acting cold towards Helios, Kratos never retorted against Helios's words and even apologized to Helios by admitting he was unjust in killing him.
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Hades" title="Hades">Hades</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/Hades425.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120426020152" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Hades425" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Hades425.jpg" data-image-key="Hades425.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/Hades425.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20120426020152"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/Hades425.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120426020152" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Hades425" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/Hades425.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20120426020152" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Hades425.jpg" data-image-key="Hades425.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1e/Hades425.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20120426020152"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos against his uncle Hades</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Unknown to Kratos, Hades had played a major role in his early life, as during <a href="/wiki/The_Wager_of_the_Gods" title="The Wager of the Gods">his hunt for the Ambroisa</a>, Hades sent out <a href="/wiki/Alrik" title="Alrik">his champion</a> to defeat Kratos. The young Spartan nearly fell victim to Hades sending fireballs after him but it only killed <a href="/wiki/Captain_Nikos" title="Captain Nikos">Kratos' superior</a> and later personally tried to kill him with <a href="/wiki/Arms_of_Hades" title="Arms of Hades">Arms of Hades</a> but Kratos overcame it and refused to let even the Gods stand in his way. Kratos ultimately succeeded and Hades tasked his champion to seek vengeance, thus setting in motion the events of the series.
</p><p>Years later, Kratos served Hades just like he served all the other Gods of Olympus. Hades aided Kratos when he was attempting to acquire <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a>'s Box by giving him the magic <a href="/wiki/Army_of_Hades" title="Army of Hades">Army of Hades</a>. After being infected by the evils of Pandora's Box this made him hate Kratos for killing his wife <a href="/wiki/Persephone" title="Persephone">Persephone</a>. During his travel of the <a href="/wiki/Island_of_Creation" title="Island of Creation">Island of Creation</a>, Kratos decided to keep pressing in his journey after being warned by Gaia that Hades will ensure his soul is tortured forever. Hades would also despise Kratos for killing <a href="/wiki/Poseidon" title="Poseidon">Poseidon</a> and his niece <a href="/wiki/Athena" title="Athena">Athena</a>. When Hades fought Kratos, he tried to kill him and vowed to make him suffer for all the pain he caused him but the tables were turned when Kratos stole his weapons, the <a href="/wiki/Claws_of_Hades" title="Claws of Hades">Claws of Hades</a>, and stole his soul instead, and killed Hades.
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Hermes" title="Hermes">Hermes</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Screensheww4.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227113544" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Screensheww4" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="94" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Screensheww4.png" data-image-key="Screensheww4.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Screensheww4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227113544"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Screensheww4.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227113544" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Screensheww4" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Screensheww4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227113544" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="94" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Screensheww4.png" data-image-key="Screensheww4.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Screensheww4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227113544"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Hermes versus Kratos</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos served Hermes along with the other Gods of Olympus. However, it seems that Hermes didn't contribute to Kratos' service as much as the other Gods did, as he is not shown giving Kratos any assignments to do. During his time as a God, Kratos likely earned Hermes' fury by killing his son <a href="/wiki/Ceryx" title="Ceryx">Ceryx</a>.
</p><p>Kratos personally encounters him during his war against Olympus but Kratos dismisses him as a threat, even calling him "a fly from the ass of Zeus" and only attacked Hermes when he insulted and provoked him. Hermes, instead of fighting Kratos, tried to avoid him by running at fast speeds. Once outsmarted and cornered, he tried to defeat Kratos, but because of his weakened state he easily fell to the Spartan's might. In his final moments, he insulted Kratos one last time and Kratos simply let him talk before killing the messenger God. 
</p><p><br>
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Hercules" title="Hercules">Hercules</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b8/Screensho667.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227125206" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Screensho667" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="99" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Screensho667.png" data-image-key="Screensho667.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b8/Screensho667.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227125206"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b8/Screensho667.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227125206" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Screensho667" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b8/Screensho667.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227125206" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="99" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Screensho667.png" data-image-key="Screensho667.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/b8/Screensho667.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227125206"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and Hercules talking</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Hercules was Kratos' half-brother. They seemed to know each other before Kratos waged war on the Gods and addressed each other as brothers.
</p><p>However, Hercules was jealous of Kratos because he had gained more fame and glory than him by allowing him to kill Ares, and by becoming the new <b>"God of War"</b> while he himself was sent on his labors, which he considered pitiful by comparison. Because of this, Hercules believed that Kratos was Zeus' favourite and wanted to kill him to prove to their father that he deserved the title of the God of War. Kratos, however, had no intention of fighting Hercules and instead tried to reason with him, saying that his war with the Gods had nothing to do with Hercules and that he was misguided in thinking Zeus had favourites. But Hercules refused to listen and attacked Kratos, who was then forced to kill his brother.
</p><p>Hercules remains the only God Kratos actually tried to dissuade from fighting against him and the only divine sibling Kratos openly acknowledged, besides Deimos. Despite this, however, while Kratos did not want his brother's death, centuries later, he admitted he didn't regret stopping him from becoming God of War even if it meant killing him, as his desire for the throne was driven by selfish reasons.
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Hephaestus" title="Hephaestus">Hephaestus</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Hephaestus_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100730035238" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Hephaestus 2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Hephaestus 2.jpg" data-image-key="Hephaestus_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Hephaestus_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100730035238"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Hephaestus_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100730035238" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Hephaestus 2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Hephaestus_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100730035238" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Hephaestus 2.jpg" data-image-key="Hephaestus_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Hephaestus_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100730035238"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and his older half-brother Hephaestus</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos and Hephaestus seem to know each other before his exile. While Hephaestus blamed Kratos for his suffering, he was never hostile to Kratos and was friendly towards him. Hephaestus told Kratos what he knew about the secrets of Olympus- particularly the <a href="/wiki/Flame_of_Olympus" title="Flame of Olympus">Flame of Olympus</a>. He also told Kratos how he used to be the prize craftsman in Olympus, and how he enjoyed his life on Olympus, but when Kratos killed Ares, that was when his life changed. It was at that point that Zeus became the monster he was now. He beat Hephaestus to a bloody pulp and took <a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a>, his daughter, away from him so he could suffer for all eternity. Hephaestus tried to recreate Pandora, but no matter how hard he tried, he failed, time and time again.
</p><p>Knowing of Kratos' skill, he hoped that he could recover her for him, but Kratos refused. He tried to persuade Kratos by reminding him that he, too, used to be a father. While Kratos was moved by this, he still chose not to help Hephaestus. Later, Kratos encountered Hephaestus again. At first, he mistook him for Aphrodite but then realized his error, sarcastically asking if his wife conquered another God of War but was ignored. Kratos told him he was seeking <a href="/wiki/Labyrinth" title="Labyrinth">the Labyrinth</a>. Hephaestus, confused, thought he sought the Flame of Olympus, but realized what Kratos was planning. He told him to stay away from Pandora. Hephaestus explained that Kratos was the reason she was in there in the first place, and why he was also banished to the Underworld.
</p><p>Kratos denied doing anything wrong to Hephaestus, but by opening Pandora's Box he had. He told Kratos that to contain the evils born from the Great War, he had to use a power greater than the Gods - the Flame of Olympus, which, when he finished it he knew putting it in the Flame would be the safest place. To get the Box, he created Pandora who was needed to pacify the Flame, but in time, he saw Pandora as his daughter and couldn't bear the thought of losing her. Hephaestus lied to Zeus, telling him that it is still on the back of Cronos. It is because it was the safest place as he thought no one could best the Titan. It was after Kratos succeeded in getting the Box that Zeus knew Hephaestus lied to him. Zeus tortured him until eventually he told the truth about where to put Pandora's Box, and how Pandora was needed to get the Box. When trying to convince Kratos to not sacrifice Pandora, he instead sent him on a suicide mission and hoped that Cronos would kill him. Instead, Kratos killed Cronos. Hephaestus forged <a href="/wiki/Nemesis_Whip" title="Nemesis Whip">the Nemesis Whip</a> and tried to kill Kratos himself to protect Pandora but Kratos managed to kill him instead. His last wish was that Pandora forgive him for failing to protect her and begged Kratos to spare her. Kratos wasn't angry at Hephaestus for trying to kill him, as told Pandora he died protecting his child, something Kratos himself understood. Kratos knew that if he had been in the Hephaestus' situation, he would have done the same thing.
</p><p>Centuries later, he admitted regret killing Hephaestus because he was undeserving and how they similarly suffered. Kratos even listed the Smith God, as one of the many undeserving of death because he had noble intentions. He also voiced praise of his craftmanship, during a talk with Atreus.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Pandora" title="Pandora">Pandora</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a3/Scwee.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227070441" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Scwee" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="96" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Scwee.png" data-image-key="Scwee.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a3/Scwee.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227070441"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a3/Scwee.png/revision/latest?cb=20231227070441" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Scwee" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a3/Scwee.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227070441" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="96" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Scwee.png" data-image-key="Scwee.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a3/Scwee.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231227070441"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>At first, Kratos wasn't interested in Pandora, as he only cared about getting his revenge on Zeus. However, she grew on him and he viciously killed Hera for insulting her. When he figured out that Pandora was needed to gain <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Pandora's Box</a>, the very thing that Kratos needed to kill Zeus, he went to rescue her. When the time came for him to sacrifice Pandora, Kratos relented as he had bonded with Pandora and wanted to find another way to kill Zeus. He even showed his protective nature by demanding that Zeus release her after he held her captive and got enraged by his rough treatment of her. When Pandora sacrificed herself to unlock the Box, it was shown to be empty, leading Kratos to believe that she was sacrificed in vain. This turned to be false as Pandora's spirit communicated with Kratos inside his mind, allowing him to forgive himself for his sins and use the Power of Hope that was buried deep within him to kill Zeus. Inspired by Pandora's words, he released the power of <a href="/wiki/Hope" title="Hope">Hope</a> in a way that allowed the mortals of the Greek World to live without the Gods of Olympus.
</p><p>Centuries later, Kratos while traversing Valhalla would remember Pandora and speak of how she was like his own daughter in many ways, and was innocent in her worldwiew. He would tell Týr and Mimir that she deserved a better fate than being a pawn sacrificed in a game of gods. Later after coming to terms with his past, he would remember Pandora’s words about hope. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Poseidon" title="Poseidon">Poseidon</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9d/KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG/revision/latest?cb=20221030080235" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="KratosMeetsPoseidon" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="98" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG" data-image-key="KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9d/KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221030080235"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9d/KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG/revision/latest?cb=20221030080235" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="KratosMeetsPoseidon" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9d/KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221030080235" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="98" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG" data-image-key="KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/9d/KratosMeetsPoseidon.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221030080235"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos served Poseidon just like he served all the other Gods of <a href="/wiki/Mount_Olympus" title="Mount Olympus">Olympus</a> at first. Poseidon aided Kratos against the <a href="/wiki/Hydra" title="Hydra">Hydra</a> by giving him the magic '<a href="/wiki/Poseidon%27s_Rage" title="Poseidon's Rage">Poseidon's Rage</a>'. However, Kratos' destructive conquest of <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a> along with Kratos destroying <a href="/wiki/Atlantis" title="Atlantis">Atlantis</a>, and with the evil of Pandora's <a href="/wiki/Pandora%27s_Box" title="Pandora's Box">Box</a> infecting him, made Poseidon despise Kratos. When Kratos attacked Olympus with the Titans, Poseidon battled Kratos with all his might to make him pay for the crimes he committed against him, only to be eventually killed by Kratos.
</p><p>Centuries later, in Midgard, Kratos briefly allured to his fight with Poseidon and his skirmish with the hippocamps when he, Freya and Mimir found a Kelpie during their search for the Norns. Freya sarcastically replied that his brutal battle with Poseidon may not be the Kelpie's favorite subject.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Persephone" title="Persephone">Persephone</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a8/Persephone.2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100211110443" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Persephone.2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Persephone.2.jpg" data-image-key="Persephone.2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a8/Persephone.2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100211110443"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a8/Persephone.2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100211110443" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Persephone.2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a8/Persephone.2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100211110443" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Persephone.2.jpg" data-image-key="Persephone.2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/a8/Persephone.2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100211110443"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Persephone was Kratos' half-sister and was encountered in the Underworld alongside Calliope, even willing to abandon the Gods to the power of Morpheus. He was insulting and hostile to Persephone, but nevertheless, she helped Kratos reunite with his daughter. She warned him that the world would suffer for his choice, which Kratos ignored. Persephone revealed that Kratos being reunited with his daughter was part of her plan to destroy the world and free herself from her miserable existence. Realizing that the destruction of the world would mean the end of Calliope, as well, Kratos' rage at Persephone increased. He was forced to abandon his daughter and Kratos killed Persephone for both threatening to put his daughter in harm's way and for making him give up the only chance he had to be with her.
</p><p>Persephone also noted on how she and Kratos were alike at being prisoners to fate. She was the first God to meet her end at Kratos' hands and her death later played a role in Kratos' war of the gods, as Hades sought vengeance on him for it. Kratos later used the casket, containing her body to progress the Underworld. Unknowingly, Kratos showed himself to be like Persephone by slaying the Gods and unleashing destruction on Greece. 
</p><p>Centuries later, Kratos still had no regrets killing her because of her cruel and manipulative nature that cost him the chance to be with his daughter. Kratos indirectly listed her, as among the many deserving of death by his hands for her ways. It is also likely he holds her in the same disdain as Ares for taking his family. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Theseus" title="Theseus">Theseus</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest?cb=20201012233155" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Theseus vs Kratos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Theseus vs Kratos.png" data-image-key="Theseus_vs_Kratos.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201012233155"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest?cb=20201012233155" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Theseus vs Kratos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201012233155" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Theseus vs Kratos.png" data-image-key="Theseus_vs_Kratos.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c3/Theseus_vs_Kratos.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201012233155"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Theseus meets Kratos</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos was aware of Theseus, as Theseus was aware of Kratos losing his divine status as the "<a href="/wiki/God_of_War_(God)" title="God of War (God)">God of War</a>" and mocked him for it as well as his journey to reach the <a href="/wiki/Sisters_of_Fate" title="Sisters of Fate">Sisters of Fate</a>. Kratos had some respect for Theseus, as he was the last person that Kratos believed would serve the Sisters of Fate and would have let Theseus lived had he not decided to fight and kill Kratos.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Perseus" title="Perseus">Perseus</a> 
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240221033650" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Perseus with his Sling" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Perseus with his Sling.jpg" data-image-key="Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240221033650"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240221033650" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Perseus with his Sling" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240221033650" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Perseus with his Sling.jpg" data-image-key="Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e8/Perseus_with_his_Sling.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240221033650"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos battling Perseus</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Perseus was Kratos' half-brother. They seemed to know each other before Kratos waged war on the Gods, as Perseus addressed Kratos with familiarity, even knowing of his recent loss of position as the God of War.
</p><p>When they met of the <a href="/wiki/Island_of_Creation" title="Island of Creation">Island of Creation</a>, Kratos encountered Perseus and the two became trapped, with Perseus being annoyed with him. However, Perseus realized the <a href="/wiki/Sisters_of_Fate" title="Sisters of Fate">Sisters of Fate</a> were likely testing him and believed to egain his lost lover, he'd have to defeat Kratos, who was then forced to battle his brother. It was worth noting Kratos never says a single word to Perseus, meaning he had nothing to say him but accepted the challenge to progress. Like many, Perseus underestimates the abilities of Kratos, as he doesn't believe that Kratos should have been granted the chance to kill Ares and even calls him a harpy's fool. However, in his fight with Kratos, he saw the Spartan's strength and realized his error in his judgment, a mistake that led to Kratos brutally killing him and escaping his confinement. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Thanatos" title="Thanatos">Thanatos</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/46/Kratos_stabs_Thanatos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250711152113" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos stabs Thanatos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos stabs Thanatos.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_stabs_Thanatos.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/46/Kratos_stabs_Thanatos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250711152113"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/46/Kratos_stabs_Thanatos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250711152113" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos stabs Thanatos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/46/Kratos_stabs_Thanatos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250711152113" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="102" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos stabs Thanatos.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_stabs_Thanatos.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/46/Kratos_stabs_Thanatos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250711152113"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos stabs Thanotos </p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>When Kratos discovered that his brother Deimos was alive and being tortured by Thanatos, Kratos was enraged and vowed to rescue his brother. He also warned the God of Death not to interfere, as he will kill him like Ares, showing no fear towards Thanatos, in spite of him being among the powerful Gods. When they met personally, Thanatos told Kratos for the murder of his daughter, he will ensure he suffers and took Deimos away. Kratos hated Thanatos for all the pain he caused to Deimos and worked with his brother to make Thanatos pay. Thanatos also realized Kratos not Deimos was actually the <a href="/wiki/The_Marked_Warrior" title="The Marked Warrior">The Marked Warrior</a> ment to destroy Olympus. When Thanatos ended up killing Deimos, Kratos' hatred grew further for his enemy and he overpowered Thanatos. Once he was weakened, Kratos beat Thanatos without mercy while ignoring his taunts and ultimately killed.
</p><p>Centuries later, Kratos still had no regrets killing him because of his cruelty that cost him the chance to be with his brother. Kratos indirectly listed him as among the many deserving of death by his hands for his ways. It is also likely he holds him in the same disdain as Ares and Persephone for taking his family.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Erinys" title="Erinys">Erinys</a>
</p><p>Erinys was sent by Thanatos to stop Kratos from saving his brother. Kratos was determined to save him and would not allow anything to stop him, including Erinys. Kratos likely was neutral and annoyed towards Erinys, as she was simply an obstacle for him to overcome in saving Deimos not only for trying to stop him, but likely became more wrathful towards her killing of several Spartan soldiers.
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Gaia" title="Gaia">Gaia</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d4/Capture2.png/revision/latest?cb=20110623015732" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Capture2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Capture2.png" data-image-key="Capture2.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d4/Capture2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110623015732"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d4/Capture2.png/revision/latest?cb=20110623015732" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Capture2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d4/Capture2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110623015732" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Capture2.png" data-image-key="Capture2.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d4/Capture2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20110623015732"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos meets Gaia</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos was Zeus' son, which made Gaia his great-grandmother. Ever since Gaia and the other <a href="/wiki/Titans" title="Titans">Titans</a> were banished to Tartarus by Zeus, she wanted revenge on her grandson. She saw Kratos as the warrior she needed to enact her revenge and kept a close eye on him. When Zeus betrayed Kratos, Gaia saved him and told him to go to the <a href="/wiki/Sisters_of_Fate" title="Sisters of Fate">Sisters of Fate</a>; that way, he could go back in time to the point where Zeus betrayed him so he could have a better chance at defeating Zeus.
</p><p>She explained to Kratos that the reason she helped Kratos was to get revenge on Zeus for his betrayal against all the Titans. When Zeus was supposed to be eaten by his father, Cronos, <a href="/wiki/Rhea" title="Rhea">Rhea</a> (Zeus' mother) instead gave her child to Gaia to protect him and to raise him to free his brothers from Cronos. However, her act of compassion for Zeus would come back to haunt her, as Zeus not only wanted to free his brothers from his father, but also to take his place as the new ruler of the mortal world. By throwing his aunts and uncles into Tartarus, he betrayed all Titans just because of the sins of one.
</p><p>When Kratos was about to give up and be killed by the <a href="/wiki/Kraken" title="Kraken">Kraken</a>, Gaia appeared before him and told him he must press on, for a Great War was coming and they needed him to lead them into battle. She warned him that if Zeus were to discover that Kratos was alive, he would hunt him down and kill him, and then Hades would collect his soul and make sure that Kratos was forever tortured. Gaia encouraged Kratos to keep going by giving him the ashes of his beloved Sparta so that it could fuel his rage, giving Kratos back his will to live.
</p><p>Kratos went back in time to the first Great War and saved Gaia along with the rest of the Titans, and together they climbed Mount Olympus ready to have their revenge on Zeus. While climbing the mountain, Poseidon joined the fight and tried to pull the Titans off the mountain. Together, Kratos and Gaia defeated Poseidon. They eventually reached Zeus and, in an attempt to kill them, Zeus fired a lightning bolt at them. Gaia tried to stop her grandson but was too slow. Kratos begged Gaia for aid but Gaia refused to help Kratos, for if she did, they would both fall. Kratos reminded her that the promised death of Zeus was why she saved Kratos. To this, she stated she had saved him only to serve the Titans. It was at this point that Gaia revealed her true colors- that she saw Kratos as nothing more than a pawn who had lost its usefulness and told Kratos that Zeus was no longer his concern, that was their war, not his, after which she purposely let him fall off the mountain into the Underworld.
</p><p>Kratos later encounters Gaia again in the City of Olympia, where she appears to have been further pushed back from Olympus by her injury and is now hanging onto a cliff edge. Seeing Kratos again, Gaia expresses surprise and then requests his assistance in getting back to the battle. Kratos, still enraged by her betrayal, sarcastically repeats her request for help and then points out she betrayed him. Gaia attempts to justify herself, but Kratos simply ignores her and begins cutting through what's left of her arm. When the Titaness asks if she means nothing to him, Kratos coldly echoes her previous words to him before he fell off the mountain by telling her that she was simply a means to an end, nothing more and that this was his war, not the Titans. He then stabbed the last remaining bone that connected her arm to her nearly severed hand with the Blade of Olympus, causing it to explode and the Titaness to fall beyond the cliff edge, leading Kratos to believe she died.
</p><p>However, during Kratos' final showdown with Zeus, Gaia was shown to be in fact still alive, and had managed to grow a new hand which she then used to climb all the way up to the top of Olympus. Kratos expressed surprise at seeing her alive, to which she responded that the world bleeds because of all of the destruction he caused by killing the Gods. Gaia then remarked that she never wanted Kratos dead but he has left her no choice. She attempted to crush both father and son with her hands, but Kratos and Zeus jumped into the hole in Gaia's shoulder to quickly escape. Kratos killed his great-grandmother shortly thereafter by purposely destroying her heart during his fight with Zeus, which caused her body to fall at Olympus.
</p><p>Centuries later, Kratos still had no regrets killing her because of her manipulative nature that drove him to seek vengeance and destroy Greece. He indirectly listed her as the many who were deserving of death.
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Cronos" title="Cronos">Cronos</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e7/Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100929174359" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Cronos-Hi-Def" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg" data-image-key="Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e7/Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100929174359"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e7/Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100929174359" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Cronos-Hi-Def" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e7/Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100929174359" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg" data-image-key="Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e7/Cronos-Hi-Def.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20100929174359"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and his grandfather Cronos</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>As Kratos was Zeus' son, Cronos was Kratos' grandfather. They first met when Kratos tried to retrieve Pandora's Box. Cronos didn't seem to care, and allowed Kratos to climb to Pandora's Temple to claim Pandora's Box. When Kratos succeeded, Zeus, who was consumed by fear, believed that Kratos would seek Cronos' aid. Zeus also blamed Cronos for Kratos managing to retrieve the box as he was supposed to kill anyone trying to reach Pandora's Temple. He promptly banished Cronos to the pits of <a href="/wiki/Tartarus" title="Tartarus">Tartarus</a>. Cronos despised Kratos, blaming him for his torment.
</p><p>They met again when Kratos went to Tartarus, where he tried to kill Kratos as punishment for his suffering, and also to avenge Gaia who was supposedly dead. Unlike many, Cronos acknowledged the Spartan's skill and even called him a great warrior. Unable to defeat Cronos head-on, Kratos used his wits and skills and managed to avoid Cronos but instead damage parts of his body. Eventually, Cronos captured Kratos and ate him. This would later prove to be an error as Kratos managed to cut Cronos open from the inside, releasing his intestines. Realizing he had been bested, he pleaded Kratos to leave him be, but Kratos ignored his pleas and killed Cronos. Realizing that his death was nigh, he insulted Kratos one last time by calling him a coward who kills his own kin. While it was true that Kratos wanted to kill his father Zeus, Cronos himself was no better as he tried to kill his own children as they were prophesied to kill him, showing that his last words were ironic.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Norse_Timeline">Norse Timeline</span></h3>
<p><a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Laufey</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d0/Kratos_and_Faye.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240130234057" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Kratos and Faye" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Kratos and Faye.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_and_Faye.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d0/Kratos_and_Faye.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240130234057"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d0/Kratos_and_Faye.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240130234057" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Kratos and Faye" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d0/Kratos_and_Faye.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240130234057" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Kratos and Faye.jpg" data-image-key="Kratos_and_Faye.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/d/d0/Kratos_and_Faye.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240130234057"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and Faye</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Laufey the Just, or Faye as she is affectionately called, became Kratos' second wife after he left Greece for <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a>. The two met and fought when Faye was looking for her <a href="/wiki/Leviathan_Axe" title="Leviathan Axe">Leviathan Axe</a> before falling in love and settling down. Together, they bore another child who was named <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>. Faye, like Lysandra before her, loved Kratos dearly and she shared his animosity towards the <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a>. She was aware of the role he and their son would play regarding <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a>. 
</p><p>To that end, she instructed her husband to, after her death, cremate her and spread her ashes upon the highest peak in the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a>. Kratos, up to that point, was unaware of Faye's status as a <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Giant</a> but had found love again with her, having cared deeply for her just as he had for <a href="/wiki/Lysandra" title="Lysandra">Lysandra</a>. He was enraged when Atreus believed that he lacked grief for her, and despised how her son spoke ill of her. His love for Faye was so great that he knew she had good reasons to hide the fact she was a Giant from her family, and angrily rebuffed Freya when she insinuated that Faye sent him on his journey to Jotunheim so that he could avenge her race by bringing down Asgard, unintentionally implying that Faye only married him to manipulate and use him as a weapon against the Aesir. After bringing down Asgard and defeating Odin, Kratos found her shrine, which revealed that she had destroyed Atreus' shrine in the Jotunheim mountain specifically so that Kratos and Atreus wouldn't know their fate (which the giants had prophesized would end with Kratos' death at Thor's hands). Kratos realized that Faye went against her own people to protect him and Atreus, and not let them be bound by the fate that the Giants had carved out for them, undoubtedly proving that her love for him was genuine. 
</p><p>His relationship with Faye was shown further in depth in his dreams. Faye would lightly tease Kratos for his gruff and quiet demeanor and spend time hunting together in the forest. Kratos deeply respected Faye and her kind nature, telling Atreus that she was better than a God. Kratos would use Faye's example of kindness to steer Atreus onto a better path: when Kratos and Atreus were stuck in Hel thanks to Atreus' recklessness, he outright demanded Atreus to honor Faye and abandon his path of pride and violence he'd chosen. Because of Kratos' faith in Faye, he was shocked to learn that she was responsible for the destruction of the valley in <a href="/wiki/Vanaheim" title="Vanaheim">Vanaheim</a> in her fight with <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>. Kratos remarks how he'd never imagined Faye could possess the kind of wrath to cause such devastation.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png/revision/latest?cb=20180926215952" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png" data-image-key="Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180926215952"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png/revision/latest?cb=20180926215952" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180926215952" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png" data-image-key="Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/9/92/Atreus-god-of-war-ps4-pro.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180926215952"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Father and son</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Atreus is the son of Kratos and <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Laufey</a> the Just. He was Kratos' second child after Calliope. At Faye's request, Kratos did not raise Atreus and instead spent most of his time either hunting or training to control his rage. This meant that Kratos rarely ever interacted with Atreus during his early developing years, and whenever he did speak to Atreus, he was often blunt and distant, leading to Atreus believing that Kratos didn't care for him, as well as knowing nothing about Kratos' past. Kratos hardly addresses his son by name, mainly referring to him as "Boy".
</p><p>Once Faye died, he decided to raise Atreus himself, focusing on teaching him survival skills and preparing him for their journey to spread Faye's ashes, but was often harsh and brusque with his words, rarely showing affection. Deep down however, Kratos loved and cared for Atreus, his strictness coming from his resentment of his own violent past and wanting to protect Atreus. Kratos feared that, without discipline, or if Atreus learnt about his past, he would grow up to become a cruel, violent god, no better than the man he once was in <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a>. Kratos often scolded Atreus whenever he made a mistake, and although at times he would shout in anger, he always managed to calm himself down before things got too heated.    
</p><p>Kratos took him to Freya so she could save him, and traveled to <a href="/wiki/Helheim" title="Helheim">Helheim</a> to find the ingredient needed to revive him. This was also one of the rare occasions in a long time that Kratos has ever been terrified and desperate enough to ask another God if he still did not fully trust for help, even going as far as apologizing to Freya for his initial rudeness over learning about her identity and godhood.
</p><p>At first, he kept his past a secret from his son out of shame, but eventually told him more about it so Atreus didn't make the same mistakes he did and so that he could be better than he was. They bonded during their journey and now both were willing to protect each other from any threat.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221117150732" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2.jpg" data-image-key="Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150732"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221117150732" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150732" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Surviving Fimbulwinter 2.jpg" data-image-key="Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/8/8a/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150732"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Three years later, their relationship improved considerably, with Kratos now calling Atreus by name. However, there was some lingering tension between them as Kratos rigorously trained Atreus during Fimbulwinter, which the latter was annoyed by. Unfortunately, seeds of mistrust would be sown between the two due to Atreus' embracing of his Loki identity—and growing secrecy about his actions—and Odin (disguised as Týr) taking advantage of Kratos' growing concern for his son's safety by encouraging Atreus to do what he wanted. This would culminate in their strained relationship for sometime, which would eventually get mended after Atreus accidentally releases the realm-tearing Garm—whom Kratos helps fight off—and shows regret for doing that and his secretive actions and subsequent recklessness—all of which he apologizes for—with Kratos also apologizing for mistrusting him. Kratos eventually shows pride in his son and supports the latter's decision to leave the Norse lands in search of giants. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180524041421" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="God-of-war-freya" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180524041421"><div style="position: absolute;
