bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180524041421" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="God-of-war-freya" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180524041421" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-image-key="God-of-war-freya.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/66/God-of-war-freya.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180524041421"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and Freya</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>At first, Kratos was wary of Freya as he didn't like strangers, but did help her as it was his fault that her friend was hurt. Even though Freya wanted to help Kratos and Atreus, he was still suspicious of her and only allowed it because Faye's quest was more important. Once he realized the truth, that she was a Goddess, he instantly no longer trusted her due to his own experience with the <a href="/wiki/Olympians" title="Olympians">Gods of Olympus</a>. Once Atreus was sick though, he instantly went to Freya and begged her to save his son. Freya agreed and told Kratos of the ingredient she needed to create a cure that would bring Atreus back from the brink of death; the heart of the <a href="/wiki/Hr%C3%A6svelgr" title="Hræsvelgr">Bridgekeeper</a> in <a href="/wiki/Helheim" title="Helheim">Helheim</a>, the Realm of the Dead. Before he left, Kratos attempted to apologize for his earlier behavior towards her, only to be stopped by Freya, who reassured him that he was right to distrust the word of a God. Freya then promised she would keep his son safe until he returned, noting that she was a parent as well.
</p><p>After retrieving the heart and returning to Freya's home, the two briefly discussed how the cure would only be temporary and that in order to heal properly, Kratos would need to tell Atreus the truth about his nature as a God. Freya then revealed she also had a son, whom she had not seen in a very long time and that she too had let her own fear take precedence over what her son needed, but she never realized his growing resentment until it was too late. Freya advised Kratos to not make the same mistake and reassured him that while the truth is never simple, nothing ever is when it comes to being a parent. Atreus then awoke, the cure having broken the fever. After this interaction, Kratos gained a newfound respect for Freya and vowed to never forget how she helped his family.
</p><p>He was quick to figure out upon learning that <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a> was Freya's son  and that Freya was the one who cursed <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a> so that he couldn't say anything about it. Still, despite this, Kratos still cared for and respected her as he did not attack her and told Atreus to remain calm and actively defended Freya from Baldur. Alas, this would cause Freya to turn against Kratos, though, neither of them were eager to engage one another, Freya pleading with Kratos and Atreus to stop attacking Baldur and let her reason with him and Kratos in return not attacking her for her attempts and continuing to fight Baldur to protect her. In a cruel twist of fate, Kratos managed to repay this debt by killing Baldur, Freya's son, who was about to strangle his mother to death due to the resentment and hatred he had carried for her for cursing him with sensory deprivation as a side effect of her invulnerability spell for over a hundred years. Freya was enraged by the death of her son and vowed revenge. Kratos wasn't angry because of what she said as he understood the pain of losing a child, and hoped that in time Freya would forgive him for what he did.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240108170315" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg" data-image-key="09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240108170315"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240108170315" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240108170315" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg" data-image-key="09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7f/09808937b316281f5f3544777ab54db9.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240108170315"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Freya would eventually keep her promise of revenge and began attacking Kratos and Atreus whenever they left home to get food. Kratos, however, would not fight back and only fend her off, showing that he still cared for her despite her hatred. His care was still strong that he even refused <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a>'s offer to keep Freya off his back in exchange for not attacking the All - Father and leaving him alone. Freya would even send <a href="/wiki/Raiders" title="Raiders">Raiders</a> to his home to try and kill him but that did not change his care for her. After this, the two would temporarily form a truce to save <a href="/wiki/Vanaheim" title="Vanaheim">Vanaheim</a> where their relationship would be rocky at first with Freya rebuffing Kratos' attempts at consoling her, but after killing <a href="/wiki/N%C3%AD%C3%B0h%C3%B6gg" title="Níðhögg">Níðhögg</a>,  Freya would admit that Kratos did not deserve to die, despite claiming that a part of her would hate him, to which Kratos understands and tells her that she does not need to explain herself to him about it. Overtime, after he helps her break off her ties to Odin and helps her defend her people, they would both make amends, with Freya even slowly understanding and empathizing with Kratos more after he reveals his tragic life and past to her.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/52/Images_-_2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240202005249" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Images - 2024-02-01T215202.252" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="112" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Images - 2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg" data-image-key="Images_-_2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/52/Images_-_2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240202005249"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/52/Images_-_2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240202005249" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Images - 2024-02-01T215202.252" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/52/Images_-_2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240202005249" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="112" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Images - 2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg" data-image-key="Images_-_2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/52/Images_-_2024-02-01T215202.252.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240202005249"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos met Baldur when he attacked Kratos' home. At first, Kratos didn't want to fight Baldur, but Baldur's attacks as well as his provocation forced Kratos to defend himself. Once Kratos discovered the truth, that Freya was Baldur's mother and he was going to kill her to punish her for all the pain she caused by making him invulnerable and depriving him of sensation, Kratos tried to stop him. He understood why Baldur was going to kill Freya but warned him that vengeance would not bring him peace and was forced to fight and kill Baldur to protect Freya. Kratos both despised and pitied Baldur, as Baldur represented Kratos at the stage of his life where he was consumed by vengeance, refusing to stand down or listen to warning no matter how many times he was told, even continuing his hunt of Kratos after getting his neck snapped during their first encounter. Similarly, Kratos ignored every mortal and god that told him to abandon his pursuit of vengeance, and stopped at nothing, even death, to kill <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a>. 
</p><p>Kratos took no pleasure in killing Baldur, knowing that it would cause Freya immense grief, however he didn't regret his actions, as he knew that if he let Baldur live, he wouldn't have abandoned his pursuit of vengeance and would have tried to kill Freya and himself.  
</p><p>However, after he and Freya came across his frozen dragon, Dagsetr in Midgard, Kratos revealed to Freya that he did not blame Baldur for coming after them, as it was Odin who gave him the commands. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Brok" title="Brok">Brok</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Brokk-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180319215244" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Brokk-GOW18" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="89" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Brokk-GOW18.jpg" data-image-key="Brokk-GOW18.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Brokk-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180319215244"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Brokk-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180319215244" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Brokk-GOW18" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Brokk-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180319215244" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="89" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Brokk-GOW18.jpg" data-image-key="Brokk-GOW18.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/c/c8/Brokk-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180319215244"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Brok was the first ally Kratos met on his quest to spread <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Faye</a>'s ashes. Like with <a href="/wiki/Sindri" title="Sindri">Sindri</a>, Kratos was often blunt and unfriendly with Brok, even dismissing Brok's claim that Brok had made the <a href="/wiki/Leviathan_Axe" title="Leviathan Axe">Leviathan Axe</a> along with his brother, only believing him when Brok showed solid proof. Brok's unusual manners and foul tongue both amused and bemused Atreus, whilst Kratos often found his chatter annoying. Nevertheless, he acknowledged Brok's skill as a smith and his knowledge of the realm gateways, allowing him to work on his gear and the Axe, often used the Gateways when travelling around <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a> and requested Brok's help on making a key by Mimir's counsel. Despite finding both the <a href="/wiki/Huldra" title="Huldra">Huldra</a> brothers annoying, Kratos was more tolerant of Brok than Sindri, as Brok's more blunt and straightforward demeanor suited Kratos more than Sindri's more chatty, overly-friendly and germaphobic behavior, which Kratos was often irritated by. Furthermore, Kratos openly showed respect to Brok when he offered to help him on his dangerous journey to <a href="/wiki/Helheim" title="Helheim">Helheim</a>, as Kratos politely refused the offer, telling Brok that his smithing work had aided them more than enough already. Kratos never showed offense to Brok's foul language, even when it was directed at him, as Kratos quickly realized that it was said out of crude habit rather than genuine intention to offend him. 
</p><p>Three years later, Kratos' relationship with Brok had improved, calling him by his name and accepting his invitation to stay at their home in the <a href="/wiki/Between_the_Realms" title="Between the Realms">Realm between Realms</a>, despite showing reluctance at leaving his home in Midgard. In his journal, Kratos noted that despite Brok's foul tongue and ill-manners, there was wisdom in his words, and that he found him 'acceptable company.' This was shown when Kratos allowed Brok to accompany him as an ally in battle more than once, and openly chose Brok over Sindri when going to <a href="/wiki/Svartalfheim" title="Svartalfheim">Svartelheim</a> to make the <a href="/wiki/Draupnir_Spear" title="Draupnir Spear">Draupnir Spear</a>, which was Brok's idea, stating that Brok spoke plainly and was therefore more trustworthy. When Brok was shocked and angered over the realisation that he had an incomplete soul and Sindri had lied to him about his death, Kratos comforted Brok, using Brok's own advice regarding form and nature to reassure him that he was a good person and a great blacksmith whose blessing was no less valuable than <a href="/wiki/The_Lady_of_the_Forge" title="The Lady of the Forge">The Lady</a>'s, showing how much he valued Brok's wisdom and desire to help others as well as his skill. After Brok's death at the hands of Odin, Kratos was deeply saddened, taking time away from the war effort with Atreus to grieve Brok, and it was ultimately what drove him to lead the Realms against <a href="/wiki/Asgard" title="Asgard">Asgard</a>. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Sindri" title="Sindri">Sindri</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f3/Sindri-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180319211604" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Sindri-GOW18" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Sindri-GOW18.jpg" data-image-key="Sindri-GOW18.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f3/Sindri-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180319211604"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f3/Sindri-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180319211604" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Sindri-GOW18" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f3/Sindri-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180319211604" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Sindri-GOW18.jpg" data-image-key="Sindri-GOW18.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/f/f3/Sindri-GOW18.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180319211604"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and Sindri</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos met Sindri while on his quest to spread Faye's ashes. As with others, Kratos was often blunt and demanding with Sindri, refusing to put up with his germaphobic demeanor. However, he acknowledged Sindri's talents and allowed him to upgrade the Leviathan Axe. After having saved Sindri from a <a href="/wiki/Dragons" title="Dragons">dragon</a>, he refused to outright admit to Sindri that he wanted to save him, insisting that the dragon was only in their way. Like Atreus, he would be annoyed at Sindri's habit of constantly badmouthing and complaining about Brok. Despite this, he refused to go so far as to confront Sindri about this, as he disagreed with how Atreus spoke to Sindri in regards to this. Kratos would also agree to visit certain <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar_Shrines" title="Jötnar Shrines">shrines</a> and <a href="/wiki/Frozen_Caverns" title="Frozen Caverns">dungeons</a> as favors for Sindri, though usually if there was some reward in it for Kratos and Atreus.
</p><p>Three years later, his relationship with Sindri had improved. While angered upon learning that Sindri had been helping Atreus behind his back, Kratos admits in his journal that he was nevertheless grateful someone had been there to help Atreus, so he holds back his frustration at Sindri for the most part. After Atreus had attacked Sindri when he'd lost control and turned into a bear, Kratos would ask Sindri if his injuries hurt, demonstrating how Kratos had become considerate of Sindri's well-being. In the wake of <a href="/wiki/Brok" title="Brok">Brok</a>'s death, Kratos empathized with Sindri's grief, telling Atreus to leave Sindri alone and let him mourn as he wished. When Atreus questioned whether Atreus and Kratos were Sindri's family as well, Kratos assured him that they were, proving that Kratos had come to genuinely see Sindri as a true friend. At Brok's funeral, Kratos affectionately placed his hand on Sindri's shoulder and tried to talk to him, remaining calm when Sindri reacted angrily to him. 
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Magni" title="Magni">Magni</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20230109145736" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg" data-image-key="Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230109145736"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20230109145736" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230109145736" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg" data-image-key="Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/a/ab/Dh3OmaYWsAAum2b.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20230109145736"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos brutally killing Magni</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos would encounter the sons of <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a> (including Magni) during Faye's last request and like many before him, was not impressed by them, calling them fools. Unlike Atreus, who felt bad for them for having a terrible father, Kratos didn't feel such sympathy, believing that since they are no longer children, they have no excuse. However, once he and his son Atreus fought them near <a href="/wiki/Thamur%27s_Chisel" title="Thamur's Chisel">Thamur's chisel</a>, he took the fight seriously. During the ensuing battle between Magni and his brother <a href="/wiki/Modi" title="Modi">Modi</a>, Kratos overpowers and kills him, forcing Modi to run away in fear. Despite this, Magni sees Kratos as a worthy opponent and “challenge”. In his Journal, Kratos noted that Magni was strong, but extremely arrogant. 
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Modi" title="Modi">Modi</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Scret67yfhvmb.png/revision/latest?cb=20240102072015" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Scret67yfhvmb" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="99" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Scret67yfhvmb.png" data-image-key="Scret67yfhvmb.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Scret67yfhvmb.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240102072015"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Scret67yfhvmb.png/revision/latest?cb=20240102072015" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Scret67yfhvmb" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Scret67yfhvmb.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240102072015" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="99" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Scret67yfhvmb.png" data-image-key="Scret67yfhvmb.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/be/Scret67yfhvmb.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240102072015"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Modi attacks Kratos</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos held Modi in low regard, disliking him for his cowardice, the insults he made about Faye, and worse; playing a hand in the return of the sickness of Atreus in <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr%27s_Temple" title="Týr's Temple">Tyr's temple</a>. Seeing his son in danger made Kratos give into his rage and he easily overpowered Modi; he would have harmed Modi further had he not been more worried about his son instead. When he encountered Modi again in <a href="/wiki/The_Mountain" title="The Mountain">Midgard's mountain</a>, he felt some pity for him since he was badly wounded by his own father and tried to convince Atreus not to kill him, as he was no longer a threat. When Atreus killed Modi, Kratos was shocked and horrified, warning him that there are consequences to killing a God. True enough, Thor would come to seek revenge for the deaths of his sons. As the two Gods battled, Kratos would call him out for his terrible parenting which lead to their deaths, especially Modi, which insulted Thor. 
</p><p>When facing <a href="/wiki/Valhalla" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a>'s trials, Kratos encountered and defeated an illusion of Modi, albeit more powerful than he had been in real life. Kratos was initially confused as to why his memory of Modi was weighed heavily enough on his mind that he would be summoned as an opponent in Valhalla. However, after battling Valhalla's version of Magni, Kratos realized that, due to being more knowledgeable about the Aesir family, he had developed a new perspective on Thor's sons. Kratos felt that, due to their cruel upbringing and harsh treatment under <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a>, Thor and <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a>,  they never had a proper chance to become decent people, realizing that had he raised Atreus in the way that he himself was raised in <a href="/wiki/Sparta" title="Sparta">Sparta</a>, Atreus would have grown up to be no better than Thor's sons. By fighting Modi in a fair 1-on-1 duel in Valhalla, Kratos understood that he was giving him an honor in death that he never received in life.  
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180701084234" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus.jpg" data-image-key="Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180701084234"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180701084234" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180701084234" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Mimir with Kratos and Atreus.jpg" data-image-key="Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/b/bc/Mimir_with_Kratos_and_Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20180701084234"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos and Mimir meet at a mountain</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos met Mimir at the top of a mountain while the former ambassador is imprisoned on a tree by <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a>. In Mimir's request, Kratos cut off Mimir's head and bring it to <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a> to reanimate him. Kratos always called Mimir "head". Throughout both games, Mimir and Kratos start to develop a friendship. Mimir often recited stories of the Nine <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Realms</a>, the <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Giants</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Aesir</a>, and liked to make jokes as well as give Kratos advice when he felt that Kratos wasn't handling his relationship with <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a> optimally. Whilst Atreus greatly appreciated Mimir's presence, Kratos was often annoyed by Mimir's excessive chatter and angered when Mimir tried to advise him with regards to parenting, though he trusted and valued his knowledge on the Nine Realms and on rare occasions, bantered with him in his own blunt way.  
</p><p>Over the next three years however, Kratos' relationship with Mimir drastically improved, as he starts to call Mimir by his name, and calls him 'Brother' multiple times, trusting his advice both on the realms and his relationship with Atreus, only ever showing anger towards him when he learnt that Mimir enslaved aa giant sea creature many years ago in order to impress <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a>. Kratos openly shares his thoughts and tales of his past with Mimir, and more frequently exchanges jokes with him, even chuckling on occasion. In Valhalla, Kratos noted in his journal that with Atreus starting his own journey and Freya being occupied, he valued his friendship with Mimir more than ever, and wished that he had met Mimir years ago shortly after his rampage through Greece, where he had wandered the lands alone, riddled with hate and misery, believing that Mimir's presence would have helped him greatly.  
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Capture_d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran_2022-11-21_%C3%A0_22.42.59.png/revision/latest?cb=20221121230752" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Capture d’écran 2022-11-21 à 22.42.59" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="95" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Capture d’écran 2022-11-21 à 22.42.59.png" data-image-key="Capture_d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran_2022-11-21_%C3%A0_22.42.59.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Capture_d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran_2022-11-21_%C3%A0_22.42.59.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221121230752"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Capture_d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran_2022-11-21_%C3%A0_22.42.59.png/revision/latest?cb=20221121230752" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Capture d’écran 2022-11-21 à 22.42.59" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Capture_d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran_2022-11-21_%C3%A0_22.42.59.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221121230752" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="95" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Capture d’écran 2022-11-21 à 22.42.59.png" data-image-key="Capture_d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran_2022-11-21_%C3%A0_22.42.59.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/e/e0/Capture_d%E2%80%99%C3%A9cran_2022-11-21_%C3%A0_22.42.59.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221121230752"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">A tense encounter between Odin and Kratos</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos knew little about Odin during Faye's life, as he seldom listened to Faye's stories about the Gods, only knowing that Odin was the king of the <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Aesir</a>. Due to his previous experiences with the Olympians, especially <a href="/wiki/Zeus" title="Zeus">Zeus</a>, Kratos likely viewed Odin with contempt before he learned much about him. Through <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a>'s guidance, he would learn about the atrocities that Odin committed on the Nine Realms, notably how he drove the <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tnar" title="Jötnar">Giants</a> into near extinction, his marriage to Freya, his unquenchable thirst for knowledge and his manipulative, deceitful nature. These stories, along with his encounters with <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a> and Thor's sons, reinforced Kratos' contemptuous thoughts on Odin, viewing him as a cruel, manipulative, paranoid God who cared nothing about the suffering of others. During his journey to fulfil Faye's last wish, he believed that Odin had sent his kin to hunt him due to his past life as the "<b>Ghost of Sparta</b>". Upon realizing that Faye was a Giant and she had foreseen their entire journey to spread her ashes, he realized much later that Odin was actually trying to track her all along to find a way into <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tunheim" title="Jötunheim">Jötunheim</a>, unaware that she was already dead. 
</p><p>After completing Faye's request, he tasked Atreus with repairing the protective stave across their home as he knew that Odin would seek revenge on him and Atreus for killing three of his kin, this view reinforced by him glimpsing a <a href="/wiki/Loki_Prophecy" class="mw-redirect" title="Loki Prophecy">mural image</a> in Jötunheim that had prophesized his death. Odin eventually managed to track him down and met the Ghost of Sparta face-to-face along with <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>. Despite three of his kin being killed by Kratos, Odin claimed that he actually wanted peace with Kratos and attempted to strike a deal, in that he would not attack Kratos and his son, in return, Atreus would stop looking for <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a> and Kratos would spill no more Aesir blood. Odin was willing to allow Kratos to keep Mimir and settle his score with Freya in order to convince Kratos to accept.   
</p><p>Kratos knew from Mimir's counsel that Odin was not to be trusted, and the fact that he was willing to harm Freya only further strengthened his refusal, as he still cared about Freya and had no intention of allying himself with the one who caused her so much pain. Despite wanting nothing to do with Odin, Kratos initially had no intention of fighting him, knowing all too well the consequences of war with the gods, fearing that it would lead to the same decimation and slaughter that he had caused in his quest to kill Zeus.  However, things would worsen when he realized that Odin invited Atreus to Asgard, an invite that Atreus later accepted. Kratos was no stranger when it came to the Gods using other people, he also witnessed first hand what happens to people who fell for Odin's lies, knowing that it would lead to his son's death or, even worse, Odin would manipulate Atreus into doing unspeakable acts to further his goals, turn him against his own father, and then dispose of him when he was no longer needed. This pushed Kratos towards opposing Odin, and when Odin encountered Kratos in <a href="/wiki/Svartalfheim" title="Svartalfheim">Svartelheim</a> and again claimed to desire peace between them, Kratos coldly rebuffed him, even threatening him with war if he didn't return his son to him. This pushed Odin into reminding Kratos of his destructive past, claiming that he was still nothing more than a uncaring monster and that Atreus would never want to rejoin him as a result, in an attempt to place doubt into Kratos' mind.  
</p><p>Later on, when Odin killed <a href="/wiki/Brok" title="Brok">Brok</a>, this was the last straw for Kratos and he agreed with Freya to unleash <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a> and start the war of <a href="/wiki/Asgard" title="Asgard">Asgard</a>. Although he did unleash war on Asgard, he made it clear he only did it because Odin forced his hand and was unwilling to make the finishing blow to Odin, instead trusting it to Freya. Like the others, he was content to keeping Odin's soul trapped in the <a href="/wiki/Marbles" title="Marbles">marble</a> but when SIndri came to destroy it, Kratos was the only one whose face was expressionless, showing that even he knew Odin had it coming. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Thr%C3%BAd" title="Thrúd">Thrúd</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4b/Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221109114326" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg" data-image-key="Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4b/Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221109114326"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4b/Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221109114326" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4b/Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221109114326" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg" data-image-key="Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/4/4b/Thrud-Stares-at-Atreus.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221109114326"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Thrud seeing Kratos' son, Atreus/Loki</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos only met Thrúd during Ragnarök after Atreus convinced her to side with him in stopping Odin. He soon learned of her friendship with his son and trusted her because Atreus did. Later after fighting and defeating Thor, he convinced the latter to stand down and be a better person for his daughter’s sake. He was also impressed by her combat skills, enough for him to recommend her to <a href="/wiki/Sigr%C3%BAn" title="Sigrún">Sigrún</a> as a potential recruit for the <a href="/wiki/Valkyries" title="Valkyries">Valkyries</a>. 
</p>
<p><a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a></p><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1b/FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20221225164944" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="FkVktklXkAQhzOE" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg" data-image-key="FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1b/FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221225164944"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1b/FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20221225164944" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="FkVktklXkAQhzOE" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1b/FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221225164944" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg" data-image-key="FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/1b/FkVktklXkAQhzOE.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221225164944"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The legendary battle of Kratos and Thor</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos was only vaguely aware of Thor before Faye's death, recognizing him as the "<b>God of Thunder</b>" when seeing his statue. Through <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a>, he would learn about Thor's drunken, violent nature and the atrocities that he committed, particularly against the giants of <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B6tunheim" title="Jötunheim">Jötunheim</a> and how he nearly wiped them from existence. Through this, as well as meeting <a href="/wiki/Magni" title="Magni">Magni</a> and <a href="/wiki/Modi" title="Modi">Modi</a>, and learning from a spirit that his mother was killed by the God of Thunder during a drunken rage, Kratos developed a low opinion of Thor, believing him to be a destructive, remorseless brute and a terrible father, using the spirit's story as a lesson to his son that it was a nature of a <a href="/wiki/God" class="mw-redirect" title="God">God</a> to cause harm to others. Regardless, he didn't underestimate Thor either, as he warned his son not to take the Gods lightly after they successfully destroy a statue of Thor, showing that he saw Thor as a formidable opponent. 
</p><p>Eventually, they would meet face-to-face during <a href="/wiki/Fimbulwinter" title="Fimbulwinter">Fimbulwinter</a>, with Kratos recognizing him with the huge thunderstorm and the legendary <a href="/wiki/Mj%C3%B6lnir" title="Mjölnir">Mjölnir</a> being dead giveaways. Even though Thor stated all he wanted was to talk with Kratos and have a drink with him, Kratos was unwilling to let him enter his home due to his wariness of how dangerous he was, and although he allowed Thor to enter, he kept his guard up, barely taking his eyes off of him until <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a> arrived. Tension was in the air as it was obvious that Thor wanted revenge on Kratos for the deaths of <a href="/wiki/Baldur" title="Baldur">Baldur</a>, Magni, and Modi. It was only when Odin gave him permission did he unleash his fury on Kratos and vowed to take a piece of Kratos for all the pain he caused to his family. 
</p><p>Although Kratos fought back, he intially tried to reason with Thor stating that he didn't seek that fight with his brother or his sons. Thor scoffed at this, and demanded that Kratos show him the strength and rage he was so infamous for, having looked forward to this battle for a long time. This gave Thor a mental edge against Kratos during the fight, and along with his sheer strength and tenacity, he became one of the few to actually succeed in killing him. Thor, however, wanting to see the monster inside Kratos, refused to end the battle that way and instantly revived him. When reasoning failed, Kratos became more aggressive, blaming Thor for Modi's death, as the only reason they found Modi in <a href="/wiki/Midgard" title="Midgard">Midgard</a> in such a weakened state was due to the beating Thor had given him. Thor was angered by this, and continued his fight with Kratos; having him on the ropes and, after breaking his shield and grabbing him in a chokehold, had Kratos in an extremely vulnerable position. Thor took this chance to threaten <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a>, a remark that made Kratos lose control of his anger, breaking free and delivering a fearsome punch that staggered Thor and knocked out a tooth, but satisfied him, stating that his blood debt was paid as he had gotten a taste of Kratos' true power. After the fight, Kratos took Thor as a serious threat, noting that his blows were as heavy as anything he'd ever felt, that Thor fought like a warrior who lusted for battle rather than outwardly causing pain, and he was glad that their fight ended prematurely. 
</p><p>As Kratos continued his travels, he eventually started to develop empathy for Thor as he learnt that Thor had received a brutal upbringing from Odin, a deliberate attempt on Odin's part to mold Thor into a merciless killer that didn't think for himself or question anything that Odin ordered. Atreus made it clear that Thor really did love his family and regretted what he had done to Magni and Modi, having promised to quit drinking after their deaths and being more protective of his remaining child <a href="/wiki/Thr%C3%BAd" title="Thrúd">Thrúd</a>, who turned out to be a decent person that befriended Atreus. Kratos recognized that he and Thor had led similar lives, both powerful warriors with destructive pasts and tragic losses, used and abused by evil <a href="/wiki/Gods" title="Gods">Gods</a> for their own ends, the key difference being that Kratos eventually broke free of his father's hold, whereas Thor remained stuck under Odin's. Eventually, when Kratos unleashed <a href="/wiki/Ragnar%C3%B6k" title="Ragnarök">Ragnarök</a> and waged war on <a href="/wiki/Asgard" title="Asgard">Asgard</a>, they engaged in one last battle. This time, Kratos had learned from their previous fight and used every weapon and skill at his disposal to overwhelm Thor as he proved to be the better warrior, only holding back enough to avoid dealing the final killing blow, controlling his inner rage. Throughout the fight, Kratos tried to reason with Thor, believing that they didn't have to fight and that Odin didn't care about him or his family, and eventually spared him as he managed to get through to Thor, telling him that they must be better for the sake of their children. As a result, when Odin appeared and furiously berated Thor for standing down against Kratos, Thor cast his hammer aside and openly refused Odin's order. Unfortunately, it also lead to his death, with Odin killing him. When <a href="/wiki/L%C3%BAnda" title="Lúnda">Lúnda</a> mentioned that she planned to tell everyone that he took down Thor, Kratos sadly stated that that was not what happened,  showing that he felt saddened that Thor had died before he had a chance for redemption.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/30/Real_tyr.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240211030230" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Real tyr" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Real tyr.jpg" data-image-key="Real_tyr.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/30/Real_tyr.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240211030230"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/30/Real_tyr.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240211030230" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Real tyr" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/30/Real_tyr.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240211030230" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Real tyr.jpg" data-image-key="Real_tyr.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/30/Real_tyr.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240211030230"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos, Freya finally meets the real Týr</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos knew nothing about the Norse "<b>God of War</b>", mainly because <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a> made it his mission to make sure no one knew about him after imprisoning him, laying waste to his temple and everything he stood for, and convincing everyone that he was dead. He learned more about Týr while traveling through his <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr%27s_Temple" title="Týr's Temple">temple</a> and also through his good friend <a href="/wiki/Mimir" title="Mimir">Mimir</a>, developing a measure of respect for his counterpart, as Týr was a God who encouraged peace and sharing wisdom, only resorting to war when it was necessary, something that Kratos very much attested to after learning from the mistakes he made during his life in <a href="/wiki/Greek_World" title="Greek World">Greece</a>. He approved of Mimir using Týr as an example to Atreus to use his godhood to help others, althoughhe showed guilt and regret when exploring his vault, knowing deep down that Týr, a God that Atreus looked up to, was a far better and wiser God of War than he ever was, as he was consumed by rage and hate during his time on the throne. When meeting Týr in the land of the <a href="/wiki/Dwarves" title="Dwarves">dwarves</a>, Kratos was not impressed and believed he would not be as useful as Atreus hoped, though he expressed pity for his condition and respect for his desire to avoid war. However, his anger and distrust for Týr would increase for his continued uselessness and for playing a hand in Atreus going to <a href="/wiki/Asgard" title="Asgard">Asgard</a>, eventually ignoring his advice entirely when he learnt that Heimdall intended to kill Atreus. After freeing the real Týr in <a href="/wiki/Niflheim" title="Niflheim">Niflheim</a>, Kratos had little to say, Odin's deception of Týr still etched in his mind, as well as the fact that he and <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a> had much work to do in restoring the realms and the real Týr needed time to process everything that had happened in his absence. 
</p><p>After meeting Týr again in <a href="/wiki/Valhalla" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a> and realising that he had sent the invitation, Kratos was confused as to what Týr's intentions were, skeptical when Týr claimed that he intended to help Kratos overcome his mental struggles. This skepticism soon vanished after Týr challenged him to a friendly fight, and proceeded to put him through several Valhalla gauntlets, each one ending with an increasingly tougher fight between the two of them, all the while delving into Kratos' past and helping him accept the mistakes he made in Greece rather than push them away the back of his mind, which eventually gave Kratos enough courage to accept Freya's proposal and become the new God of War in the <a href="/wiki/Nine_Realms" title="Nine Realms">Nine Realms</a>. In his journal, Kratos praised Týr not only for his formidable skill in battle but also his wisdom and insight into his mental struggles, fully understanding why he was so beloved during his time as the Norse "<b>God of War</b>".  
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Sif" title="Sif">Sif</a>
</p><p>Sif, the wife of <a href="/wiki/Thor" title="Thor">Thor</a>, primarily interacts with <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a> rather than Kratos. Her character is focused upon her perspectives through her family interactions and her influence over her children, <a href="/wiki/Thr%C3%BAd" title="Thrúd">Thrúd</a>. While Kratos and Sif do not have direct interactions, her presence and actions impact the broader story, especially in relation to Thor and and the <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Aesirs</a>, which indirectly affects Kratos' journey. However, Kratos would later encounter Thrúd and cross paths with her while mourning Thor's death.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Speki_%26_Svanna" title="Speki &amp; Svanna">Speki</a> &amp; <a href="/wiki/Speki_%26_Svanna" title="Speki &amp; Svanna">Svanna</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5d/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221117150733" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Surviving Fimbulwinter 3" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Surviving Fimbulwinter 3.jpg" data-image-key="Surviving_Fimbulwinter_3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5d/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150733"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5d/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221117150733" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Surviving Fimbulwinter 3" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5d/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150733" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Surviving Fimbulwinter 3.jpg" data-image-key="Surviving_Fimbulwinter_3.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/5/5d/Surviving_Fimbulwinter_3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221117150733"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Atreus close to Kratos' pet</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Speki and Svanna are the two wolves that pull Kratos and Atreus’ sled. They had previously been captives of a Raider camp before Kratos and Atreus freed them, and against Kratos' wishes, Atreus named them. They assist in traveling across the cold climate, providing not only transportation but also a sense of companionship and reliability. While Kratos valued their usefulness, he seldom showed affection to them, unlike Atreus, who often comforted and chatted with them. When Kratos and Freya set out to find the Norns, Freya scolded Kratos' brusque demeanor towards them, highlighting that their fear of traversing the Frozen Lake was due to the Kol-Raiders, who frequently ate wolves and were likely the ones who had previously captured them. After clearing out the raider camps, Kratos realized that this fear extended towards him due to his behaviour, and showed them affection for the first time, petting them whilst awkwardly mixing up their genders. In his journal, Kratos noted that he now felt a desire to bring them comfort as well as protect them. 
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Fenrir" title="Fenrir">Fenrir</a>
</p><p>Fenrir is the oldest and the original leader of the three wolves alongside <a href="/wiki/Speki_%26_Svanna" title="Speki &amp; Svanna">Speki and Svanna</a>. He is also sick yet beloved pet of Atreus as well. Kratos’ relationship with the wolf is limited, but Atreus shares a compassionate interactions with Fenrir, and also sees him more as a member of the family. With the news of his death, Kratos allows Atreus to bury him.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Freyr" title="Freyr">Freyr</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0f/Freyr_and_mimir.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231223010148" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Freyr and mimir" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Freyr and mimir.jpg" data-image-key="Freyr_and_mimir.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0f/Freyr_and_mimir.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231223010148"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0f/Freyr_and_mimir.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231223010148" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Freyr and mimir" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0f/Freyr_and_mimir.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231223010148" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Freyr and mimir.jpg" data-image-key="Freyr_and_mimir.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/0f/Freyr_and_mimir.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231223010148"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Meeting with each other from Freyr</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos' first encounter with Freyr was a tense one, as Freyr believed that Kratos was working for Odin, only standing down when Freya intervened. After breaking Freya's curse, Freyr accepted Kratos as an ally, despite admittingly not knowing much about Kratos at all.  In his journal, Kratos seemed befuddled by Freyr, noting that his 'roguish' and laid-back demeanor was unimpressive and didn't resemble any great leaders or diplomats that he had known in Greece, and wondered how Freyr had managed to create temporary peace between the Elves and had formed a resistance group consisting of races who would usually never cooperate with each other. Despite this, Kratos recognized his efforts in the <a href="/wiki/Aesir-Vanir_War" title="Aesir-Vanir War">Vanir-Aesir</a> conflict and accepted him as an ally in their resistance against <a href="/wiki/Odin" title="Odin">Odin</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Aesir</a> gods. Whilst the two rarely speak to each other, there is a mutual respect between the two warriors. Freyr’s primary concern is to protect other people and most importantly — his sister. Kratos' relationship with Freyr also aligns with his goals of opposing Odin's tyranny.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/L%C3%BAnda" title="Lúnda">Lúnda</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7d/Lunda_profile.png/revision/latest?cb=20240213013324" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Lunda profile" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="183" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Lunda profile.png" data-image-key="Lunda_profile.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7d/Lunda_profile.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240213013324"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7d/Lunda_profile.png/revision/latest?cb=20240213013324" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Lunda profile" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7d/Lunda_profile.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240213013324" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="183" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Lunda profile.png" data-image-key="Lunda_profile.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/7/7d/Lunda_profile.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20240213013324"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">A close-up shot of Lunda, another ally for purchases</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Lunda is a skilled dwarven blacksmith who offers her services to Kratos and Atreus. She provides critical support in the form of upgraded weapons and armor. Kratos respects Lunda for her craftsmanship and dedication, but finds her overly friendly mannerisms strange, and often catches her staring flirtatiously at him. Lunda starts to notice his discomfort, and eventually offers to apologize for her comments on his appearance, but Kratos replies that it isn't necessary, and that she can carry on if she desires, which amuses her.  
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Durlin" title="Durlin">Durlin</a>
</p><p>When Kratos and <a href="/wiki/Atreus" title="Atreus">Atreus</a> encounter him, Durlin is initially cautious and reluctant to get involved. However, after hearing Faye's death, he tells a little bit about his secret and pasts. As it turns put, he was also a former rebel leader, who, alongside <a href="/wiki/Laufey" title="Laufey">Laufey</a>, led a failed coup against the <a href="/wiki/Aesir" title="Aesir">Aesir</a>. Durlin's relationship with Atreus also shines when  he secretly gives him directions to the <a href="/wiki/Jarnsmida_Pitmines" title="Jarnsmida Pitmines">Jarnsmida Pitmines</a> to find <a href="/wiki/T%C3%BDr" title="Týr">Týr</a>.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Ratatoskr" title="Ratatoskr">Ratatoskr</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/33/Ratatsokr_%26_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221123151953" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Ratatsokr &amp; Kratos" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="90" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Ratatsokr &amp; Kratos.jpg" data-image-key="Ratatsokr_%26_Kratos.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/33/Ratatsokr_%26_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221123151953"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/33/Ratatsokr_%26_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20221123151953" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Ratatsokr &amp; Kratos" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/33/Ratatsokr_%26_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221123151953" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="90" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Ratatsokr &amp; Kratos.jpg" data-image-key="Ratatsokr_%26_Kratos.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/3/33/Ratatsokr_%26_Kratos.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221123151953"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Comedic contact at Kratos' shoulders</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Ratatoskr, the enigmatic squirrel who manages the <a href="/wiki/Yggdrasil" title="Yggdrasil">World Tree Yggdrasil</a>, serves as an advisor to Kratos. Although their interactions are infrequent, Ratatoskr provides some guidance and lore about <a href="/wiki/N%C3%AD%C3%B0h%C3%B6gg" title="Níðhögg">Níðhöggs</a> that aids Kratos in his quest. The relationship is more advisory than personal, with Kratos sometimes being comfortable to listen on Ratatoskr’s wisdom as he navigate the Nine realms.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Heimdall" title="Heimdall">Heimdall</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6b/Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png/revision/latest?cb=20221114223035" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png" data-image-key="Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6b/Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221114223035"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6b/Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png/revision/latest?cb=20221114223035" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6b/Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221114223035" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png" data-image-key="Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/6/6b/Heimdall-Odin-Atreus-Tho.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20221114223035"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Secret confrontation while Heimdall is listening to Odin before meeting Kratos</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Kratos knew little about Heimdall, only first hearing about him when Mimir bitterly referenced him after meeting Durlin, revealing that he was likely the one who had burned the humiliating mark in Durlin's head as a way to remind him of their failed rebellion. When the Norns revealed that Heimdall intended to kill Atreus and that they knew Kratos would kill him and subsequently trigger Ragnarok, Kratos became fixated on killing Heimdall, despite knowing that this could fulfil the very outcome he hoped to avoid - a war with Asgard and his eventual death. He ignored Mimir's warnings on Heimdall's foresight abilities making his death near-impossible, but did agree to ask the Huldra Brothers for their advice on how to beat him. With Brok, Kratos built the <a href="/wiki/Draupnir_Spear" title="Draupnir Spear">Draupnir Spear</a>, a weapon designed to counter Heimdall's foresight by overwhelming his senses via its ability to detonate and generate limitless copies of itself.  Kratos maintained that he only sought to protect his son with Draupnir, and had no intention of starting a war with Odin unless Atreus' safety was under threat. After Atreus returned from Asgard, Kratos abandoned his desire to kill Heimdall, as Atreus was now safe and by his side again.  
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/07/Heimdall_facing_Draupnir.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250403103044" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Heimdall facing Draupnir" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Heimdall facing Draupnir.jpg" data-image-key="Heimdall_facing_Draupnir.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/07/Heimdall_facing_Draupnir.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250403103044"><div style="position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%;"><div class="gallery-icon-container view-image"><div class="icon-container view-image" aria-label="view image"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em"><defs><path id="IconImagesSmall__a" d="M11 15h-.586L3 7.586V7h8v8zm-8 0v-4.586L7.586 15H3zm9-10a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 01-1 1H2a1 1 0 01-1-1V6a1 1 0 011-1h10zm4-4a1 1 0 011 1v10a1 1 0 11-2 0V3H6a1 1 0 110-2h10z"></path></defs><use xlink:href="#IconImagesSmall__a" fill-rule="evenodd"></use></svg></div></div></div></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/07/Heimdall_facing_Draupnir.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250403103044" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Heimdall facing Draupnir" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/07/Heimdall_facing_Draupnir.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250403103044" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Heimdall facing Draupnir.jpg" data-image-key="Heimdall_facing_Draupnir.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/0/07/Heimdall_facing_Draupnir.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250403103044"></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kratos having won his fight and has to put down Heimdall</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Fate, however, had other plans and when Kratos and his son Atreus went to aid <a href="/wiki/Freya" title="Freya">Freya</a> in <a href="/wiki/Vanaheim" title="Vanaheim">Vanaheim</a>, he encountered Heimdall. As Freya went ahead to aid her brother, Kratos and Heimdall dueled, with Heimdall frequently taunting and insulting Kratos, avoiding every attack thanks to his foresight. However, by using his skills and Draupnir, Kratos managed to land a solid blow on Heimdall, which shocked the arrogant God, who couldn't even remember the last time anyone had done such a thing, and subsequently became more aggressive and easier to hit. Kratos eventually overpowered Heimdall and impaled him against a wall, but refused to kill him. Heimdall was shamed by Kratos' pity, and, upon realizing he was being this way because of his son, he vowed to kill Atreus to spite Kratos. Kratos blew up his arm as payback and told him he was on his last warning. Heimdall, however, refused to walk away and conjured a new arm to continue the fight with Kratos to get revenge for humiliating him. Heimdall then attacked Kratos with everything he had, repeatedly vowing to kill his son whilst continuing to taunt and insult him. Kratos feared that killing Heimdall would prove the Norns right, that deep down he hadn't changed and he was no different to the god-killing monster that he once was in Greece, but Heimdall's repeated threats and taunts eventually caused him to snap. When Heimdall threw dirt in his eyes, Kratos furiously dropped him with a vicious attack, then repeatedly smashed his head into the ground and strangled him to death, killing him in a matter of seconds. Once Kratos's rage subsided, he felt horror at what he had done, fearing that his burst of anger and feeling of satisfaction at killing Heimdall had proven the Norns right and that there was now no way of avoiding Ragnarök. In his journal, Kratos described Heimdall as a cruel, pompous bully.  
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Angrboda" title="Angrboda">Angrboda</a>
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/12/Angrboda-god-of-war-44771326-2048-1152.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231224064004" class="mw-file-description image" style="display: inline-block; position: relative;"><img alt="Angrboda-god-of-war-44771326-2048-1152" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Angrboda-god-of-war-44771326-2048-1152.jpg" data-image-key="Angrboda-god-of-war-44771326-2048-1152.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/godofwar/images/1/12/Angrboda-god-of-war-44771326-2048-1152.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20231224064004"><div style="position: absolute;
